loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip O. is a family man, 34 years old, who is married with four children.

Philip has an entrepreneurial business of videos while at the same time selling foodstuffs which he started in 2006.

Initially, Philip was employed working in the health sector but had to quit and move to his business which has been generating more income than he used to earn while employed.

Philip wants to expand his business by increasing his stock and would like to obtain a loan of Ksh 30,000 to be able to do this.

Philip’s future plan is to venture into cloth sales and dairy farming, something he believes will guarantee his children a better education and a successful life for his entire family.

loans.use: To increase his business stock

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Unidos Por El Progreso 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Pilar is the coordinator of her group, Unidos Por El Progreso (United for Progress), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural area, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple, rented structure with her longterm partner and their three children.

Pilar is excited to be taking her seventh loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her ambulatory business selling clothing by purchasing blue jeans, blouses and shoes in the capital at the main market and then selling them in her community at a profit.

Pilar will use the profits to invest in her children by purchasing clothes and school supplies for them. Her long term goal is to purchase her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy blouses, blue jeans and shoes

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es:
Jacqueline se dedica a  comercializar ropa de niño, su esposo trabaja en el interior, es militar, con rango de Sargento. Sus fuentes de ingreso derivan de estas dos actividades, así cubren la manutención de su familia, tienen 2  hijos con las edades de 9 y 4 años. Viven en casa de sus padres Zona Litoral de la  ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará a la compra de mercadería (ropa de niños) para su posterior comercialización.
 
Es su segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite solicitar otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Jacqueline sells children clothing; her husband, who is a sargeant in the military, is stationed in the country's interior. Their family's income derives from these two activities; this is how they support their family, which is made up of two children, who are 9 and 4 years old. They live in their parents' house, which is in the Litoral zone of the city of El Alto. The funds will be used to buy children's clothing to sell. This is her second loan with Impro; her good behavior with her previous loan qualifies her for another one.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy children's clothing.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William M. Masinde is farmer who plants and sells maize.  He started his business in 2005.

Before this, he sold poultry but had to quit because the market was not good and his income was too low. 

He is 50 years old and married with six children.  His future plans are to educate his children and begin dairy farming. To expand his business and work towards his goals he is requesting a loan of 25000 KES.

loans.use: To buy more seed to expand maize farming

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar se dedica a  ser taxista en la comunidad de Pucarani, su esposa es agricultora y productora de leche de vaca para su comercialización con la Planta industrializadota de leche Pil; esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la mantención de su familia, tienen 5  hijos con las edades de 2, 7, 5, 12 y 15 años. Viven en Pucarani Provincia Los Andes ( a dos horas de la ciudad de El Alto).
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de maquinaria para cortar alfa y cebada, productos que también comercializa.
 
Es segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite solicitar otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Edgar is a taxi driver in the Pucarani community. His wife is a farmer, and she produces milk to sell to Pil, the milk industrial plant. This activity is their main source of income, which he uses to support the family. They have five children; 2, 7, 5, 12, and 14 years old. They live in Pucarani in the Los Andes province (two hours from the city of El Alto). The loan is to buy machines to cut alfalfa and barley, which are products that they also sell. This is his second loan with Impo. His good payment behavior allows him to ask for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a machine to cut alfalfa and barley, which are products he and his wife sell

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer O. is a 56-year-old businesswoman who lives in Kwirare Busia District. Since 2006 she has had a business selling fish and groceries. She buys her stock once a week in the nearby Miyanga market but sometimes travels as far away as Malaba for stock.

She is married and a mother of three children. She plans to use her loan of 20000 KES to expand her business by increasing her stock of fish and groceries.

loans.use: To increase her stock

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia se dedica a  comercializar ropa en la comunidad de Caranavi, zona tropical de  los Yungas, a cinco horas de la ciudad de La Paz; su esposo es transportista Inter provincial; así consiguen sus ingresos con los que cubren la manutención de su familia, tienen 2  hijos con las edades de 7 y 4 años  .Viven en alquiler en Ciudad Satélite de la  ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de más ropa para continuar su negocio.
 
Es su primer crédito con Impro y el análisis socio-económico le permite acceder a dicho préstamo.
texts.en:
Lucia sells clothing in the town of Caranavi which is located in the tropical area of Los yungas. It's five hours from the city of La Paz. Her husband is an inter-state truck driver. This is how they earn a living to maintain their family. They have two children ages seven and four and live in a rented place in the Ciudad Satelite neighborhood of El Alto. The loan is meant for the purchase of clothing to keep her business going. Her first loan with Impro, and a socio-economic analysis, allow her access to this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing at wholesale to sell in  the communiy of Caranavi, 5 hours from La Paz.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice E. started her business selling cereal in 1998 after quitting subsistence farming that was not generating any income.

She buys her stock three times a week and then sells it at the nearby Miyanga market. She lives with her family of seven children and her husband in Mikisirimi in Busia District.

Her future plan is to buy a piece of land where she will be able to live and do some farming, expanding her business and boosting her income.

She is requesting a loan of 15000 KES.

loans.use: to increase her stock by buying more cereals

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.es:
Gumercinda  se dedica a  ser Artesana; confecciona ropa deportiva para colegios y cuenta con su propio taller de costura, es su principal fuente de ingreso con la que cubre la manutención de su familia; no tiene esposo, tiene 1  hijo con la edad de 15 años. Tiene su domicilio en Alto la Portada de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de materia prima (tela).
 
Es su tercer crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite solicitar otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Gumercinda is an artisan; she manufactures sports clothing for school and has her own sewing workshop; this is her main source of income with which she supports her family. She doesn't have a husband but does have a 15-year-old son. She lives in the Alto la Portada section of the city of El Alto. She will use the funds to buy raw materials (fabric). This is her third loan with Impro; her good repayment history allows her to request another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Jocelyne

texts.fr: A. Jocelyne est née le 22 Mai 1965 à Abomey, ville historique du Bénin. Mais Jocelyne réside depuis environs 30 ans au quartier Cadjehoun à Cotonou, capitale économique du Benin. Jocelyne est mariée à AZAGNANDJI Raymond, un entrepreneur, et est mère de quatre enfants.  Tous les enfants de Jocelyne sont scolarisés.  Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille.  Jocelyne a été à l’école jusqu'au secondaire.  Jocelyne vend d’huile à moteur et des tissus qu’elle s’approvisionne à Nigeria, Etat voisin du Bénin. Jocelyne mène cette activité depuis sa naissance. Jocelyne a déjà obtenu des crédits à ALIDé – ces crédits ont été bien remboursés.  Jocelyne sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé pour renforcer son activité et acheter plus d’huile à moteur.
texts.en:
Jocelyne A. was born on the 22nd of May, 1965, in Abomey, an historic town in Benin. However, Jocelyne has lived in the Cadjehoun quarter of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for the past thirty years. Jocelyne is married to Raymond Azagnandji, an entrepreneur, and has four chlidren. All of Jocelyne´s children attend school, and the couple work together to meet their family´s needs. Jocelyne attended school up to secondary level. She makes a living by selling engine oil and fabric that she sources from Nigeria, Benin´s neighbour. Jocelyne has been involved in this business pratically since birth. She has already received two loans from ALIDé which have both been repaid. Jocelyne is seeking another loan from ALIDé in order to bolster her business and buy more engine oil.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more engine oil

loans.name: Paola

texts.es:
Paola, vive en  la zona Estrellas de Belén, de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive en casa de sus padres, junto a su esposo y su pequeño hijo de un año.
 
Trabaja como ayudante juntamente con Enrique su esposo como obreros en una fábrica elaboradora de muebles de exportación.
 
El crédito lo destinará a la compra de materiales de construcción, ya que su señor padre les proporcionó un espacio en su vivienda en la cual podrán realizar las reparaciones y construcción de una habitación donde podrán vivir con un poco mas de comodidad junto a su pequeña familia.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgar el crédito.
texts.en:
Paolo lives in the Estrellas de Belén section of the city of El Alto. She lives in her parents' house with her husband and one-year-old son. She and her husband work as laborers in a factory that makes furniture for export. The funds will be used to buy building materials and supplies because her father provided a space in his house where they can build a room for themselves so that her small family can live a bit more comfortably This is her first loan with Impro; the socio-economic evaluation conducted qualifies her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet M. is a 32-year-old businesswoman who is married with six children living and who operates a business selling maize in Bukirima, Busia District.

Before venturing into her maize business, Linet used to engage herself in subsistence farming but that was not generating any income for her.

Linet buys her stock twice a week from a nearby Miyanga market. She would like to expand her business to be able to achieve her future plan of better education for her children. It is for this reason she would like a loan of Ksh 20,000.

loans.use: To increase her stock of maize

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo vive en  la zona Villa Juliana, de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive en casa propia junto a su esposa y uno a de sus hijas menores la cual se encuentra culminando sus estudios escolares.
 
El señor Lorenzo trabaja como electricista de manera independiente realizando pequeños contratos de instalaciones eléctricas, en domicilios, fabricas y otros,
Su esposa posee una tiendita de abarrotes en su mismo domicilio.

El crédito lo destinará a la compra de  materiales como ser cables, enchufes y otros ya que acaba de recibir un contrato de mediana magnitud. 

Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgar el crédito.
texts.en:
Lorenzo lives in the Villa Juliana section of the city of El Alto. He lives in his own house with his wife and one of his minor daughters, who is finishing her schooling. Lorenzo is an independent electrician; he undetakes small electrical installations in homes, factories, etc. His wife has a small grocery store in their home. The funds will be used to buy supplies like cables, plugs, etc. because he just landed a medium-sized work contract. This is his first loan with Impro; the socio-economic evaluation conducted indicated that he qualifies for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cable, plugs, etc.

loans.name: Samuel Lutomia

texts.en:
Samuel Lutomia M. is a businessman selling second-hand clothes, which he started doing in 2009 after quitting masonry.

He is age 31, married, and a father of two children. He lives in Kwirare and does his business in a nearby market called Miyanga. He buys his stock in Nairobi once a week. Samuel wants to increase his stock in order to get enough income to be able to achieve his future plan of buying a vehicle that he would use to transport his purchased goods. It is for this that he wishes to get a loan worth 10,000 KES.

loans.use: Replenishing his stock

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more products to sell

loans.name: United Women Group

texts.en: Bendu W. has been selling charcoal in the Bioma Coma Yard on Gurley Street for eight years. She is 36 years old, single, and has four children who are 7, 13, 20 and 22 years old. In addition to her children, Bendu also takes care of her siblings. She started her business selling for other people, but now she is on her own. She has a good relationship with her customers which keeps people returning. Bendu is the leader of this group of five borrowers called "United Women". She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more charcoal. Her goal is to grow her business and to be in good health. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Bendu is the one holding the sign. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, this non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal

loans.name: Moulikatou

texts.fr: A. Moulikatou est née le 15 avril 1973 à Parakou, au Nord du Bénin.  Mariée à HOUNTOMDJI Clif, un réparateur de véhicule ou de moto, Moulikatou est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés, dont un est a sa change. Moulikatou vit ensemble avec son enfant et son mari au quartier Agla à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.  Il y a environs six ans que la famille vit dans ce quartier.  Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille.  Moulikatou n'a fait que l’école primaire.  Moulikatou vend de glacières et des ustensiles de cuisine.  C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Moulikatou s’approvisionne.  Moulikatou mène cette activité depuis environs sept ans. Moulikatou a déjà obtenu des crédits à ALIDé.  Ces crédits ont été bien remboursés.  Moulikatou sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé pour renforcer son activité et acheter d'autres ustensiles de cuisine.  Elle voudrait améliorer le niveau de vie de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Moulikatou A. was born on the 15th of April, 1973, in Parakou, in the north of Benin. She is married to Clif Hountomdji, a car and bike mechanic, and has two children of school-age, one of whom is in her care. Moulikatou lives with her child and husband in the Agla quarter of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. The family have lived in this quarter for the past six years. The couple work together to meet their family´s needs. Moulikatou only attended primary school. She now sells coolers and cooking utensils for a living, and sources these materials from the international market of Benin. She has been doing this for the past seven years. Moulikatou has already received loans from ALIDé and these have all been repaid. She is seeking another loan from ALIDé in order to bolster her business and buy more cooking utensils, and her end goal is to improve her children´s standard of living.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of coolers and cooking utensils

loans.name: Elshad

texts.en: Elshad K., 47, sells different kinds of food, such as rice, macaronis, beverages and tea. He  has more then 20 years of experience in this field. He is married and has three sons who help Elshad run his business. He needs an additional 1,600 Azerbaijan New Manat to purchase more products to sell. He promises to repay his loan on time and he appreciates your help very much.

loans.use: Purchase more products to increase his profit

loans.name: Unidas Para Progresar 1,2,3 Group

texts.en:
Maxima is the coordinator of her group, Unidas Para Progresar (United to Progress), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Hato Mayor, an agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and 5 children.

Maxima is excited to be taking out her tenth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business making curtains by purchasing large rolls of cloth and different decorations, such as bows and sequins with which to decorate her curtains. She will use the profits to invest in her family by purchasing school supplies for her children and in her home by refinishing the floor. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Cloth by the roll, decorations

loans.name: Walvine

texts.fr: A. Walvine est née en 1962 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Benin.  Walvine est veuve et a deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Walvine vit ensemble avec ses enfants au quartier Cadjehoun à Cotonou.  Walvine n’a pas fréquenté l’école.  Walvine vend des pagnes et des chaussures.  Elle vend également des ustensiles de cuisine de façon secondaire. Walvine s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et à Lomé au Togo.  Walvine exerce cette activité depuis 8 ans et a déjà eu de crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé.  Walvine sollicite un autre crédit de ALIDé pour renforcer son activité et ambitionne plus tard d'acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Walvine A. was born in 1962 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is a widow with two school-aged children. Walvine lives with her children in the Cadjehoun quarter of Cotonou. She did not attend school, and today she sells fabric and shoes for a living, as well as cooking utensils as a side-line. She sources her goods from Dantokpa, Benin´s international market, and from Lomé in Togo. She has been involved in this business for the past eight years and has already received one loan from ALIDé, which was successfully repaid. Walvine is seeking another loan from ALIDé in order to bolster her business, and her end goal is to buy a plot of land.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fabric and shoes

loans.name: Prisca

texts.fr: B. Prisca est née en 1983 à Cotonou, capitale économique de Bénin. Prisca a vit depuis 22 ans au quartier Cadjehoun à Cotonou.  Mariée à ADJIBOLA Lambile, un tailleur, Prisca est mère de deux enfants.  Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Prisca vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Prisca a été à l’école jusqu’à secondaire.  Pour venir en aide à son mari, Prisca s’est mise à vendre des tenues bébé. Prisca exerce cette activité depuis 7 ans, et s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Prisca a déjà obtenu des crédits à ALIDé.  Ces crédits ont été bien remboursés. Prisca sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé pour libérer soit même les charges financières.
texts.en:
Prisca B. was born in 1983 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. For the past 22 years she has lived in the Cadjehoun quarter of Cotonou. She is married to Lambile Adjibola, a tailor, and has two children, one of whom attends school. She lives with her children and husband, and the couple work together to meet their family´s needs. Prisca attended school until secondary level. She started selling infant clothes in order to help her husband financially. She has been involved in this business activity for the past seven years, and sources her goods from Dantokpa, Benin´s international market. Prisca has already received some loans from ALIDé, which have been repaid. She is seeking another loan from ALIDé in order to help meet her financial obligations.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of infant clothes

loans.name: Sadiq

texts.en:
Sadiq M. is a 37-year-old man who has sold office supplies and toys in Agsu city since 2006. He is married and has two children who are the meaning of his life. He enjoys his life very much and his working day is more that nine hours long.

Sadiq is alone in his business and he would like to increase his income and spend more time with his adorable kids. For this purpose he applied for 1,600 AZN which he will use to purchase more supplies and toys to increase his profit.

Sadiq and his family count on your help.

loans.use: To purchase more office supplies and toys to sell

loans.name: Solange

texts.fr: C. Solange est née le 9 mai 1970 à Cotonou, capitale économique de Bénin.  Mariée à EHOUZOU Marcel, agent à BTP, Solange est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés.  Solange vit ensemble avec ses enfants.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Solange a été à l’école jusqu’au secondaire.  Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Solange vend des pagnes. Solange s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et à Lomé au Togo.  Solange a 15 ans d’expérience dans cette activité.  Elle a déjà obtenu des crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursé.  Solange sollicite un autre crédit de ALIDé pour renforcer son activité et satisfaire des besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Solange C. was born on May 9, 1970, in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She's married to Marcel EHOUZOU, an agent with BTP. She's the mother of two school-attending children, and she lives with them. The couple supports the family together. Solange attended school up to secondary level. In order to provide for herself, she sells pagnes (colorful African cloth). She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, an international marketplace in Benin, as well as in Lomé, Togo. Solange has 15 years of experience in this business. She already benefited from several loans from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, which were repaid without problems. Solange is seeking another loan from ALIDé, in order to bolster her business and satisfy personal needs.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell pagnes (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Agnès

texts.fr: K. Agnès est née en 1960 à Comé, dans le departement du Mono. Agnès est divorcée et vit depuis 3 ans au quartier Zogbo à Cotonou, capitale économique de Bénin.  Agnès vit avec ses deux enfants, tous scolarisés.  Pour faire face à ses besoins, Agnès vend des tissus, par le système de distribution.   Agnès n’a jamais été à l’école. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Agnès s’approvisionne. Agnès exerce cette activité depuis environs 10 ans.  Elle a déjà obtenu des crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés.  Agnès sollicite un autre crédit de ALIDé pour acheter des tissus et éventuellement d’autres marchandises.  Un jour, elle voudrait acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Agnès K. was born in 1960 in Comé, in the Mono region. She is divorced and has been living in the Zogbo quarter of Cotonou, Benin´s economic capital, for the past 3 years. She lives with her two children, both of whom attend school. In order to meet her family´s needs, Agnès sells fabric via a distribution network. She did not attend school herself. She sources her goods from Benin´s international market, and has been involved in this business for the past ten years. She has already received loans from ALIDé, all of which have been repaid. Agnès is seeking another loan from ALIDé in order to purchase more fabric, and eventually other merchandise. One day she would like to buy a plot of land.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fabric

loans.name: Inqilab

texts.en:
Inqilab M. is a 46-year-old entrepreneur who sells cell phones and cell phone accessories in his own store in his home city of Agsu. He is married and has two children.

Inqilab has ten years of experience in his business. He is very friendly with his customers and that’s why he is very successful in his business.

Demand is this business is very high and the range of cell phones is changing every month, so Inqilab tries to bring in the best and newest cell models. Now he applied for 1,600 AZN to bring in new cell phones. He and his family count on your help.

loans.use: To purchase more cell phones

loans.name: Mujeres Solidarias 3 Group

texts.en:
Martina is the coordinator of her group Mujeres Solidarias (Women in Solidarity), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Hato Mayor, an agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure as a single mother with her two children.

Martina is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business and her loan size. She plans to use this loan to invest in her clothing business by purchasing T-shirts, blue jeans and polo shirts in the main market in Santo Domingo and then selling them in her village for a profit.

Martina will use the profits to invest in her home by purchasing a radio, refinishing the floor and fixing the roof. Her long term goal is to buy a plot of land and build a new house. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase T-shirts, blue jeans and polo shirts to sell

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es: Doña Blanca Rosa  tiene la edad de 45 años, muy dedicada a su trabajo por el cual ha salido adelante para apoyar  a su hija y mama. Pues es divorciada desde hace varios años, el cual, ha sido una pena para ella, desde entonces se ha esforzado mas para poder cubrir sus necesidades, tanto alimenticia como hacer las mejoras a su vivienda. Ella trabaja como analista de estadística, desde hace varios años, por gastos diversos no logra hacer de un solo las necesidades de mejoras de su casa, es por eso que a sido de mucho beneficios los prestamos que Afodenic ha otorgado para poder hacer los cambios, con el crédito anterior logro poner cerámica. Y con este comprara zinc, cuartones, clavos y otros para poder cambiar el techo ya que esta muy viejo y se le pasa el agua, su techo es de cielo raso el cual se le a fregado todo por la mala condición del zinc es por eso urge cambiarlo para que no se le maltrate mas su cielo raso, ya que se esfuerza mucho por esta mejoras que junto con la institución ha logrado.
texts.en:
Blanca Rosa, 45, is very dedicated to her work; this has allowed her to provide for her daughter and her mother. She has been divorced for several years, which was a shame. However, she has struggled ever since to be able to meet her needs, both food-wise and with respect to home repair. She has worked for many years as a data analyst. However, due to various unexpected expenses, she has never been able to complete her home improvements all at once. This is why Afodenic's loans have been so useful; her previous loan allowed her to install ceramic tile. This loan will be used to buy zinc metal sheeting, wood beams, nails, etc. in order to replace the roof, which is very old and leaky. Her ceilings have all been rain damaged due to the poor condition of the zinc roofing. It's urgent that she be able to replace it so that her ceiling doesn't become still more damaged because she has struggled mightily, with help from the institution, to make these improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials to repair her roof.

loans.name: Ileana Matilde

texts.es: La joven Ileana tiene la edad de 28 años, lo cual ha logrado ser una joven emprendedora, casada y con dos hijos, su esposo trabaja como jefe del departamento en la supervisión en el supermercado la Unión, pues gracia a el que le ha dado dinero de su salario y con su esfuerzo. Logro poner una pulpería que la hecho crecer en inventario pues vende una variedad de productos, lo cual ha logrado con los financiamiento de Afodenic el cual se ha beneficiado para mejorar en su negocio como su vida personal. Con este préstamo invertirá en granos básicos como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, maíz, jabón, papel higiénico, golosinas, gaseosas, jugos, cereales, lácteos, pollo y carne, como también invertir una parte en ropa para niñas, niños y adultos, cosméticos el cual se vende mucho y queda buena ganancias. Lo que mas desea es poder tener su casa propia ya que vive junto con su mama, lo cual desea tener mejor privacidad y una casa para sus hijos que espera lograr este anhelo como madres.
texts.en:
Ileana, age 28, has become an enterprising young woman. She is married and has two children. Her husband works as head of the department of supervision in the Unión supermarket. She was able to set up a min-market thanks to her husband, who gave her money from his salary, and her effort. She has increased her inventory; she sells a variety of products. She did this with the loan from Afodenic. This has been helpful in improving her business and her personal life. She will use this loan to buy basic items like rice, beans, sugar, oil, corn, soap, toilet paper, sweets, soft drinks, juice, grains, dairy products, chicken, and meat. She will use part to buy clothing for children and adults. She will also buy cosmetics, which she sells a lot and gets good earnings. What she wants most is to be able to have her own house. She now lives with her mother, and she wants to have more privacy. As a mother she also longs to have a house for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy  rice, beans, sugar, oil, corn, soap, toilet paper, sweets, soft drinks, juice, grains, dairy products, chicken, and meat.  She will also buy clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Favor Group

texts.en:
Rachael C. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called Favor. She is 32 years old, single, and has six children –age 5, 7, 11 and 16 years old, and twins who are 4 years old.

For 13 years Rachael has been selling dry fish and pigs feet at the West Point Market. She started selling for her uncle and later by herself. She sells quality goods in a friendly manner which keeps customers returning.

Rachael plans to use her portion of the group loan to buy more dry fish and pigs feet. Her goal is to grow her business and to send her children to school and build them a house.

In the photo Rachael is holding the sign. James W. is in the inset at lower right.

About LEAP

The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more dry fish and pigs feet to sell.

loans.name: George Group

texts.en:
James K. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called George Group. He is 58 years old, married, and has three children who are 14, 24, and 26 years old.

For over 30 years James has had a tailoring business at the Happy Corner Market. His parents gave him his first machine. James says that he always tries to satisfy his customers and his clothes are good quality, which helps his business.

James plans to use his portion of the group loan to buy more clothes to sell. His goal is to have a big personal tailor shop and to help his children in every way possible.

In the photo James is holding the sign. Alice B. is in the inset at lower right.

About LEAP

The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Lawoulath

texts.fr: M. Lawoulath est née le 4 décembre 1972 à Sakété, dans le departement de Plateau au Bénin.  Il y a environs 10 ans que Lawoulath vit au quartier Cadjehoun à Cotonou, capitale économique de Bénin. Lawoulath est mariée à ZOHOUN Marcel, inspecteur à l’OPT (l’office de poste et télécommunications), et est mère de deux enfants.  Tous les enfants de Lawoulath sont scolarisés.  Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille.  Lawoulath n’a fait que l’école primaire.  Pour faire face à ses besoins, Lawoulath vend des produits cosmétiques. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Lawoulath s’approvisionne. Lawoulath exerce cette activité depuis trois ans. Lawoulath a déjà obtenu des crédits à ALIDé.  Ces crédits ont été bien remboursés. Lawoulath sollicite un autre crédit de ALIDé pour acheter des produits cosmétiques pour renforcer ses activités et de mieux répondre à la forte demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Lawoulath M. was born on December 4, 1972, in Sakété, in the Plateau Department, Benin. For approximately 10 years, she's been living in the Cadjehoun neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She's married to Marcel ZOHOUN, an OPT (post and telecommunication office) inspector, and she's the mother of two school-attending children. The couple supports the family together. Lawoulath only attended primary school. To provide for herself, she's been selling cosmetics for three years. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, an international marketplace in Benin. She already benefited from several loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé. These loans were repaid without problems. Lawoulath is seeking another loan from ALIDé in order to buy cosmetics in order to bolster her business and better meet high customer demand.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell cosmetics

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es: Don Luís tiene la edad de 46 años, una hermosa familia de tres hijos, el cual cursan sus estudios, en su trayectoria de vida, logro sacar un curso en mecánica automotriz, que por muchos años ejerció, luego tuvo la iniciativa de poner su propio negocio el cual comienza con dinero de su liquidación y con poco inventario,  el cual vende repuestos usados para vehículos una variedad de productos. Por su conocimiento le es más fácil poder dar un buen servicio al cliente.  A si como también hace trabajos privados en la mecánica aunque es cansado se cobra bien. y se ayuda para poder pagar los gastaos de agua y luz del local. Con este financiamiento desea comprar repuestos usados que no tiene en existencia y de lo que vende más para poder dar cada día  a sus clientes una mejor atención en venta, lo cual es de gran necesidad la compra de rines para carros, stop, tuercas, tornillos, entre otros. Sus planes es lograr cada día la atracción de clientes nuevos.
texts.en:
Don Luís is 46 years old, and has a beautiful family with 3 children who study in school. Over the course of his life, he managed to take a class in automotive mechanics, and he worked in this area for many years. Later he took the initiative to have his own business which he started with his severance pay and a small amount of inventory. He sells a variety of used car parts. Because of his knowledge he is able to give good service to his customers. In addition, he also works privately as a mechanic; this is tiring work but it pays well and helps to pay the water and electricity bills for his premises. With this financing he wants to buy used parts that he does not currently have, so that he can increase his sales and be able to provide better service each day to his customers. For this reason he needs to buy wheels for cars, nuts, stop screws and other parts. His plan is to try to attract new customers every day.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: he will buy used auto parts to restock his auto parts business

loans.name: Conforte

texts.fr: Née le 02 Décembre 1984 au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin, K. Conforte est mariée à SAGBO Joseph, un cuisinier. Conforte est mère de deux enfants, mais a un autre enfant à sa charge. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. La famille s’est installée depuis environs 5 ans à l’Etoile à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Conforte n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Conforte vend des biscuits de façon ambulante. Conforte s’approvisionne à Lomé au Togo, pays limitrophe du Bénin. C’est depuis 4 ans que Conforte mène cette activité. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Conforte a eu quelques difficultés financières lors du remboursement de son crédit passé, à la suite de la brûlure de son enfant qui l’a conduit à des dépenses. Aujourd’hui, Conforte ambitionne agrandir son activité afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et de se faire plus de revenu à la hauteur de ses charges. C’est la raison pour laquelle Conforte sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Conforte K. was born on December 2, 1984, in Nigeria, a country that borders Benin. She's married to Joseph SAGBO, a cook. She's the mother of two children, and has another child to support. Some children attend school. For approximately five years, the family has been living in l'Etoile in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. The couple supports the family together. Conforte never attended school. To provide for herself, she sells biscuits as an ambulant saleswoman. She gets her supplies in Lomé, Togo, a country that border Benin. She's been running this business for four years. She's a previous client of Kiva's partner, ALIDé, who repays her loans without problems. Conforte experienced some financial difficulties when repaying her previous loan: one of her child got burned, a situation which induced expenses. Today, she ambitions to expand her business in order to better satisfy her customers and raise her income to match her expenses. This is why Conforte is seeking another loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of biscuits

loans.name: Orlando Jose

texts.es: Don Orlando tiene la edad de 42 años, padre de familia de dos hijos los cuales cursan la primaria. El señor Orlando tiene nueve años trabajando como cadete de taxi, el cual recorre día a día la capital de Managua, con día bueno y días malos por que abecés los clientes no quieren pagar la carrera por el alto costo pero también la gasolina esta cara. Y viene quedando poco, el taxi es propio el cual adquirió por medio de su liquidación de un trabajo anterior que dio una prima a la cooperativa y con ahorros pago. Las dificultades que tiene es cuando tiene problemas el carro, no tiene con que pagar la reparación al mecánico al momento. Con este préstamo quiere tapizar los asientos del taxi para mejorar la imagen del mismo ya que anda en mal estado y comprar  4 llantas para su mantenimiento de carrera. Con estos financiamientos que Afodenic ha dado ha mejorado el funcionamiento del vehiculo lo cual es de mucha necesidad ya que es su fuente de trabajo. A futuro es poder tener otra unidad para poder tener mejores ingresos, así si tiene malo uno, el otro  sale a trabajar ya que se preocupa cuando se le daña el carro debido a que tiene una gran responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Orlando, 42, has two children, who are in primary school. Orlando has been a taxi driver for 9 years throughout the city of Managua. Some days are good, some not so good, because customers don't want to pay for long trips and gasoline is very expensive. His profits are small. He owns his own taxi, which he bought with some savings and his severance pay from a previous job was used as a premium to the transportation cooperative. His difficulties arise when the vehicle has problems; he doesn't have funds to pay a mechanic. This funding will be used to upholster the taxi's seats so that it will project a more pleasing appearance because it's in a pretty bad state right now. He also needs to buy four new tires. Afodenic's loans have provided for the better functioning of the vehicle and this is very needed because it's his only source of income. In the future, he would like to have a second vehicle so that income would be higher. That way, if one vehicle is out of service, the other one can take up the slack. He always worries when the vehicle can't function because he has a great responsibility.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires and upholster his taxi's seats.

loans.name: Redey Daniel

texts.es:
El Sr. Redey, cuenta con una familia estable que esta compuesta por sus tres hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar y su esposa quien trabaja como empleada del hogar de una familia en la zona donde el vive, El Sr. Redey tiene la actividad económica de servicio de transporte urbano de pasajeros radio taxi que realiza su hermano que es su conductor, El Sr Redey es el dueño del taxi y su hermano trabaja para el ya que el Sr Redey tiene otra acctividad trabaja como chofer en la embajada de Dinamarca, el cliente presta servicios como conductor personal de la Cónsul de Dinamarca en el País .

El cliente, actualmente este es su segundo credito bajo este programa. Con el dinero del credito el comprara una radio de comunicaciones para su radiotaxi y haci poder ofrecer mejor servicio a los clientes.

Esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Redey has a stable family, which is comprised of his three school-age children and his wife. She works as a household employee for a family in the area where they live. Redey provides urban passenger transportation in a radio taxi. He works with his brother, who is his driver. Redey owns the taxi, and his brother works for him. Redy has another job. He works as a driver for the Danish embassy. He provides services as a personal driver for the Danish Consul in the country. This is his second loan under this program. He will use the money from the loan to buy a communications radio for his radio taxi. This way he will be able to offer better service to his customers. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a communications radio

loans.name: Joséphine

texts.fr: B. Joséphine est née en 1965 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Joséphine réside au quartier Gbégamey à Cotonou, depuis sa naissance. Joséphine a un enfant qui n’est pas scolarisé et avec lequel elle vit. Joséphine assure seule les charges de son enfant. Pour y parvenir, Joséphine mène comme activité, la vente du riz à son domicile. Joséphine vend également de la tisane (médicament traditionnel), ce qui lui permet d’avoir plusieurs sources de revenu. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Joséphine achète ses produits. Joséphine mène cette activité depuis 30 ans environs et a déjà bénéficié de crédit auprès de ALIDé. Joséphine est une bonne cliente de ALIDé, qui a bien remboursé son crédit. La clientèle de Joséphine devient de plus en plus nombreuse. Face à cette situation, Joséphine désire renforcer son capital et élargir son activité, mais ne dispose pas suffisamment de moyens financiers pour y parvenir. Voila pourquoi Joséphine sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Joséphine B. was born in 1965 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She lives in the Gbébamey area of Cotonou since birth. Joséphine has one child who does not attend school and with whom she lives. She is sole support for her child. To make ends meet, Joséphine sells rice from her home. She also sells herb tea (traditional medication), which provides her with several sources of income. She buys her products in Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. Joséphine has been running her business for about 30 years and has already been granted credit loans from ALIDé. She is considered a good member of Alidé, who promptly reimburses her loans. Joséphine’s customers are increasing in numbers. To face this situation, she wants to strengthen her business and widen the scope of her activity, but lacks the financial means to do so. Therfore she is requesting another loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Resupply stock with bags of rice, oil, condiments.

loans.name: Malick

texts.fr:
Monsieur Malick T. est un jeune chauffeur de 32 ans qui a exerce ce métier depuis plus de 5 ans. Mais il évolue  aussi dans le domaine de l’aviculture depuis 2004 pour maximiser ses gains et diversifier ses sources de revenu. Il ne dispose pas de son propre taxi  mais il travaille en collaboration d’un propriétaire qui lui cède  par moment son véhicule. Le choix de son métier a été influence par les conseils de son frère chauffeur. Il habite dans le quartier de Ngaparou et est sociétaire de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC Yoff seulement depuis Aout 2009.
Il est marie et père d’un enfant âgé d’un an 3 mois. Ce qui l’intéresse le plus dans son activité c’est l’aspect lucratif car avec la réalisation de profits il parvient à entretenir sa famille et améliorer le cadre de vie avec l’acquisition d’un prêt qui pourra augmenter ses possibilités d’investissement.
Par conséquent il sollicite un prêt de 200 000 frs pour renouveler  ses poussins et renforcer son activité d’aviculture
texts.en:
Malick T. is 32 years old, and has been a taxi driver for the past five years. Since 2004, he has also gotten involved in poultry farming, to maximize earnings and diversify his sources of income. He doesn’t own a vehicle, but works in cooperation with a taxi owner who lets him use it occasionally. His choice of business was influenced by his brother, himself a taxi driver. He lives in the Ngaporou neighborhood and became a member of the Yoff branch of U-IMCEC in August 2009. He is married and father of one child. He is most interested in the lucrative aspects of his activities, since by realizing profits he is able to support his family and improve their living conditions. A loan will increase his investment capabilities, which is why he is requesting a loan for 200,000 Francs, to renew his supply of chicks and bolster his poultry business.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment

loans.name: Rose

texts.fr: Née en 1971 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, K. Rose vit depuis 4 ans au quartier Cadjèhoun à Cotonou. Rose est divorcée de son mari et a à sa charge ses quatre enfants. Tous ses enfants sont scolarisés et vivent donc avec elle à Cadjèhoun. Rose a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au cours secondaire. Pour assurer les différentes charges qui lui reviennent, Rose vend du riz préparé à son domicile. A côté de cette activité, Rose vend des divers (lait, savons, pâtes alimentaires, conserves, etc.), des tissus et également des chaussures, ce qui lui permet d’avoir plusieurs sources de revenu. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Rose fait ses achats. Il y a près de 20 ans que Rose mène cette activité, ce qui lui permet d’assurer ses besoins. Rose a déjà obtenu une fois de crédit à ALIDé, crédit qui a été bien remboursé. Rose voudrait développer son activité pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle se faire plus de revenu que par le passé. Mais n’ayant suffisamment pas de moyens financiers pour y arriver, Rose sollicite l’aide de ALIDé pour renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Born in 1971 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Rose K. has been living for the past four years in the Cadjéhoun area of Cotonou. She is divorced from her husband and provides support for her four children, who are all in school and live with her in Cadjéhoun. Rose attended school up to secondary level. To manage the diverse household expenses, Rose sells rice prepared in her home. Additionally, she sells various products (milk, soap, pasta, canned goods, etc.), fabrics and also shoes, which provides her with several sources of income. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. Rose has been active in this business for about 20 years, and is able to make ends meet. Rose has already been granted one loan by ALIDé, which she promptly reimbursed. She would like to develop her business to increase customer satisfaction, and generate more income than in the past. Without the financial means to accomplish this, she is requesting support from ALIDé to bolster her business.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bags of rice, condiments, and pieces of fabric

loans.name: Ayedegue

texts.fr: AYEDEGUE R. est née en 1968 et vit depuis environs 20 ans à Cadjèhoun à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à EKEMON Théodore, un militaire en retraite, R. est mère de quatre enfants, dont trois sont à sa charge. Certains de ses enfants sont scolarisés. R. vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. R. n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, R. mène comme activité la vente de tubercules d’ignames, de façon ambulante. C’est à Dantokpa, marché internationale du Bénin, que R. s’approvisionne. R. a deux ans d’expérience dans l’exercice de cette activité, mais a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits auprès de ALIDé. R. a bien remboursés les trois crédits qu’elle a obtenus de ALIDé. R. souhaite développer un peu plus son activité pour mieux répondre à la demande de ses clients ; cependant, R. ne dispose pas suffisamment de moyens pour y arriver. C’est ce qui amène R. à solliciter auprès de ALIDé, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
R. AYEDEGUE was born in 1968, and has been living for the past 20 years in the Cadjéhoun area of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Théodore EKEMON, a retired soldier, and is the mother of four children, three of whom are under her care. Some of her children attend school. R. lives together with her husband and children; she has not attended school herself, and the couple shares household expenses. To meet her needs, R. is an itinerant vendor of yams. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. She has two years of experience doing this, and has already been granted three loans by ALIDé, all of which were repaid in full. R. wants to further develop her business to better satisfy her customers, but lacks the financial means to do so. This is why she is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy yams

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en: Mavis is forty – five years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, two of them are currently attending school. She lives with her family in an old family house. Mavis is a trader. She trades cereals such as maize, rice and beans. She buys bags of maize, rice and beans from the farmers in her community and nearby villages. She says food vendors come from the cities to buy from her. She also sells in the local market. She has been in business for over three years. She wants to purchase stock of cereals in bulk so that she can supply to the increasing number of her customers and increase her profit margin. She desires to help her children climb the academic ladder to higher levels.

loans.use: To purchase cereals in bulk

loans.name: Firmine

texts.fr: S. Firmine est née en 1977 à Agonlin au Bénin. Mariée à HOUNYOVI Justin, un imprimeur, Firmine est mère de deux enfants. Aucun des enfants n’est scolarisé. Il y a environs 10 ans que Firmine s’est installée au quartier Djidjè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, où elle y vit avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Firmine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour se prendre en charge et venir en aide à son mari, Firmine vend divers produits (bombons, biscuits, sardine, lait, savons, pâtes alimentaires, papiers hygiéniques, etc.)à son domicile. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Firmine s’approvisionne. Firmine a déjà trois ans d’expérience dans l’exercice de son activité et a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Firmine voudrait améliorer son niveau d’activité afin de mieux répondre à ses clients et de satisfaire les besoins de sa famille. Pour y arriver, Firmine sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
S. Firmine was born in 1977 in Agonlin in Benin. Married to HOUNYOVI Justin, a printer, Firmine is the mother of two children. Neither of the children is in school. About ten years ago Firmine settled in the Djidjè neighborhood of Cotonou, economic capital of Benin, where she lives with her children and husband. The couple pays the family's expenses together. Firmine did not go to school. To support herself and help her husband, Firmine sells diverse products (candy, cookies, sardines, milk, soap, pasta, toilet paper, etc.) from her home. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, international market of Benin. Firmine has three years' experience in this business and has already received three loans from ALIDé, loans which she has fully repaid. Firmine would like to improve her business standards in order to better respond to her customers and satisfy her family's needs. In order to do that, Firmine is seeking a fourth loan through ALIDé.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various products (candy, cookies, sardines, milk, soap, pasta, toilet paper, etc.)

loans.name: Don De Dieu Plus Group

texts.en:
Etina B. is the manager of the Community Bank named “Don de Dieu” which means “God’s Gift” in English. It is composed of 30 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Etina has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 2008. She started her clothing business with capital of $100. She has been with Hope since 2008 progressively. Her business has prospered thanks to accumulated profit and good management. Her business generates a profit of $50 per week.

Etina will use her next loan to buy clothes to sell retail with the goal of increasing her profits.

Etina is 33 years old, married and a mother of two children ages 8 and 17 who are pupils in school. Her ambition is to open a clothing store.

loans.use: To buy clothes to resell retail with the goal of increasing her profit.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Frank

texts.es:
El Sr. Frank vive en la localidad de el torno, es casado, su esposa es la Sra Zulma con la cual tienen un hijo pequeño, el se dedica al servicio de transporte de pasajeros con su mototaxi, la cual es su fuente principal de ingreso, ya que su esposa solo se dedica a cuidar a su hijo; el destino del credito fue para comprar una linea de mototaxi(pertecer a un sindicato tiene un costo elevado muchas veces mas que la moto o que el auto ya que en bolivia hay lineas que tienen mas socios por que muchas personas usan esa linea de tranporte y esto ocaciona que las lineas de tranporte suban sus precios para afiliar asi a mas personas), su deseo es poder comprar su propia casa y un trajajo estable, es una persona  joven trabajadora que esta empezando con la actividad de transporte.

El Sr. Frank esta agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Frank lives in El Torno. He is married to Zulma and they have a young son. He is a mototaxi driver, which is his main source of income because his wife is a stay-at-home mom. The funds were used to buy into a mototaxi route (to belong to a union is very expensive, sometimes costing more than the mototaxi or the auto itself because in Bolivia there are routes that have more members because many customers use that route; this causes the transportation cooperatives to raise their prices to have more people join). His wish is to be able to buy his own home and to have stable work. He is a young, hard-working man who is just starting out in the public transportation business. Frank is grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for placing their trust in him in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy into a mototaxi route.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia is a thirty eight years old woman. She is married with two children who are in school. She is a food vendor. She prepares rice and tomato sauce with fish and sell to her community on one of the principal street of her town. Leticia’s lack of significant business progress is influenced by inadequate working capital.  She is constantly disturbed by price hikes since she is not able to buy food ingredients in bulk. She needs the loan to enable her inject additional capital into the business to scale up production and improve her meal quality.  She would be buying food ingredients like bags of rice, vegetable oil, spices and firewood in bulk. She is expecting to increase her profit to support her family’s finances.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients in bulk.

loans.name: Victoire

texts.fr: A. Victoire est née le 21 Juillet 1968 et est mariée à AKAKPO Félix, un couturier. Le couple a un enfant qui est scolarisé. Il y a environs 6 ans que la famille s’est installée au quartier Agla à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Victoire a fréquenté l’école jusqu’à l’université. Mais depuis 6 ans environs, pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Victoire mène comme activité la vente de boissons en cannettes, de tissus et de divers autres produits (produits de cheveux, produits de toilette, dissolvants, etc.) à son domicile. Victoire s’approvisionne au marché Gbogbanou à Cotonou. Victoire a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. Victoire sollicite un autre crédit afin renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Victoire A. was born July 21, 1968 and is married to Felix Akakpo, a tailor. The couple has a child, who is in school. It's been about 6 years since the family settled in Agla neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. The couple contribute together in covering the family expenses. Victoire has education up to university level. But for about 6 years, Victoire has been running a business selling can drinks, fabrics and various other items (hair extensions, bathing items, solvents, etc.) in her home in order to meet the different expenses. She gets her supplies in Gbogbanou market at Cotonou. Victoire already benefitted from a loan from ALIDe which she repaid. She is requesting another loan in order to strengthen her business and better meet the requests of her clientele.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various products( hair extensions, bathing products, solvents)

loans.name: Moron

texts.es:
Jesús Ambio de 27 años de edad vive en casa de su padre quien se dedica a la agricultura, su madre es fallecida.El vive junto con su hermano quien aporta en los gastos de la casa ellos viven en Caserio Barrio Nuevo – Ocucaje.
El sr. tiene una hija de 6 años de edad la cual no vive con èl pero le pasa mensualmente una pensión de S/. 200 aparte que siempre esta pendiente de los gastos de su niña.
El sr. se dedica al transporte diario de 7.00am hasta las 9.00 pm realizando colectivo de Ica – Ocucaje ida y vuelta este trabajo lo realiza desde hace 5 años trabaja en el carro de su hermana quien  confía mucho en él.
El goza de buenas referencias desea el financiamiento para poder apoyar a su padre en la compra de insumos para la agricultura y tambien para la compra de uniforme y matriculas de su hija.  
Es una persona con bastante ganas de salir adelante cuentan con buenas referencias de parte de los vecinos los cuales manifiestan que es una persona bien responsables.
texts.en:
Jesús Ambio, 27, lives in his father's house; his father is a farmer, his mother is deceased. A brother, who also lives with them, contributes to household expenses, too. They live in Caserio Barrio Nuevo - Ocucaje. He has a 6-year-old daugther who doesn't live with him. However, he pays a 200 sol monthly support for her and he is always conscious of his daughter's expenses. For the last 5 years he has been in public transport. He uses a car that his sister, who trusts him a lot, lends him. He covers the round-trip Ica-Ocucaje route from 7am until 9pm. He has good references and needs funding to help his father to buy farming supplies and also to buy his daughter's school uniform and pay her school enrollment fees. He is a person who has a great desire to succeed in life. His neighbors give him good references and state that he is a very responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farm supplies for his father and to pay for his daughter's school enrollment fee and her school uniform.

loans.name: Bokoli Plus Group

texts.en:
Bokoli Plus is a Community Bank made up of 26 members whose chairwoman is Mado T.. These members are united for the same goal, to grow their businesses by loans received from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC.
Mado started her business in 2002 selling soft drinks. Today, she has a facility where she sells soft drink crates in her area. She is 55 years old, single and has six children between 14 and 36 year old. Three of her children go to school. Currently, Mado is happy to be part of one of Hope’s groups. She has already received eight loans that she paid back correctly and her business has been reinforced through the loan she received. She is planning with the coming loan to purchase 20 crates of soft drinks to resell in order to increase her profit. Her dream is open a soft drink store. She sells in the eastern area of Kinshasa.

loans.use: To purchase 20 crates of soft drinks

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Adinofex Plus Group

texts.en:
Kinguluta M. is the director of the group “Adinofex Plus” made up of 25 members firmly united to receive loans from the MFI (micro-finance institution) HOPE RDC in order to develop their businesses.
Kinguluta has acquired solid experience by selling cell phones and accessories. She has been in the microenterprise world since 2007. She joined The MFI HOPE DRC in January 2008. With the coming loan, she plans to increase her working capital and be able to buy four cell phones. Her ambition is to become a cell phone and accessory provider in her area. Kinguluta is married and a mother of two daughters aged between 11 and 16 years old. Both girls go to school.

loans.use: To purchase four cell phones

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a thirty eight years old woman. She is married with two children who are in school. She is a food vendor. She prepares rice and tomato sauce with fish and sell to her community on one of the principal street of her town. Alice’s lack of significant business progress is influenced by inadequate working capital.  She is constantly disturbed by price hikes since she is not able to buy food ingredients in bulk. She needs the loan to enable her inject additional capital into the business to scale up production and improve her meal quality.  She would be buying food ingredients like bags of rice, vegetable oil, spices and firewood in bulk. She is expecting to increase her profit to support her family’s finances.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients in bulk.

loans.name: Segundo Aristides

texts.es:
Segundo es soltero, tiene 35 años de edad, Vive con sus padres, hermanos y sobrinos. Reside en un Pueblo Joven de Lambayeque ubicado a 15 minutos de Chiclayo.

El es propietario de una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros),que adquirió con sus ahorros cuando trabajaba como albañil de construcción. Tiene 03 años de experiencia brindando servicio de tranporte de carga y pasajeros en su unidad móvil, esta actividad es su único ingreso económico con el cual aporta dinero a su hogar.

Segundo nos cuenta que las lluvias durante estos meses de verano son muy intensas en los caseríos donde el brinda su servicio de movilidad y esto ha afectado su vehículo, el cual requiere reparación urgente por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles para cubrir los gastos de reparación y mantenimiento de su vehículo. 

Su más grande anhelo es comprar otra mototaxi, con la cual pueda incrementar sus ingresos económicos y dar tranquilidad y apoyo a sus padres y familiares.

Segundo es muy querido por sus vecinos y todos dan referencia de su buen comportamiento y responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Segundo, 35, is single. He lives with his parents, his siblings and his nieces and nephews in one of Lambayeque's new towns located 15 minutes from Chiclayo. He owns a mototaxi (three-wheeled vehicle used to transport passengers and cargo) that he got from savings he had from his work as a bricklayer. He has been in the transportation business for three years; this is his only source of income for his household. Segundo tells us that the heavy summer rains these past few months in the settlements where he works have damaged the roads and thus his vehicle needs urgent repair and servicing. He has called upon Edpyme Alternativa requesting a 1200 new sol loan to cover these repair costs. His greatest wish is to buy another mototaxi so that his earnings will increase thereby providing his parents and family peace of mind. Segundo is well-liked by his neighbors and they all attest to his good behavior and responsibility.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repair and service costs.

loans.name: Blessing Plus Group

texts.en:
Mfuti R. is a leader of a Community bank named “Blessing Plus”, which is composed of 34 micro entrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Mfuti is 38 years old, married and a father of six children between the ages of 3 and 13. Four of the children go to school. He sells pairs of shoes. He has been in business since 1999 and has already received six loans from Hope that he repaid correctly. He has acquired solid experience and his business has prospered thanks to good management and accumulated profits. He intends, with the next loan, to purchase 20 pairs of shoes to increase his inventory. Currently, he earns a profit of $30 every week. His dream is to open a general boutique in his area.

loans.use: To purchase 20 pairs of shoes

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en:
Magdalene is twenty-five old. She is married with one kid. Magdalene lives with her family in a rented apartment.  

Magdalene is a hair dresser. She does both plaiting and perming. She graduated from the apprenticeship training five years ago and she is training two apprentices in hair dressing. She has her saloon on one of the principal street of her town and business is mostly brisk on weekends when most women style their hair for many occasions.  Magdalene is requesting for a loan to enable buy assorted hair creams, weavons, shampoo, etc to improve her services to her customers. She hopes to increase her income to enable her save more to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase assorted hair creams and weavons.

loans.name: Akoua Rosaline

texts.fr: Z. Akoua Rosaline est née le 10 Octobre 1969 et vit depuis une vingtaine d’année à Xwlacodji à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C’est une veuve et mère de cinq enfants, dont quatre sont encore à sa charge. Tous les enfants de Rosaline sont scolarisés. Rosaline vit seule avec ses enfants et supporte seule leurs charges respectives. Rosaline n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis 21 ans, Rosaline mène comme activité la vente de nourriture (poissons et viande frits accompagné d’akassa fait à base de maïs). A côté de cela, Rosaline vend également des produits de toilette et du savon dans son quartier. Rosaline s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Rosaline est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé ayant déjà obtenu quatre crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a eu à bien rembourser. Rosaline ambitionne développer davantage son activité et agrandir surtout sa seconde activité de vente de produits de beauté. C’est pour y parvenir et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle que Rosaline sollicite un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Z. Akoua Rosaline was born on October 10, 1969 and has been living for some twenty years in Xwlacodji in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. She is a widow and the mother of 5 children, of whom four are still dependent on her for support. All Rosaline's children are enrolled in school. She lives alone with her children and is the sole breadwinner for the family.

Rosaline did not go to school. For 21 years, she has been selling cooked food: fried fish and meat with "akassa" (a local dish) made of cornmeal. Besides this business, she also sells toiletries and soap in her neighborhood. She gets her goods at Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin.

Rosaline is a long-time client of ALIDé, having already received four loans from ALIDé, which she reimbursed correctly. She would like to expand her little businesses, especially her sales of cosmetics. It is in order to arrive at that goal and better satisfy her clientele that Rosaline is asking for a fifth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fish, meat, maize, and toiletries

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is fifty – two years old. He is married and the father of six children. Three of them are currently pursuing education at the junior and senior high school levels. The other three have graduated and now independent. John is the major bread winner of his family. He has very good knowledge in herbal medicines and so he prepares and sells to his customers herbs and mixtures of herbs that treat various ailments like stroke, jaundice, malaria, typhoid etc. John has a license from the food and drug board to operate.  His service to his community is well known since he has treated a number of sicknesses for many people. John is requesting for a loan to enable him inject additional working capital into his business to scale up to serve more people. He is expecting to increase his profits also to support his children in school.

loans.use: To buy herbal ingredients in bulk.

loans.name: Irène

texts.fr: Née en 1962, A. Irène est une veuve ayant cinq enfants tous scolarisés, dont deux seulement sont à sa charge. Irène vit avec ses enfants au quartier Xwlacodji à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Seule Irène supporte les différentes charges de la famille. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Irène mène comme activité la vente de divers produits (conserves, savons, liqueurs, petits pois, lait, mayonnaise, divers produits de beauté, huile d’arachide, etc.) dans sa boutique size au quartier Xwlacodji. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Irène s’approvisionne. Irène mène cette activité depuis une dizaine d’année et a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Irène ambitionne élargir davantage sa boutique et augmenter le niveau de son activité pour mieux faire face à la nombreuse demande de sa clientèle et se faire plus de revenu à la hauteur de ses charges. C’est la raison pour laquelle Irène sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1962, A. Irène is a widow with 5 children, all enrolled in school, of whom only two are still dependent on her for support. Irène lives with her children in the Xwlacodji neighborhood of Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. Irène is the sole breadwinner for the family.

To support herself and her children, Irène sells various items (tinned goods, soaps, liqueurs, peas, milk, mayonnaise, various cosmetics, peanut oil, etc.) in her little shop located in the Xwlacodji neighborhood. She gets her merchandise at Dantokpa, international market of Bénin. She has been in this business for about 10 years and has already received and correct reimbursed three loans from ALIDé. Her ambition is to enlarge her little shop and boost her business to cater for the demand of her clientele and earn enough income to pay her family's expenses. This is the reason why Irène is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various products (peas, pasta, tinned goods, etc.)

loans.name: Clémence

texts.fr: T. Clémence est née en 1979 à Houègbo dans le département de l’Atlantique au Bénin. Clémence est mariée à ANGO Nicaise, un employé à la Société Béninoise de Brasserie au Bénin, et est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés. Clémence vit depuis une dizaine d’année au quartier Enagnon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, avec sa famille. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Clémence a très peu fréquenté et a appris ensuite la coiffure. C’est cette activité que Clémence exerce depuis 15 ans, pour faire face à ses différents besoins. A côté de cette activité, Clémence vend également divers produits de coiffure et également des tissus dans son atelier situé au quartier Enagnon. Clémence est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a bénéficié antérieurement de trois crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a tous bien remboursés.  Cependant, Clémence a rencontré de difficultés financières depuis qu’elle a été victime d’un accident à son troisième crédit. Clémence voudrait rehausser le niveau de son activité pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et se faire plus de revenu. C’est ce qui a amené Clémence à solliciter un quatrième prêt auprès de ALDé.
texts.en:
T. Clémence was born in 1979 in Houègbo in Atlantique province in Bénin. Clémence is married to ANGO Nicaise, an employee at the Benin Brewing Company in Bénin, and is the mother of two children, both enrolled in school. She has been living with her family for some 10 years in the Enagnon district of Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. The couple both participate in supporting the family.

Clémence was not enrolled in school for long and later learned hairdressing. This is the business she has been in for 15 years, in order to earn a living. Besides this business, she also sells various hairdressing products and lengths of cloth in her beauty shop, located in the Enagnon district. Clémence is a long-time client of ALIDé and has previously received three loans from ALIDé, all correctly reimbursed. However, she has encountered financial difficulties since she had an accident during her third loan period. She would like to boost her business to better satisfy her clientele and earn more money. This is what brings her to request a fourth loan from ALDé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of hairdressing products (hair extensions, pomades, hair oil, etc.) and lengths of cloth to sell

loans.name: Léa

texts.fr: T. Léa est née en 1953 et vit depuis 40 ans au quartier Xwlacodji à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à AMOUSSOU Joseph, Léa est mère de deux enfants. En plus de ses deux enfants, Léa a deux autres enfants à sa charge. Léa n’a pas fréquenté l’école, mais certains de ses enfants sont scolarisés. La famille vit ensemble à Xwlacodji. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Pour assurer les différentes charges qui lui incombent, Léa a une boutique size dans son quartier, où elle vend divers produits (produits de toilette et de beauté, liqueurs, etc.). Léa mène comme activité secondaire la vente de tissus, ce qui lui permet d’avoir plusieurs sources de revenu. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Léa s’approvisionne. Il y a près de 30 ans que Léa mène cette activité. Léa a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. La clientèle de Léa s’accroit de jour en jour, et Léa n’arrive plus à satisfaire toutes leurs demandes compte tenu du peu de moyens financiers dont elle dispose. Afin d’augmenter son niveau d’activité et de mieux faire face aux besoins de sa clientèle, Léa sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
T. Léa was born in 1953 and has been living for 40 years in the Xwlacodji district in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. Married to AMOUSSOU Joseph, Léa is the mother of two children. Besides these two children, Léa is responsible for two other children.

Léa did not attend school, but certain of her children attend school. The family live together in Xwlacodji. The couple are jointly responsible for supporting the family.
