To earn her living, Léa has a little shop located in her district, where she sells various products (toiletries, cosmetics, liqueurs, etc.) As a secondary business, she sells cloth, which allows her to have several income sources. She gets her merchandise at Dantokpa, international market of Bénin.

Léa has been in this business for almost 30 years. She has already received and correctly reimbursed two loans from ALIDé. Her clientele is growing by leaps and bounds and Léa is not able to satisfy demand, in view of the meager financial means at her disposal. In order to bolster her little businesses and better satisfy the needs of her customers, Léa is requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of toiletries and cosmetics and liqueurs

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha A. is married and has four children. She has received junior high school education. Martha sells frozen fish at Elmina, which she has been doing for some time now. Her husband is a fitter (mechanic). Martha uses her income to support the husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to be frozen for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to help her husband complete their family house.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more fish to be frozen for resale.

loans.name: Juliette

texts.fr: M. Juliette est née le 3 février 1970 à Azové au Bénin.  Juliette vit depuis 8 ans au quartier Vodjè à Cotonou, capitale économique de Bénin.  Juliette est mariée à AGONDJIHOSSOU Clément, un chauffeur, et est mère de quatre enfants. Juliette n’a jamais été à l’école mais tous les enfants de Juliette sont scolarisés.  Juliette vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Juliette est une couturière. Mais à côté de cela, et pour faire face à ses besoins, Juliette vend des sacs, des chaussures et des tissus, par le système de distribution. Juliette s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et à Lomé au Togo.  Juliette exerce cette activité depuis 8 ans et a déjà eu de crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé.  Juliette sollicite un autre crédit de ALIDé pour renforcer son commerce et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Juliette ambitionne plus tard acquérir une parcelle.
texts.en:
Juliette M. was born on February 3, 1970, in Azové in Benin. For eight years, she's been living in the Vodjè neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Juliette is married to Clément AGONDJIHOSSOU, a driver, and she's the mother of four children. She never went to school, but all her children attend school. She lives with her children and her husband. The couple supports the family expenses together. Juliette is a seamstress, but she also sells handbags, shoes, and fabrics, by the distribution system. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, an international marketplace in Benin, as well as in Lomé, Togo. Juliette has been running this business for eight years, and already benefited from one loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé. The loan was repaid without problems. She's seeking another loan from ALIDé in order to bolster her business and better satisfy her customers. She ambitions to acquire a parcel in the future.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics, shoes and handbags

loans.name: Anta

texts.fr: Anta N. est une femme de 37 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc villageois depuis 2 ans et a 4 fois de suite été bénéficiaire de prêt. Elle développe un petit commerce de chaussures, de pâte d'arachide, de jus naturel et de friperie. Son objectif est de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Anta N., 37, is married and the mother of 4 children. She has been a member of her Village Bank for two years and has received 4 consecutive loans. She is working at expanding a little business selling shoes, peanut butter, natural juice, and used clothing. Her goal is to help improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: adding to her working capital

loans.name: Segundo Hermógenes

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 47 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 16 y 15 años en el distrito de Pucalá, ubicado a cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace dos años se dedica a la apicultura. El nos cuenta que viene criando abejas en terrenos cercanos al complejo arqueológico Huaca Rajada (Complejo donde fué encontrado el Señor de Sipán) y vende la miel que recolecta en un pequeño complejo comercial cercano al museo de sitio.

La iniciativa del negocio surgió gracias a una oportunidad de capacitación que diera el fondo Italo – Peruano a los pobladores de la zona para que empezaran a ganarse el sustento haciendo actividades de producción, como por ejemplo apicultura, elaboración de artesanía, trabajos en madera, etc.

Segundo desea ampliar su negocio con la instalación de nuevas colmenas, pero para ello necesita de láminas de cera natural con las cuales pueda facilitar el trabajo a las abejas, así como de un insumo para evitar que las hormigas ataquen las colmenas. El no cuenta con el capital suficiente para comprar lo que necesita por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para ver convertidos a sus hijos en profesionales de éxito. Esta es la tercera vez que trabaja con nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus pagos. En la fotografía nos muestra las láminas y las placas que necesita rellenar para lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Segundo, 47, is married and lives with his wife and two children, 16 and 15 years old, in Pucalá district, which is 40 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. He has been a beekeeper for the past two years. He tells us that he has been raising bees on lands near the Huaca Rajada arqueological complex (where The Lord of Sipán was found) and he sells the honey in a small commercial complex near the site's museum. He started this business thanks to training opportunities provided by the Italo-Peruano Fund to residents of the area so that they could earn their living in productive activities, like beekeeping, crafts-making, woodworking, etc. Segundo wants to increase his production by installing new hives. To do so, however, he needs natural wax panels that will facilitate the bees' work as well as a certain substance that will prevent ants from attacking the hives. He does not have sufficient funds to do so; therefore, he has called upon Edpyme Alternativa requesting a 1500 new sol loan. His greatest wish is to continue working in order to see his children become professionals. This is his third collaboration with our Institution and he has shown himself to be a punctual and responsible client with respect to repayments. In the photo, he shows the panels and plates that he needs to fill in order to reach his objective.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy natural wax panels for his bee hives.

loans.name: Emilienne

texts.fr: A. Emilienne est née en 1981 à Ouidah, ville historique du Bénin. Mais Emilienne vit a Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis 15 ans.  Mariée à AREMOU Céfou, un chauffeur, Emilienne est mère de deux enfants, dont un est scolarisé. Emilienne n’a fait que l’école primaire et a appris ensuite la coiffure.  Emilienne vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari à Cotonou et le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Depuis près de 4 ans, Emilienne exerce ce métier de coiffure et parallèlement à cette activité, Emilienne vend des produits de beauté et de coiffure à la devanture de sa maison.  Emilienne s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin.  Emilienne a obtenu une fois déjà de crédit à ALIDé, crédit qui a été bien remboursé. Emilienne sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé pour renforcer son activité et acheter plus de produits de beauté. Dans l'avenir, Emilienne envisage acheter sa propre parcelle.
texts.en:
A. Emilienne was born in 1981 in Ouidah, a historic town in Bénin. However, she has been living in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin, for 15 years. Married to AREMOU Céfou, a driver, Emilienne is the mother of two children, of whom one is enrolled in school.

Emilienne only attended primary school and then learned hairdressing. She lives with her husband and children in Cotonou, and she and her husband share in providing for the family. For almost four years, Emilienne has been working at hairdressing, and at the same time, she has been selling cosmetics and hairdressing products outside her house. She gets her products at Dantokpa, international market of Bénin.

Emilienne has already received and correctly reimbursed one loan from ALIDé. She is requesting another loan to bolster her business and buy more cosmetics. In future, Emilienne plans to buy her own plot of land.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of hairdressing products and cosmetics

loans.name: Jose Ricardo

texts.es:
José C., es un gran admirador de la tierra en que nació Huila departamento colombiano que  en sus diferentes pisos térmicos, exhibe hermosos paisajes, volcán nevado, montañas y ríos que forman saltos, caprichosas formas  de cueva y hasta la expresión cálida en un desierto. 
El es casado y tiene 3 hijos y toda la vida ha sido un gran emprendedor que acompañado de su esposa, hace 25 años, ha logrado alcanzar muchos logros, desde que iniciò su negocio de alimentos fritos, de manera incipiente, adquiriendo en su crecimiento gran experiencia empresarial, que lo llevaron a dirigir microempresas de mayor tamaño hasta conseguir lo que hoy tiene una vivienda adecuada y separada de dos locales comerciales que utiliza para vender víveres, bebidas, y especialmente refrescos que acompañados con la música convocan a las familias a pasar momentos muy  agradables en la terraza de su tienda. Previo montaje de este negocio distribuía  mercancía al pormayor en el centro de Barranquilla a pequeños comerciantes y ganó mucha clientela y muy buenos empleados, 3 de los cuales continúan trabajando con él, porque reconocen que es un buen líder y observaron su capacidad de pasar de tener un estadero alquilado a uno que hoy es de su propiedad.    
José ha recibido 4 créditos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y por su buen manejo ha logrado incrementar su capital de trabajo y sostener dignamente a su familia, con la que sueña verla progresando y anhela que su último hijo alcance el sueño de ser profesional; vive en un barrio sano y su tienda está ubicada en un sitio comercial, estratégico, es conocida por muchas personas en Soledad y en Barranquilla, a todos les encanta por el concepto de diversión sana y familiar en la que lo ha enmarcado; con este propósito está solicitando un crédito de temporada por valor de $2.000.000 para invertir en refrescos y alimentos de consumo que comercializará en las verbena que realizará en la terraza de su negocio, en la época   carnavalera que se avecina;  fiesta por la que ya preguntan sus vecinos pues favorece la unidad familiar y fortalecen la amistad y la protección entre vecinos.
texts.en:
José C. is a great admirer of the land of his birth, the Colombian department of Huila. This place is known for its varying climates among the different elevations, the beautiful landscapes, a snow-capped volcano, mountains, rivers that form various tributaries, whimsical cave formations, and expressed warmth of its desert.

José is married, has three children, and has been a great entrepreneur all of his life. For 25 years, he and his wife have racked up many accomplishments. He started a basic business selling fried foods. As he gained more business experience, he began managing larger micro-enterprises. Today he has adequate housing and two business locations where he sells food, beverages and especially soft-drinks that accompany the music that invites families to have a good time on the terrace of his establishment. Prior to establishing his restaurant, he distributed merchandise in bulk to small businesses located in central Barranquilla where he acquired many customers and very good employees, three of whom continue to work for him. José’s workers recognize him as a fine leader and have noticed his ability to take his business from a rented area to a location that he owns.

José has received four previous loans from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. His excellent money management has helped him increase his operating capital and sustain a decent lifestyle for his family. He dreams of continuing his progress and hopes that his youngest child will achieve the goal of becoming a professional. José lives in a safe neighborhood and his establishment is located at a strategic commercial site that is well-known among the residents of Barranquilla and Soledad. Everyone likes the idea of having a safe place where families can come to have fun. For this reason, José is requesting a seasonal loan in the amount of 2,000,000 COP to buy soft drinks and food for the events that he will host on the terrace of his business. As Carnival season approaches, his neighbors are asking when his parties will take place because his business is known for promoting family unity, strong friendships, and safe ties among the residents.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food & soft drinks to sell at parties

loans.name: Fatma Thioub

texts.fr: Fatma Thioub D. est âgée de 58 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 9 enfants; Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 2 ans et a eu 4 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit. Elle fait de l'aviculture, de l'embouche ovine et la vente de gaz butane. Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge de sa famille et d'augmenter son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Fatma Thioub D., 58, is married and the mother of 9 children. She has been a member of her Village Bank for two years and has received four consecutive loans. She raises poultry and sheep and sells butane gas. Her goal is to participate in supporting her family and to add to her savings.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: add to her working capital

loans.name: Aracelys María

texts.es:
Desde hace 21 anos, Aracelys María R. M. de 44 años, se dedica al oficio de la  confección, ella es la autentica mujer cabeza de familia que siempre ha participado en actividades productivas, reproductivas, educativas, domesticas y comunitarias, para lograr que sus 5 hijos tengan un mejor futuro. En el barrio Bellavista de Malambo, municipio ubicado en el área metropolitana de Barranquilla, todos la conocen porque tiene este negocio que inicio, cuando le llevaban la tela, tomaba medidas, diseñaba y elaboraba la ropa de acuerdo a lo solicitado y que fue creciendo tanto, que empezó a fabricar por tallas y a comercializar en las poblaciones del Departamento del Atlántico. Ella ha pasado por muchas dificultades familiares, pero siempre se ha sobrepuesto y le han servido para mejorar; así Fuè cuando se separo de su esposo y se mudo sola a Medellín, ciudad de Colombia reconocida por sus pasarelas de elegancia, glamour y sensibilidad de modistos y diseñadores colombianos e internacionales; allì fuè donde perfeccionó su arte, pues trabajo desde su negocio para diseñadores de ferias internacionales realizadas en esa ciudad, y pudo, mediante un crédito del estado, reiniciar su negocio e intentar regresar por sus hijos a Malambo, decisiòn que no concreto porque fue favorecida por subsidios del programa de Familias en Acción del estado y por eso  hace 6 anos, se estableciò en esta población para desde allí apoyar los estudios de sus hijos sin interrumpirlos. 

Aracelys ingresó a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el programa de grupos solidarios en el año 1995 y recibió 5 créditos antes de que algunas compañeras del grupo empezaran a trabajar en empresas, ella misma cambiara de ciudad y este grupo se desintegrara;  cuando ella regresò de Medellín, encontró nuevamente el apoyo de la Fundación, adquirió una fileteadora y comenzó a trabajar para terceros. Durante 2 años cosía a una mayorista de ropa en la modalidad de maquila; ahora lo hace para una cadena de almacenes que le ha suministrado la máquina de 2 agujas, pero debe pagar un arriendo por piezas y la exclusividad de su trabajo, actividad en la que no gana mucho dinero. Esta es la razón por la que solicita un crédito de $2.300.000 que invertirá en la compra de una máquina industrial, a fin de confeccionar en tela pesada, como la de los jeans y poder tener la suya propia con lo ahorrado por concepto de arriendo. 

Aracelys María, sueña con adquirir su propia marca, tener una mejor vivienda y ver culminada la educación de sus hijos; su mayor desafío es organizar una infraestructura completa para ejercer su arte y ayudar en la educación de sus hijos sin el ingreso de su esposo, por eso duplica sus esfuerzos y también se dedica simultáneamente a la venta de mercancías cosmética.
texts.en:
For 21 years, Aracelys Maria Ramirez M., 44 years old, has been dedicated to the profession of seamstress. She is an authentic female head of household who has always participated in productive, reproductive, educational, domestic and community activities to acheive a better future for her 5 children. In the Bellavista de Malambo neighborhood, a town located in the metropolitan area of Baranquilla, everyone knows her. When she started this business, they would take her the fabric, she'd take measurements, and she would design and make the clothing according to what they had ordered. It grew so much that she started to make clothes in sizes and sell them in the towns of the Atlantico Department. She has gone through many family hardships but she has always overcome and they have improved her. That is what happened when she separated from her husband and moved alone to Medellin, a city in Colombia known for its elegant runways, its glamour, and the sense of its Colombian stylists and designers. She was able, with a state credit, to begin her business again, and try to return for her children to Malambo. This decision didn't happen because she was favored by the Families in Action program of the state and that is why, 6 years ago, she established herself in this town to support her children's studies from there without interruptions. Aracelys entered the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo with the support groups programs in 1995 and she received 5 loans before some of the other members of the group started to work in businesses, she herself changed towns, and the group began to disintegrate. When she returned to Medellin, she again found the support of the Fundación. She acquired a sewing machine and started to work for others. For 2 years she sewed for a clothing wholesaler in a small factory. Now she does it for a chain of stores that has supplied her with a 2 needle machine, but she must pay rent for the pieces and the work exclusivity. This activity does not make her a lot of money. This is the reason she is asking for a loan of $2.300.000 which she will invest in the purchase of an industrial machine. This will be in order to sew with heavy fabrics, such as denim, and to be able to keep for herself what she pays in rent. Aracelys María dreams of acquiring her own label, having better housing, and finishing her children's education. Her biggest challenge is organizing a complete infrastructure to pracrice her art and help in the education of her children without her husband's income. This is why she doubles her efforts and at the same time sells cosmetic merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a two needle machine

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.fr: Information removed at borrower's request

loans.use: To buy fabrics and soaps

loans.name: Edwuin Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Edwuin Antonio S. C. es originario del municipio de condega del departamento de Estelí, él es trabajador de ceprodel y tiene un año de estar laborando como oficial de crédito urbano del departamento de Estelí se le otorgo el crédito para la realización de un curso de titulación en su carrera de ingeniería agropecuaria ya que el no posee el suficiente recurso para pagar el postgrado y él necesita con urgencia recibir el diplomado ya que se le presenta la oportunidad.
Edwuin saco su carrera con la ayuda de su mama. Ella es comerciante ya que se dedica a vender comiderias

Edwuin es casado y no tiene hijos sus padres no viven con el pero el siempre los ayuda ya que gracias a ellos él tiene su carrera y dice que siempre estará con ellos apoyándolos. Este es el  primer crédito que se le otorga a Edwuin y plantea que le servirá de mucho ya que  es un gasto muy importante él cual le ayudará a culminar su carrera  y nos expresa que está agradecido con ceprodel por la ayuda que se le esta brindando por lo que desea  seguir trabajando para la institución en todas sus labores y recompensar de esa forma el apoyo que se le esta dando.
texts.en:
Sr. Edwuin Antonio S. C. is a native of the City of Condega in the Department of Estelí. He is an employee of CEPRODEL and has been working for the past year as an urban loan officer in the Department of Estelí. Edwuin has been granted a loan so that he can complete his degree in agricultural engineering. Since he does not have sufficient resources to pay for his courses and has the urgent need to receive his diploma, this opportunity presented itself to him. Edwuin quit his job working for his mother. She was a businesswoman who managed an eatery.

Edwuin is married and does not have children. Even though his parents do not live with him, they have always been a great help and he is thankful for that. Edwuin has his career and says that he will always be there to help his parents. This is the first loan that he has received and plans to use the proceeds to cover this major expense that will help get his degree. He says that he is grateful to CEPRODEL for providing assistance. Edwuin hopes to continue working for the Institution in its mission and repay the support that has been given to him.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for the courses needed to complete his degree

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.es:
El señor Emiliano S. H., de 59 años de edad es casado y su esposa trabaja en  los quehaceres del hogar y los trabajos de la finca ellos se dedican a la siembre del café y los cítricos desde hace 36 años, ellos comenzaron a laborar en esta rama gracias al esfuerzo del señor S., ellos son una familia con dos hijos, de los cuales una trabaja como enfermera y la menor estudia y ayuda en los trabajos del hogar.

Dentro de las principales dificultades que se les han presentado a lo largo de los años, fue un asalto que lo golpeado físicamente y económicamente, pues lo dejo incapacitado laboralmente por un buen périodo, pero con tratamientos a podido reincorporarse al trabajo de sus tierras paulatinamente, dentro de sus planes están  la diversificación de sus cultivos, pero primero desea realizar una inversión de capital en la compra de insumos y fertilizantes, esto les brindaría una mejor producción y ais mejores ingresos, que les beneficiaran para futuros proyectos.

Ellos son una familia honesta y responsable, merito que es del reconocimiento de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Sr. Emiliano S. H. is 59 years old and married. His wife handles the household activities and chores around their farm. They have been growing coffee and citrus fruits for 36 years. They both started in this line of work as a result of Emiliano’s efforts. In addition, they have two children. One works as a nurse and the other is a student who helps with the household chores.

Some of the main difficulties they have confronted over the years include the assault on Emiliano in which he was physically beaten and the financial impact on their family. He was incapacitated and not able to work for a long period of time. After receiving treatments, he was able to return to working their land. Among their plans are to diversify their crops, but they first need an infusion of capital to purchase supplies and fertilizers. This will help with production and result in more income to invest in future projects.

Emiliano and his family are honest, responsible, and well-recognized by the community for their work.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase farming supplies & fertilizers

loans.name: Sabine

texts.fr: A. Sabine est née le 2 septembre 1966 à Cotonou, capitale économique de Bénin. Sabine vit au quartier Cadjèhoun à Cotonou, depuis sa naissance. Mariée à ACLASSATO François, un chauffeur, Sabine est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Sabine a un autre enfant à sa charge, en plus de ses enfants. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Sabine n’a fait que l’école primaire. Depuis près de 20 ans, afin de contribuer à assurer les charges familiales, Sabine vend des tissus à son domicile, mais aussi par le système de distribution. Sabine s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin.  Sabine a déjà obtenu une fois de crédit à ALIDé, crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Sabine sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé pour renforcer son activité. Sabine ambitionne plus tard acquérir un refrigérateur et diversifier son activité par la vente de jus de bissap, bière, et de la glace.
texts.en:
A. Sabine was born on September 2, 1966 in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. Sabine has been living in the Cadjèhoun district of Cotonou ever since she was born. Married to ACLASSATO François, a chauffeur, Sabine is the mother of three children, all enrolled in school. She is also responsible for one other child. The couple share in supporting their family.

Sabine only went to primary school. For about 20 years, in order to contribute her part to supporting the family, Sabine has been selling lengths of cloth out of her home and also as a hawker. She gets her wares in Dantokpa, international market of Bénin. She has already received and correctly reimbursed one loan from ALIDé. Wishing to meet the growing demand from her clientele, Sabine is requesting another loan from ALIDé to bolster her little business. She hopes later to be able to acquire a refrigerator and diversify her business by selling a hibiscus-flower soft drink (bissap), beer, and ice.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of lengths of cloth for re-sale

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge T. P., tiene 36 años de edad vive en el barrio Nuevo Milenio de Soledad en  el departamento del Atlántico, con su cónyuge y 3 hijos entre los 4 y 12 años actualmente  estudiando. 
Por iniciativa propia inició su taller de mantenimiento y reparación de motocicletas una vez se había capacitado con el  Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje  SENA en mecánica de Motos, desde entonces  su negocio ha progresado lo mismo que su clientela por la calidad  y la honestidad que caracterizan a  Jorge la cual aplica en su taller cuando presta los servicios que ofrece. 
Con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, ha recibido 4 créditos, los cuales ha invertido en adecuaciones de su vivienda y en el taller, del que ha vivido y sostenido a su familia, pues trabajando como mecánico  ha logrado superar muchos obstáculos en su vida.  En la actualidad aspira a obtener un crédito por valor de $1.800.000 que invertirá  en la compra de inventario como bujías, llantas rines cables, prensas pinzas y en general repuestos para la reposición y arreglo de las motos    de sus clientes.
Su sueño inmediato es lograr un mejor posicionamiento de su microempresa y ver a sus hijos convertirse en “grandes profesionales” y personas de bien. Su desafío más crucial es la innovación de algunos de sus procesos y tratar de sobresalir en su campo de acción, pues vive en un barrio deL Municipio de Soledad, donde consigue clientes de toda índole y nivel socioeconómico, rodeado  de otras comunidades, donde el medio de transporte principal es la moto, lo cual  hace que su negocio esté constantemente visitado por propietarios o conductores de estos vehículos que necesitan de su servicio.
texts.en:
Jorge T. P. is 36 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Nuevo Milenio in the city of Soledad, which is situated in the Department of Atlántico. He and his wife have three children between the ages of 4 and 12, all of whom attend school. Out of his own initiative, he started a motorcycle repair and maintenance shop. Jorge at one time trained with SENA (the National Learning Service) in a motorcycle mechanics program. Since then, his business has grown and his customers know him for his honesty and the quality of service he provides in his shop.

Jorge has received four loans with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which were invested in making improvements to both his home and his shop. Working as a mechanic, he has managed to support his family and overcome many obstacles in his life. He now hopes to obtain a loan valued at 1,800,000 COP in order to purchase inventory such as spark plugs, tires, rims, cables, screws, clamps, and other replacement parts needed to repair his customers’ motorcycles.

His immediate dreams are for his micro-business to be better positioned and to see his children become successful professionals and good people. His most crucial challenge is innovating some of his processes so that he can become more successful. Since he lives in a neighborhood within the city of Soledad, he has customers from all socioeconomic levels and from many of the surrounding communities where the primary mode of transportation is the motorcycle. Jorge’s business is frequently visited by the owners and drivers of these vehicles that are in need of service.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase motorcycle parts to keep in stock

loans.name: Alice Espérance

texts.fr: A. Alice Espérance est née le 19 juin 1969 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.  Mariée à RADJI Saka, un agent à la SOBEMAP au Bénin, Alice Espérance est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés.  Alice Espérance vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari au quartier Agla à Cotonou, depuis 6 ans.  Alice Espérance a été à l’école jusqu'au secondaire. Alice Espérance vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Pour contribuer aux charges familiales, Alice Espérance vend des tissus et des produits cosmétiques, par le système de distribution.  Alice Espérance exerce cette activité depuis huit ans et s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et à Lomé au Togo.  Alice Esperance est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui rembourse bien ses crédits.  Alice Espérance sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé pour renforcer son activité et mieux satisfiare sa clientèle.
texts.en:
A. Alice Espérance was born on June 19, 1969 in Cotonou, economic capital of Bénin. Married to RADJI Saka who is a SOBEMAP agent in Bénin, Alice Espérance is the mother of 3 children, all enrolled in school. She has been living together with her children and her husband in the Agla district in Cotonou for 6 years.

Alice Espérance went to school up to the secondary level. She helps her husband support the family. In order to do her share, she sells lengths of cloth and cosmetics on foot through the neighborhoods. She has been in this business for 8 years and buys her wares at Dantokpa, international market of Bénin, and in Lomé (Togo).

Alice Espérance has been a client of ALIDé for a long time and has reimbursed her loans in a timely manner. She is requesting a new loan from ALIDé to bolster her little business and better satisfy her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of lengths of cloth and cosmetics

loans.name: Sandra Candelaria

texts.es:
Sandra R. P. tiene 37 años y habita en el barrio Galán de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Está separada con un hijo de 15 años y ahora vive con su familia en casa, donde venden almuerzos y bebidas refrescantes, un negocio familiar, Solicita un crédito de $2.000.000 para comprar bebidas, refrescos e insumos de productos alimenticios que elabora en épocas especiales como la de Carnaval, cuando las familias de su barrio organizan una fiesta en la calle y se divierten sanamente.
Iniciaron el negocio vendiendo plátanos y verduras en la puerta de un supermercado y vendió el lugar porque se iniciò la pavimentación que  afectaron sus ventas; por eso se fue para el mercado de Barranquilla donde incursionó el negocio de vender almuerzos económicos, como papas rellenas y arroz de payaso, arroz envuelto en una hoja con carne, pollo, huevo y verduras. Como ahora están reestructurando el mercado, cambió otra vez para adicionarse al negocio familiar en un sitio estable, la casa paterna donde venden almuerzos, refrescos y todo relacionado con la comida frita.
Aparte de su negocio de venta de comestibles, Sandra estudió manejo de máquinas planas gestionado ante el Sena por la Fundación Santo Domingo que la llevó a  un nivel avanzado; igualmente hizo un curso de emprendimiento, con el que se diò cuenta que resulta muy costoso comprar la maquinas planas e implementar toda la estructura para montar un negocio, por eso no tiene  su propia confección. Sueña con que algún día pueda tener la plática que le permita comprar toda la maquinaria para crear su propia microempresa de ropa, por eso trabaja fuertemente, pero con mucha alegria y dinamismo.
texts.en:
Sandra R. P., age 37, lives in the Galán neighborhood in the city of Barranquilla. She is separated and has a 15 year old son. She now lives at home with her family, where they sell lunches and cold drinks. It is a family business. She is asking for a loan for 2,000,000 COP to buy drinks, refreshments, and supplies for food that she makes during special times like Carnaval. This is when neighborhood families organize a party in the street and have fun safely. They started the business selling bananas and vegetables in the entrance of a supermarket. She sold the place because they started paving that affected their sales. She then went to the market in Barranquilla where she established her business of selling economical lunches liked stuffed potatoes, rice with chicken or dried fish, rice wrapped in a leaf with meat, chicken, egg, and vegetables. As they are now restructuring the market, she moved again in order to set up the family business in a stable place. They sell lunches, refreshments, and everything having to do with fried food from her father’s house. Besides her business of selling food, Sandra learned how to use industrial sewing machines in training given by Sena (National Service for Learning). The Santo Domingo Foundation arranged for her to take the course, and she achieved a higher level of efficiency on the machines. She also took a business course, and she realized that it would be very expensive to buy the industrial sewing machines and set up all of the structure to launch a business. That is why she does not have her own seamstress shop. She dreams of one day being able to have the money that will allow her to buy the machinery to create her own clothing business. That is why she works hard, but also happily and dynamically.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy drinks, refreshments. and supplies to make food for special times

loans.name: Ndèye Awa

texts.fr: Ndèye Awa F. est une femme de 47 ans, elle est célibataire sans enfant. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SANTHIABA-SUD depuis 2 ans et a bénéficié de 4 prêts qu'elle a régulièrement remboursés. Elle développe un petit commerce de fruits et légumes comme activité principale et fait de la transformation et vente d'huile d'arachide. Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge de sa famille et d'augmenter son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Ndèye Awa F., 47, is single and has no children. She has been a member of the Village Bank SANTHIABA-SUD for two years and has received four loans that she has reimbursed in a regular fashion. She is working at expanding a little fruit and vegetable sales business as her primary activity and does processing and sale of peanut oil. Her goal is participating in supporting her family and adding to her savings.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: add to her working capital

loans.name: Flor De Caliri Group

texts.es:
FLOR D. CALIRI es un banco D. emprendimiento que fue formado por socias D. la zona D. caliri que esta ubicado frente al rio Irpavi,las orillas D. este rio ha sido expropiado por personas que trabajan en el lavado D. arena y que luego venden a las distintas empresas como material D. construccion, en su mayoria los pobladores D. la zona se dedican al lavado D. arena para contrucciones, costa D. 12 socias que se dedican a distintas actividades, tienen una mesa directiva que fue elegida en asamblea D. socios, son personas muy responsables y con deseos D. superacion. forman la asociacion:

La Sra. Gabriela es la presidenta del banco D. emprendimiento Flor D. Caliri, esta casada tiene hijos que estan en edad escolar y se dedica a la crianza D. animales y con el dinero del credito comprara alimento balanceado para el engorD. D. los animales.

La Sra Rosmery es la secretaria esta casada y no tiene hijos todavia, venD. cosmeticos por catalogo y le va muy en esta actividad ya que tiene muchos clientes por el centro D. la ciudad que le hacen pedidos, y con el dinero del credito comprara productos D. promocion para despues venderlos al precio normal.

La Sra. Alicia es  la tesorera del banco, ella esta casada y tiene 3 hijos ya mayores, su actividad es D. lavandera, ya conocen como hace su trabajo y es muy requerida en la zona.

La Sra Graciela trabaja como empleada domestica, es soltera y el dinero del credito lo necesita para comprar un refrigerador para su casa.

La Sra. Maria quien venD. masitas, Carmen que se dedica a la venta D. comida, Antonia que venD. ropa en las ferias, Victoria es empleada domestica, Marcelina  tambien es empleada del hogar, Natalia venD. salteñas, Federico se dedica a la venta D. helados, Benito se dedica al traslado D. arena en su volqueta, ellos son todos los miembros del banco Flor D. Caliri.

El dinero del credito lo utilizaran en la compra D. mercaderia y asi poder incrementar su capital D. trabajo.

Todos los socios estan muy agradecidos con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
FLOR D. CALIRI is a communal bank composed of members from the Caliri area, which is located on the banks of the Irpavi River. The banks of this river have been expropriated by persons who work washing sand that is later sold to construction companies. Most of the inhabitants of the area work washing sand for construction. The bank has 12 members that are engaged in various commercial activities. They have a governing board that was elected at a meeting of members. They are very responsible folks who want to succeed. The association is maD. up of: Gabriela is the group president. She is married and has children who are of school age. She raises small animals and will use the funds to buy balanced feed to fatten up the animals. Rosmery is the group secretary. She is married but doesn’t have any children yet. She sells catalogue cosmetics and does well with this activity because she has many customers downtown that place orders with her. She will use the funds to buy sale items that she will then sell at full price. Alicia is the group treasurer. She is married and has 3 adult children. She is a laundress. Her work is well-known so she is highly sought-after in the area. Graciela is a domestic employee. She is single and will use the funds to buy a refrigerator for her home. Maria sells masitas (little fried turnovers), Carmen sells prepared meals, Antonia sells clothing at the markets, Victoria is a domestic employee, Marcelina is also a domestic employee, Natalia sells salteñas (a kind of food filled pastry), Federico sells frozen treats, Benito transports sand in his dump truck; they are all members of the Flor D. Caliri communal bank. The funds will be used to buy merchandise in order to increase their working capital. All the members are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in them upon granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise to increase working capital.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nuevo Amanecer está formado en la comunidad de Zhidmad a unos 40 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca,  en esta localidad podemos apreciar  la belleza de su paisaje andino durante todo el viaje, la mayor parte de su gente  se dedica a la agricultura y a la cría de animales siendo esta actividad el  sustento para sus familias.

 La señora Blanca R. es socia activa de éste banco hace diez años motivada por Rosa R., Blanca tiene 37 años y vive junto a sus tres hijos de 18, 15 y 2 años de edad en la comunidad de Zhimad pues su esposo  migró fuera del país en busca de  bienestar y  mayor comodidad para su familia  consiguiendo construir su casa propia a base de sacrificio y esfuerzo conjunto.

Blanca al igual que la mayoría de sus compañeras del banco se dedica a la cría de pollos  hace seis  años, solo ha llegado a tener 100 porque tiene que comprar mucho alimento y a veces no le alcanza el dinero, pero también se dedica  a la elaboración de guaipe que entrega  a sus clientes fijos o en algunas ferreterías recorriendo toda la ciudad  lleva un año en esta otra actividad.

Con el nuevo préstamo solicitado va a comprar alimento para sus pollos como  chanca,  balanceado y maíz,  su  meta es seguir incrementando su negocio de pollos.

De igual manera  Zoila R. lleva  tres años  trabajando en su banco comunal gracias al presidente de la Junta Parroquial,  ella tiene 38 años y vive en su casa propia esfuerzo conyugal  con su esposo de oficio albañil y sus cuatro hijos de 19, 16,15 y 6 años.

Ella realiza guaipe  lleva 9 años trabajando gracias a  un familiar que le enseñó como elaborarlo,  para ello recibe la tela de una fabrica pero solo pueden ser beneficiarias si tienen un carnet de identificación que la institución  les hace entrega, luego de elaborar el guaipe vende por diferentes partes de la ciudad de Cuenca o a sus clientes fijos que le hacen pedidos con frecuencia

Con el préstamo que reciba va a comprar tela  para elaborar más guaipe y buscar nuevos clientes. Su meta es  llegar a ser una gran comerciante de guaipe.
texts.en:
The Nuevo Amanecer (New Dawn) Communal Bank is located in the community of Zhimad, some 40 minutes outside the city of Cuenca. In this locality you can really appreciate the beauty of the Andean countryside. The greater part of the population is dedicated to agriculture and livestock raising, which is the activity that sustains their families. Mrs. Blanca R. has been an active member of this bank for 10 years, motivated by Rosa R.. Blanca is 37 years old and lives with her 3 children, aged 18, 15, and 2, in Zhimad, since her husband migrated out of the country in search of wellbeing and greater comfort for his family. They succeeded in building their own house with sacrifice and effort in common. Blanca, like the majority of her fellow bank members, raises chickens and has done so for 6 years. She has only acquired 100 because she has to buy so much feed and at times, there isn't enough money. She also makes dust cloths which she provides to fixed customers, or sells in some hardware stores spread around the entire city. She has been doing this for the past year. With this new loan, she will buy chicken feed and corn for the chickens. Her goal is to continue to expand her chicken business. In like manner, Zoila R. has been working with her communal bank for 3 years, thanks to the president of her Parroquial Committee. She is 38 years old and lives in her own house with her husband, a brick layer, and their 4 children, ages 19, 16, 15, and 6. She has been making dust cloths for 9 years, thanks to a family member who taught her how to make them. For this, she receives cloth from a factory. To benefit, she has to have an identity card provided by the company. After making the dust cloths, she sells them in different parts of Cuenca, or to her set customers who request them frequently. With this loan she will buy cloth to make dust cloths in hopes of locating new customers. He goal is to become a major merchant of dust cloths.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING CHICKEN FEED & CORN FOR CHICKENS, AND CLOTH FOR MAKING DUST CLOTHS TO SELL

loans.name: El Arbolito Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL "EL ARBOLITO"

Teresa es la tesorera de la alcancía comunal "EL ARBOLITO" y trabaja con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD por más de un año.
Teresa comenzó vendiendo caramelos en forma ambulatoria, caminaba varias horas para ofrecer sus caramelos y cuando se cansaba se paraba en una esquina para vender sus dulces. Pasaron algunos años, hasta que nos conoció, entonces con un grupo de amigas y vecinas pudo formar una alcancía, luego gracias a EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD Teresa pudo acceder a un préstamo.
El préstamo lo usó para comprar más productos y de mayor variedad, lo suficiente como para abrir una pequeña bodega, bodega que está en funcionamiento, y que Teresa administra muy bien.
Ahora el gran sueño de Teresa es seguir creciendo y hacer crecer su pequeña bodega.
texts.en:
COMMUNAL SAVINGS BANK “EL ARBOLITO”. Teresa is the treasurer of the communal savings bank “EL ARBOLITO” and she has worked with ESPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD for more than one year. Teresa began selling candies as a street vendor. She would walk for several hours selling her candies, and when she was tired, she would stop on a corner to sell her sweets. She did this for some years until she learned about the communal savings bank. Then with a group of friends and neighbors she was able to form the savings group, and thanks to EDASPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD, she was able to get a loan. She used the loan to buy more products and more variety, enough to open a small store. The store is functioning and Teresa runs it very well. Now Teresa’s big dream is to continue advancing and for her small store to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth es una joven muy trabajadora, es soltera y tiene 28 años, por el momento vive en la casa de su hermana. 
Desde hace 7 años trabaja como docente en una escuela de su localidad, pero el año pasado la animaron a incursionar en el alquiler de disfraces, teniendo a una socia para este negocio, el cual le resulta muy rentable, sobre todo en la etapa escolar (de abril a diciembre).
A su vez, tiene como ventaja el ser profesora, pues está al tanto de los eventos que se realizan en los colegios donde los alumnos deben ir disfrazados.
Para el futuro, quiere ser independiente para obtener las ganancias completas, pero sabe que para ello debe hacerse muy conocida en su localidad.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y promete pagar todas cuotas puntualmente, pues quiere seguir trabajando y sus anhelos es de crecer con la ayuda de estos préstamos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más disfraces, especialmente para niños.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hard working woman. She is single and 28 years old. For right now, she is living in her sister’s house. For the last 7 years she has worked as a teacher in a local school, however, this last year she decided to become involved with a costume renting business. Having a partner for this business made it very profitable, especially during the school year (April to December). Being a teacher puts her at an advantage since it is at the events put on by schools where the children dress in costumes. In the future, she would like to be independent in order to obtain all the profits, but she knows that for this she needs to become well known in her area. This is her second loan with MFP and she promises to pay all the installments promptly. She would like to continue to work and her dream is to grow with the help of these loans. With the money she is currently soliciting she will buy more costumes, especially children’s costumes.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy children's costumes

loans.name: Jose Gregorio

texts.es:
José R. de 23 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, su esposa es ama de casa con ella tiene 1 hijo de 8 meses.

El empezó hace 4 años atrás, porque tuvo un accidente en la empresa que trabajaba y lo jubilaron a temprana edad, con el dinero de la jubilación compro algunos víveres y empezó a vender afuera de su casa.

Ahora el tiene una tienda bien surtida, trabaja todos los días desde las 06h00 hasta las 21h00 el promedio diario de clientes tiene 21 clientes. Una de las dificultades que tiene es la delincuencia que hay en el sector donde vive. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, cola, lácteos para su negocio. En el futuro quiere agrandar su tienda para poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Twenty-three year old José R. lives in the Suburbio de Guayaqhil neighborhood. His house is made of cement and has all the basic necessities. His wife is a homemaker and together they have an 8 month old child. Four years ago he had an accident in the business where he worked and they retired him at a young age. With the money from the retirement he bought some provisions and began selling them outside his home. Now he owns a well-stocked store. He works every day from 6am to 9pm and sees on average 21 customers a day. One of the difficulties that he has is the crime in the area where he lives. With this loan he would like to buy rice, soda and dairy products for his business. In the future he would like to expand his store in order to be able to continue to work.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, soda and dairy products

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira tiene 50 años, vive con su esposo y con 3 de sus 4 hijos, pues el mayor migró al extranjero. 
Toda su vida ha trabajado haciendo manualidades y en la costura de ropa, actividades que realiza en su casa, mientras su esposo trabaja haciendo servicio de taxi. Desde que se casaron planearon construir una casa grande para alquilar habitaciones y obtener ganancias de esa manera. Para tal fin, los domingos Elvira también elaboraba y vendía comida, poco a poco reunieron el dinero y lograron construir una casa tal como querían.
Actualmente tienen 15 habitaciones que alquilan desde 100 hasta 180 soles mensuales, dependiendo el tamaño, inclusive colocaron un teléfono público y venden tarjetas telefónicas para ganar dinero extra, pues en su barrio no había este servicio.
A pesar de estos logros, Elvira quiere seguir trabajando muy duro, pues menciona que sus inquilinos merecen todas las comodidades y quiere seguir mejorando la infraestructura de sus habitaciones.

Este es su décimo préstamo con MFP y está convencida que pagará todas sus cuotas puntualmente, como hasta ahora lo ha hecho. Ella comenta que hace un tiempo tuvieron un problema en su grupo con una persona que no pagaba sus cuotas, fue un inconveniente que ya solucionaron. El dinero que ahora solicita es para terminar con los acabados y mejoras del baño de su segundo piso.
texts.en:
Elvira is 50 years old and lives with her husband and 3 of their 4 children. The oldest child has immigrated. All her life she has worked making handicrafts and sewing clothes. She does these activities from her home while her husband provides a taxi service. Since they first married they planned to build a large house in order to rent out rooms and, in this way, obtain additional income. With this goal, Elvira made and sold food on Sundays and little by little saved money and managed to build a house like they wanted. Currently they rent out 15 rooms for 100 to 180 soles a month depending on the size. In addition, because such a service did not exist in their neighborhood, they installed a public telephone and sell telephone cards in order to gain additional money. Despite all these achievements, Elvira would like to continue to work very hard. She mentioned that her tenants deserve all the amenities and she would like to continue to improve the infrastructure of their rooms. This is her tenth loan with MFP and she is confident that she will pay all the installments promptly as she always has done. She comments that a while ago there was a problem in her group with a person who didn’t pay their installments and it was an inconvenience that has now been resolved. The money that she is currently soliciting is to finish the remodel of the second floor bathroom.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fix the bathroom for her tenants

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo es un hombre muy trabajador, tiene 61 años, está felizmente casado y tiene 8 hijos, casi todos son independientes. No tiene casa propia, por lo que vive junto a su esposa y su hija de 12 años en el comedor popular de su barrio.

Él es una persona multifacética, pues realiza diferentes actividades como chofer, soldador y comerciante, todo esto para obtener mayores ganancias económicas, pero su negocio principal es la vende de quesos. El producto que el vende es de la ciudad de Huancayo (sierra central peruana), que donde él nació, y donde elaboran quesos muy ricos, es por ello que sus vecinos le hacen pedidos constantemente.
Al principio viajaba hasta su pueblo para comprar carne y quesos, pero hoy en el día ya tiene proveedores que le traen estos productos a un bajo precio. Gracias a estos negocios, Guillermo pudo educar a sus numerosos hijos, pero lo que le apena es no haber podido comprar un terreno para tener una casa propia, pero aun así  se siente feliz porque siempre trató de darle lo mejor a sus hijos, menciona. 

Este es su 19avo préstamo con MFP y está muy agradecido por la oportunidad brindada con reiterados créditos, pues han sido y siguen siendo de gran apoyo para que siga trabajando con su negocio. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de más quesos y carne, para incrementar sus ventas y ganancias.
texts.en:
Guillermo is a very hard-working man of 61. He is happily married and has 8 children, nearly all of them grown and independent. Because he does not have his own home, he lives together with his wife and his 12-year-old daughter in his neighborhood's soup kitchen. He is a multi-faceted person who carries out a range of activities, including driver, welder and salesman. He does all of this to obtain additional income, but his main business is selling cheese. The product he sells comes from the city of Huancayo (in Peru's central highlands), where he was born. The cheese from Huancayo is very delicious, and so his neighbors are constantly ordering it from him. At the beginning, he traveled to his village to buy meat and cheeses, but today he has suppliers who bring him these products at a low price. Thanks to these businesses, Guillermo has been able to educate his numerous children; however, it bothers him that he could not buy a piece of land in order to have a house of his own. However, he mentions that he still feels happy, since he has always tried to do his best for his children. This is his 19th loan with MFP, and he is very grateful for the opportunity provided to him through these repeated loans. They have been, and continue to be, of great help to him so that he can continue operating his business. He plans to invest the funds he is currently requesting in purchasing more cheeses and meat, in order to increase his sales and his profits.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying larger quantities of merchandise

loans.name: Juan Ramón

texts.es:
Juan Ramón C. tiene la edad de 46 años vive en la humilde comunidad  de San Caralampio es soltero pero tiene 3 hijos de las edades de 18 y 15 años los cuales estudian y le ayudan a su padre en los trabajos agrícolas, ya que este se dedica a la siembra de café y pitahaya desde hace 15 años y comenzó en el trabajo de agricultura gracias a un programa agrario, en el cual se integro a la cooperativa y consiguió los recursos para comenzar a trabajar.

Uno de los principales problemas que ha sufrido han sido los robos a sus cosechas que lo han golpeado en varias ocasiones, dentro de las planificaciones que tiene para sus tierras esta la incorporación de la siembra de la piña, pero necesita brindarle el mantenimiento optimo a sus tierras de tal manera que comprara insumos y fertilizantes, para la siembra posterior de las semillas de piña.

Agradecería se le apoyara para diversificar su cosecha, y así mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de toda su familia, así como el capital necesario para la inversión de otros proyectos.
texts.en:
Juan Ramón C. is 46 years old and lives in the humble community of San Caralampio. He is single, but he has three children between the ages of 15 and 18 who attend school and also help their father with the work around the farm. Juan has been growing coffee and pitaya (also known as “dragon fruit”) for 15 years. He began farming as a result of an agricultural program that allowed him to join a cooperative and acquire the necessary resources to get started.

One of the major problems he faces is having his harvested crops stolen on various occasions. For his next planting schedule, Juan would like to incorporate pineapple but he needs to maintain his land at an optimal level. For this reason, he needs to purchase supplies and fertilizers so that he will be able to plant the pineapple seedlings.

Juan appreciates the support in helping him diversify his crops, improve the conditions for his entire family, and acquire investment capital needed to fund other projects.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer & supplies

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel tiene 50 años y desde muy joven no deja de trabajar, sólo así logró educar a sus 4 hijos, quienes ya son adultos. Actualmente vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Lucho.
Desde que empezó a trabajar, se dedicó a la costura, pero desde hace 4 años emprendió el negocio de la compra y venta de pescado, con la meta de implementar un taller de confecciones que hoy es una realidad. Hoy en día, desde las 4 de la mañana ya está en el centro de acopio de pescados, compra su mercadería y luego la vende en la puerta de este lugar. Su esposo es el encargado de repartir el pescado en los puestos de algunos mercados, donde tienen clientes; y a su vez, envían este producto a otras ciudades.
Isabel está muy satisfecha con su negocio porque es muy rentable y gracias a éste logró su objetivo de tener un taller de confecciones donde ahora trabajan sus hijos trabaja.

Este es su sexto crédito con MFP y promete, una vez más, ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que gracias a estos préstamos ha progresado en su negocio. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de pescado para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Isabel is 50 years and, from a young age, has not stopped working. She has managed to pay the educational expenses for her four adult children. Isabel currently lives in her own home with her husband Lucho.

When she started working, Isabel devoted herself to sewing. Four years ago, she started a business of buying and selling fish with a goal of opening a clothing store, which is now a reality. Today her schedule begins at 4am when she arrives at the fishing collection center to buy her merchandise before selling it at the entrance of the center. Her husband is in charge of delivering the fish to vending posts in different markets where they have customers. Sometimes she ships her product to other cities. Isabel is very satisfied with her business because it has proven to be profitable and helped her achieve her goal of opening the clothing store where her children are now employed.

This is her sixth loan from MFP. Isabel, once again, promises to make her payments on time because these loans have helped her progress in her business. The money she is requesting will be used to buy more fish to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Está Casada, tiene 41 años, 05 hijos, los que aun están bajo su poder y estudian. La Socia presenta Estudios Superiores de Odontología.

Su fuerza y anhelo de sacar adelante a sus hijos, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes que se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa, un ambiente muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. 

Las ganancias que genera a diario le ayudan a mejorar el ingreso económico de su familia. Desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes y hoy en la actualidad tiene clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su negocio a comprar porque ella  tiene todo los productos  que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con la amabilidad y carisma que le caracteriza. Muy aparte Rosario, también cuenta con un consultorio, ya que ella es de profesión Odontóloga, cuenta con su propio consultorio.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará sacos de arroz y azúcar, fideos, sal y aceite en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Rosario, se siente muy feliz por la labor que realiza, su sueño es surtir más su negocio y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse.
texts.en:
Rosario is a member of the Communal Bank “Honestidad y Trabajo” (Honesty and Work), which is located in the Distirct of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is 41 years old, married, and has five dependent children who are in school. Rosario has a college degree in dentistry.

Due to her strength and desire to see her children succeed, she was motivated to start her own business. Rosario sells groceries out of her home, which is well-equipped to accommodate her customers. The revenue she generates on a daily basis helps to improve the income of her family. To date, she has been gaining customers and now has a regular clientele who come by every day to do their shopping. Her store is stocked with all the products a housewife would need. Rosario attends to each customer with her kind and charismatic personality. In addition, she has her own office where she has set up her dental practice.

With this loan of 1500 soles, Rosario will purchase bags of rice and sugar, noodles, salt and oil in packets, milk, boxes of canned fish of different brands, crates of eggs, and personal hygiene products so that she can provide better service to her customers. She is very happy with the work she has accomplished. Her dream is to grow her business even more. Rosario thanks Manuela Ramos for helping women like her and providing them with development opportunities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchadise for her store

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza es una mujer de buen carácter y sus 45 años tiene la jovialidad de una quinceañera. Vive en una casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos.

Su negocio es la venta de pescado y otros productos marinos, su especialidad son los langostinos y filetes. En este negocio lleva cerca de los 8 años y le es más rentable que su anterior negocio de venta de comida. Para esto, tiene que estar a las 4 de la mañana en el dentro pesquero, pues si llega más tarde se queda sin mercadería.
Por otro lado, le gusta su negocio y aunque tenga que madrugar, después de las 6 sólo tiene que cobrar lo que distribuyó. Inicialmente trabajaba sola, pero no se abastecía en la atención, por lo que contrató a un joven que se encarga de la repartición del pescado, mientras ella está atenta de que sus clientes estén satisfechos con el producto

Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP, sabe que tiene que ser puntual en sus pagos, y así lo ha sido siempre, es por eso que ha sido un apoyo valioso para su esposo en los gastos de su hogar. Con el dinero que ahora solicita incrementará el capital de su negocio, para que siga manteniendo la preferencia de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maritza is 45 years old and a woman of fine character who has the bubbly energy of a 15-year-old. She lives in her own home with her husband and two children.

Maritza sells fish and other types of seafood, with her specialties being shrimp and fillets. She has been in business for almost eight years and finds this line of work more profitable than her previous business selling prepared food. In order to work as a fishmonger, she has to arrive at the fishing docks at 4am because she will not be able to acquire any merchandise if she arrives any later. Maritza enjoys her work even though she has to wake up very early. By 6am, she begins collecting payment for the fish she has delivered. At first she worked by herself, but she was not able to provide adequate service, so she hired a young assistant who is responsible for making deliveries. This allows her to focus on making sure that her customers are satisfied with the products.

This is her sixth loan with MFP. Martiza knows she has to make her payments on time, like she has always done previously. The loans have allowed her to help her husband with the household expenses. The money she is requesting will be used as additional capital for her business so that she can continue satisfying her customers’ preferences.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for her fish business

loans.name: Anacely

texts.es:
En el municipio de Nagarote, la señora Anacely L. se dedica a laborar como trabajadora domestica siendo una mujer muy disciplinada y con gran amor al trabajo. 
Ella se esfuerza para llevar el sustento a su casa y beneficiar a sus pequeños hijos que están estudiando. El crédito lo está solicitando para invertirlo en la compra de útiles escolares para sus hijos y también en el pago de la matricula del colegio para que ellos se preparen y en un futuro lleguen a ser grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
In the town of Nagarote, Sra. Anacely L. works extremely hard as a housekeeper. She feels that she is a very disciplined woman who has great love for her work.

Anacely strives to maintain her home and support her children who attend school. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy school supplies for her children and also pay for their high school registration fees. This will prepare them to be outstanding professionals in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for her children's school supplies & registration fees

loans.name: Víctor Samuel

texts.es: Víctor Samuel E. H. de 39 años de edad, reside en Ciudad Arce, en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a una extensa familia la cual esta conformada por su esposa, y seis hijos, los cuales le ayudan en el negocio. Víctor posee una ladrillería, la cual esta ubicada en su casa de habitación, en donde él se encarga de hacer los ladrillos junto a sus hijos, los cuales posteriormente reparte con los clientes o comercializa en su casa. Víctor posee varios años de experiencia en este oficio, logrando de esta manera hacer ladrillos de muy buena calidad, razón por la que cuenta con muchos clientes, así mismo él se destaca por ser un señor muy amable y responsable con su familia quien trabaja muchas veces incluso de noche para poder entregar los pedidos a tiempo y de esta manera tener una ganancia asegurada. Él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar toda la materia prima para la elaboración de los ladrillos, así mismo para comprar repuestos de los instrumentos que utiliza para realizar su trabajo. Víctor desea mucho poder mejorar su negocio y de esta manera poder brindarles una mejor vida a sus seis hijos, los cuales depende del trabajo de su padre.
texts.en:
Víctor Samuel E. H. is 39 years old and a resident of Ciudad Arce in the Department of La Libertad. He lives with his large family, which includes his wife and six children who help him with his business. Victor manages a brickwork operation located outside of his home. Together with his children, he is responsible for making bricks to sell and deliver to his customers. Victor has many years of experience in this business and manufactures bricks of fine quality, which explains why he has many customers. Likewise, he is known for being a very caring man who takes responsibility for his family. He often works at night so that he can deliver his orders on time and guarantee a steady income.

The loan he is requesting will be use to buy all of the raw materials used for manufacturing bricks and also parts for the instruments he uses in his work. Victor wants so much to improve his business because his work allows him to provide a better life for his six children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for making bricks

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Anyela Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Anyela R. se dedica a la actividad de pulpería donde vende todo tipo de productos desde comestibles, cosméticos y también productos farmacéuticos como lo son medicamentos de todo tipo. 

Ella es una dama muy trabajadora que se ha destacado como excelente comerciante en el municipio de Nagarote. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de los productos para la pulpería como son los granos básicos tales como arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, entre otros.
texts.en:
Sra. Anyela R. manages a store where she sells all types of products such as food items, cosmetics, as well as medicines of all kinds.

Anyela is a hardworking woman who has developed into a successful merchant in the town of Nagarote. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy products for her store such as basic grains (such as rice), beans, oil, sugar, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchadise for her store

loans.name: Juan Enrique

texts.es:
Juan M. es un varón muy trabajador que se ha destacado por ser muy responsable ya que ha sabido mantener su hogar y llevar el sustento a su hijo en edad escolar.
Actualmente está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la mejora de su vivienda por medio de la instalación de tuberías subterráneas para la circulación del agua. Con el crédito comprará los tubos, los codos y llevará a cabo el pago de la mano de obra. Por esta razón es que él espera muy confiadamente que su crédito le sea otorgado y así le brindará a su familia y a su hijo mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Juan M. is a hardworking gentleman who has developed into an individual who is very responsible in maintaining his home and supporting his school-age child.

He is currently requesting a home improvement loan so that he can install underground pipes to circulate the water. With the proceeds from the loan, Juan plans to buy pipes and pipe joints and also pay for the labor involved. He is confident that his loan will be approved so that he can provide his family better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase plumbing supplies & pay for labor

loans.name: Mauricia Justina

texts.es:
En el municipio de Nagarote, la señora Mauricia M. se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajadora que ha sabido administrar su hogar velando por el bienestar de sus dos hijos que dependen de ella.
La señora Mauricia está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de materiales de construcción para llevar a cabo el mejoramiento de su vivienda. Con el crédito comprará 100 piedras canteras y 20 bolsas de cemento para terminar de construir y así brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
In the town of Nagarote, Sra. Mauricia M. is known for being a hardworking person who has been able to preserve her home, thereby ensuring the welfare of her two dependent children.

Mauricia is requesting a loan in order to buy construction materials needed to facilitate improvements to her home. With the proceeds, she plans to acquire 100 quarry stones and 20 bags of cement needed to finish this construction project and provide her family with better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction supplies needed to make home improvements

loans.name: Juana Silvia

texts.es: Juana Silvia V. D. F. D. 33 años D. edad, resiD. en el Municipio D. Armenia, ubicado en el departamento D. Sonsonate. Vive en compañía D. su esposo y su hijo D. 9 años D. edad. Juana posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos D. primera necesidad, la que esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación desD. hace mas D. 2 años. Es por medio D. este negocio como Juana junto a su familia, han logrado seguir adelante, ya que es este la única fuente D. ingresos que posee, es por ello que es D. mucha importancia poder surtir la tienda con productos los cuales sean muy solicitado en el lugar y así mismo agregar otros nuevos. Es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo a través del cual cuente con el dinero necesario para aumentar su inventario, D. esta manera ella podrá contar con mayor cantidad D. clientes y así mismo vender más productos lo cual le generen mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Juana Silvia V. D. F. is 33 years old and a resident of the town of Armenia, located in the Department of Sonsonate. She lives with her husband and her nine year old son. For more than two years, she has managed a store in her home where she sells basic necessities. Through this business, Juana and her family have been able to get ahead because this is their only source of income. Therefore, it is very important to keep the store stocked with the products that are most requested as well as add new items. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she will have the money to increase her inventory. As a result, she will have more customers, sell more products, and generate better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more inventory

loans.name: Fátima Elizabeth

texts.es:
Muy satisfecha se encuentra la señora Fatima R. porque ha sido una dama muy esforzada y ha logrado finalizar sus estudios universitarios y actualmente iniciará a realizar un curso para finalizar su carrera profesional. 
El crédito que ella ha solicitado lo invertirá en el pago de dicho curso y también en el pago de la tramitación de su título universitario para llegar a ver cumplido su sueño de ser una gran profesional de éxito y así mejorar sus condiciones de vida en el municipio de Villanueva.
texts.en:
Señora Fatima R. is very satisfied because through her hard work she has succeeded in completing her university studies, and she is currently starting a course towards the completion of her professional credential. The loan she has requested will be used to pay for this course, as well as to pay for the processing of her university degree. This will be the fulfillment of her dream to become a successful professional, improving her living situation in the city of Villanueva.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for university studies

loans.name: María Lisette

texts.es: María Lisette C. D. U. D. 33 años D. edad, resiD. en el Municipio D. Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos D. 13 y 5 años D. edad. María es una mujer muy trabajadora y con mucha iniciativa quien inicio estudiando cosmetología en sus tiempos libres, con la visión D. poder poner su propio salón D. belleza, con el cual pudiera mejorar su calidad D. vida y la D. su familia, y así mismo poder realizarse como profesional. DesD. hace cuatro años que ella posee la sala D. belleza, y en la actualidad cuenta con muchos clientes quienes son fieles a ella por el excelente trabajo que María realiza. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda obtener el dinero necesario para comprar más cantidad D. productos para el cuidado del cabello, así mismo comprar cremas para cuerpo, tintes y cosméticos. Esto lo hace con el fin D. poder aumentar sus ventas, no solo realizando sus servicios, sino también vendiendo otros productos. Para María aumentar sus ganancias es fundamental, ya que sólo D. esta manera podrá brindarle una vida mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
María Lisette C. D. U., 33, lives in Soyapango, in the San Salvador department. She lives with her husband and 2 children ages 13 and 5. María is a hard-working woman with lots of initiative who started studying cosmetology in her free time, with the goal of having her own beauty shop, so that she could improve the quality of life of herself and her family, as well as becoming a professional. She has had the beauty salon for four years, and now has many faithful clients because of her excellent work. She is requesting a loan in order to obtain the money necessary to purchase a greater quantity of hair care products, as well as skin creams, dyes, and cosmetics. She is doing this with the goal of increasing her sales, not only through her services, but also selling related products. For María the fundamental thing is to increase her earnings, since this is the only way to proviD. a better life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty salon products

loans.name: Catalina Sobeyda

texts.es:
En el mercado central de Chinandega, la señora Catalina Romero se dedica a su actividad de venta de productos de madera y artesanías como sillas, mesas, hamacas, marimbas de juguetes, sombreros, canastos, entre otros.
Ella está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los productos de madera y artesanía para continuar ofreciéndolos en el mercado y así abastecer a sus clientes que a diario visitan el mercado y que están interesados en comprar los productos de madera y las bellas artesanías que ella ofrece.
texts.en:
In the Chinandega central market, señora Catalina Romero sells wooden products and handicrafts such as chairs, tables, hammocks, toy marimbas, hats, and baskets among other things. She is requesting a loan to purchase additional wood products to sell, thus satisfying the clients who visit the market daily, interesting in purchasing the beautiful handicrafts that she offers.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood products and handicrafts

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, la señora Dolores V. se dedica arduamente a su actividad de venta de tamales con cuajada ofreciéndolos todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana y teniendo una gran variedad de clientes que compran dichos productos.
