Ella se ha destacado por ser muy persistente en el trabajo y preocupándose por el bienestar de su familia. Por ello es que espera que su crédito sea otorgado para realizar la comprar el maíz, hojas queso, cuajadas y leña para la elaboración de dichos tamales.
texts.en:
In the Department of León, El Salvador, Dolores V. works arduously selling tamales with curd cheese. She begins her sales very early in the morning and has a variety of customers who come to buy her products. Dolores has shown herself to be persistent in her work, and she is concerned for her family's well-being. For this reason, she hopes that her loan will be funded in order to buy corn, corn husks for wrapping, cheese, curds and firewood for the production of her tamales.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn, curds and firewood

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
La señora María Luisa se ha destacado por ser una persona muy trabajadora y sonriente dedicándose a la elaboración de deliciosas tortillas preparadas por ella misma en el departamento de León donde a diario elabora las tortillas para la venta.
Ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de materia prima tales como leña, maíz, cal y un comal para las tortillas. Ella está confiando que su crédito será otorgado  y de esta manera logrará obtenerlo y a lo inmediato realizará las compras para el mejoramiento del negocio en su localidad.
texts.en:
Maria Luisa has become well known for being a hard working woman, who always has a smile on her face. She makes and sells home-made tortillas daily in the Leon Department. She is asking for this loan in order to buy ingredients and supplies such as firewood, corn, salt and a griddle to cook her tortillas. She is counting on this loan in order to buy her supplies and allow her to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de maíz, leña, cal y comal

loans.name: Arely Sugey

texts.es:
El nacatamal es una de las comidas típicas de Nicaragua que son elaborados por personas con mucha experiencia en el ramo y aunque en varios países quieren elaborarlos, nunca han tenido el sabor como los nacatamales de Nicaragua.
La señora Arely C. se dedica a la elaboración de los nacatamales siendo este negocio el que le permite obtener los ingresos para el mantenimiento de la actividad y por ende de su familia. Ella solicitó el crédito para la compra de la materia prima para la elaboración de dichos nacatamales y así venderlos a sus clientes todos los fines de semana en el departamento de Chinandega.
texts.en:
Nacatamales are a typical food in Nicaragua. They are made by experienced cooks and even though people in other countries have tried to make them, they do not taste as good as those from Nicaragua. Ms. Arely makes nacatamales, this being the business that provides her an income to support herself and her family. She requested this loan to buy ingredients for her nacatamales, in order to sell them to her customers in the Chinandega department on the weekends.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Juana Martinez es una dama digna de imitar porque se dedica a vender reposterías ambulantemente en las cercanías al mercado el Bisne donde vende dichas reposterías desde tempranas horas con un canasto en su cabeza dirigiéndose por varios lugares y con la exposición al sol pero esto no le es impedimento porque ella se ha planteado trabajar muy esforzadamente para llevar el sustento a su hogar.
El crédito que está solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de las reposterías para continuar ofreciéndolas en el mercado siempre vendiéndolas ambulantemente.
texts.en:
Juana is a woman to be emulated. She sells confectionery on foot around the “Bisne” marketplace. She begins selling early each morning from a basket carried on her head. She is out in the sun as she walks through many places, but this has not deterred her. She has put much effort into her work, in order to bring money into her home. She is requesting this loan so she can invest in more items of confectionery, so that she can continue to sell them on foot in the marketplace.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in confectionery items for resale

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Karla Sánches es una persona muy inteligente que inició su negocio de venta de calzados en el mercado El Bisne en Chinandega y hasta el momento ha logrado suplir el negocio de calzados por lo que a diario varios clientes llegan a visitarle para comprar el producto.
Está solicitando un crédito para la compra de los calzados principalmente los colegiales para ofrecerlos por lo que ya inició el año escolar y debe venderlos a lo inmediato. Ella espera que el crédito le sea otorgado y así seguir mejorando en su negocio.
texts.en:
Karla is a very bright woman and began her business of selling shoes in the “Bisne” marketplace in Chinandega. Until now she’s been able to maintain her business because she has customers who buy from her daily. She is requesting this loan in order to invest in more shoes, particularly school shoes, as the school year has begun, and she must begin selling them immediately. She hopes that this loan will be granted so that she can continue to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in shoes for resale

loans.name: Manuela Del Socorro

texts.es:
Muy deliciosos son los alimentos que vende la señora Manuela M. en el mercado El Bisne en Chinandega donde se ha destacado por tener veriedad de clientes que le compran a ella por la razón de que ella misma prepara los alimentos.
Está solicitando el crédito para la compra de la materia prima como arroz, frijoles, aceite, entre otros para la elaboración de los alimentos y así continuar ofreciéndolos en el mercado y logrando la satisfacción de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Manuela sells delicious food in the “Bisne” marketplace in Chinandega, where she has become well known for having many customers who buy from her because she prepares the food herself. She is asking for this loan in order to buy basic supplies, such as rice, beans, and cooking oil, among other things, so that she can continue to satisfy her customers by selling her dishes in the marketplace.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients for food sales

loans.name: Sandra Carolina

texts.es:
La señora Sandra Carolina S. C., tiene 33 años y vive con su esposo en el Barrio Sacuanjoche,  el esposo trabaja como Artesano y apoya en los gastos familiares, ellos tienen 3 hijos y estudian la escuela secundaria.
Dentro de los planes de la familia está el mejorar las condiciones de vida de la familia, ella se dedica a la costura desde hace 4 años y dentro de los principales problemas que ha tenido están la falta de financiamiento que ha obtenido de los bancos debido a sus pocas posibilidades económicas, pero con el apoyo económico de su esposo de su liquidación del último trabajo que tenía el señor, logro poner su pequeño taller de costura, pero ahora ella necesita de una inversión más alta de capital para la compra de materia prima y una máquina de coser que le facilitara y le brindara rapidez para realizar las ordenes de trabajo con esto ella lograra captar más clientes y obtener mejores ingresos que beneficien sus condiciones sociales.
texts.en:
Señora Sandra Carolina S. C., 33, lives with her husband in the Sacuanjoche neighborhood. Her husband provides for the family expenses by his work as an artisan. They have 3 children in secondary school. As part of the family plans to improve their living situation, she has been sewing for 4 years, and one of the main problems she has had has been the lack of financing because of her limited economic potential. With help from the completion of the last work that her husband had, she was able to start her small sewing shop, but now she needs a greater investment of capital to buy raw materials and a sewing machine that will make her work easier and quicker, so she will be able to fulfill her work orders. Thus she will be able to gain additional clients and increase her income, improving their social condition.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials and a sewing machine

loans.name: Santos Alberto

texts.es:
Santos Alberto G. S. tiene 64 años de edad vive en la comarca de San Jose de los Ríos es acompañado y la señora se dedica a las actividades domésticas y le apoya en los gastos del hogar, el tiene 7 hijos y todos se dedican a la agricultura desde hace 31 años.

Dentro de los principales planes de la familia está el realizarle remodelaciones al hogar y dentro de los principales problemas esta la falta de agua potable que afecta la vida e la familia y la sequia de las cosechas, el se inicio en este rubro gracias al apoyo de la reforma agraria. Dentro de los planes a futuro está el realizar trabajos de conservación del suelo y agua que beneficien a toda la comunidad, pero primero desea invertir este préstamo en la compra de fertilizantes e insumos que aporte un mejor mantenimiento de la producción.
texts.en:
Santos Alberto G. S., 64, lives in the San Jose de los Ríos region. His wife takes care of the domestic activities and helps him with the household expenses. He and his 7 children have all worked in agriculture for the last 31 years. The family plans to remodel their home, and the main problem affecting family life is the lack of drinkable water and lack of water for the crops. He started in this line of work thanks to agrarian reform. The plans for the future are to work to conserve the land and water in a way to benefit the whole community, but he plans to invest this loan to buy fertilizers and soil improvements in order to increase production.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of agricultural fertilizers

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
La Sra. Luzmila, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 55 años y es madre de 03 hijos, todos ya independientes.

Las ganas de salir adelante y cumplir parte de sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes, con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico de su hogar, lleva 03 años ejerciendo este tipo de actividad y desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando muy buenos clientes. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar porque en ella  encuentran todos los productos necesarios, que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará leche , conservas de pescado , huevos en jabas y parte del dinero invertirá en comprar detergente , lejía y jabón en cajas para así brindar  una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Luzmila, se siente con muchas ganas de seguir trabajando y esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Luzmila belongs to the “Honestidad y Trabajo” [Honesty and Work] Communal Bank in the District of Juanjui, Province of Mariscal Cáceres, in the Department of San Martín, Peru. She is 55 years old and married, and has 3 children who all live independently. It was a desire to get ahead and to fulfill her dreams that motivated Luzmila to start her own grocery sales business. With her earnings she can contribute to the household budget. She has been working in grocery sales for 3 years and from the beginning up until the present she has gained many good customers. Today she has regular customers who visit her store every day, because she offers all the products they need. She has all kinds of products for the home and she attends to customers' needs with a charisma that she is well known for. With this loan of 1000 Peruvian Soles she will buy milk, canned seafood, and cartons of eggs. She will also use part of the loan to buy packaged detergent, bleach and soap in order to offer better service to her customers. Luzmila very much wants to keep working and thanks the Manuela Ramos movement for helping women like her to have opportunities to progress in the environment in which they find themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy products such as canned seafood and cartons of eggs in order to increase and vary her inventory.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
In this tough economy, Sam was looking for an opportunity to provide for his family’s financial security, but he never imagined that he would find inspiration while walking through the mall one afternoon.

Sam is the owner of BouncyLand, an indoor children’s play space and recreation zone located inside a suburban shopping mall. “Since we opened, I’ve enjoyed watching the families come and have a good time together. It’s nice to see that even in this economic crisis, parents still make their children’s happiness a priority. We do it all for the kids.” 

Sam, a father of two and originally from Morocco, poured his life savings into BouncyLand to get his business up and running and turning a profit. “I’m very proud of our success; especially that I employ four people in my business. It feels good to give someone a job.” Sam now wants to upgrade the play space to make it safer, but, despite his good credit, he was declined for a loan from his bank.

A $10,000 loan, approved by Opportunity Fund, will allow Sam to invest in safety improvements at BouncyLand, including new floor mats and carpeting. “There’s no limit to what I can achieve now that I’m my own boss. I’m giving kids a safe place to play and parents the chance to relax and have fun with their children. I love what I’ve created here.”

loans.use: To make safety improvements

loans.name: Libertadores Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL LIBERTADORES

Los 11 integrantes  D. L. Alcancia Comunal "LIBERTADORES" son organizados y se reúnen puntualmente. Ellos se agruparon para acceder a un crédito que les permita invertir en su negocio.
Tienen diferentes negocios que con mucho esfuerzo pueden brindarles lo mejor a sus familias. Como es el caso D. L. socia Zenobia, es casada hace 16 años tiene 2 menores hijos, Zenobia se dedica a L. venta D. salchipapas por las noches ya que durante el día tiene que ocuparse D. sus hijos, esto le permite aportar para L. alimentación D. su familia; el crédito recibido lo invertirá en algunos productos que le hace falta para atender a sus fieles clientes.
El Sr David es el secretario del grupo, viendo L. necesidad D. su familia opto por iniciar un negocio que le permita sustentar los gastos en casa,  se dedica a L. costura D. Jean,  2 personas lo ayudan. Como todo negocio al principio fue difícil,  pero con mucho esfuerzo su negocio se estabilizó, ahora se preocupa por L. educación y alimentación D. sus 3 menores hijos. 
Hace varios años Sonia pudo comprar un carro juntamente con su pareja para trabajar en transporte público, aunque a veces ese negocio tiene sus bajas,  pero elL. sigue adelante para poder mantener a sus 3 hijos. 
Los socios se sienten agradecidos por el apoyo que les brinda Edaprospo  y las personas que intervienen en el financiamiento como son los prestatarios D. KIVA.
texts.en:
LIBERATORS COMMUNCAL BANK The 11 members of the Liberators Communal Bank are organized and meet punctually. The group formed to take out a loan that allows them to invest in their business. They have different businesses that, with a great deal of work, can offer the best to their families. Take the case of Zenobia, who has been married for 16 years and has 2 minor children. Zenobia sells salchipapas (combination of sausage and French fries) at night, since she takes care of her children during the day. This allows her to contribute to feeding her family. She will invest the loan in commodities needed to serve her loyal customers. David is the group’s secretary. Seeing his family’s need, he decided to set up a business that allows him to keep expenses at home. He sews jeans, and 2 people help him. As is true with any business, the startup was difficult, but with a lot of hard work, his business stabilized, and he now concerns himself with raising and feeding his 3 minor children. Several years ago, Sonia was able to buy a car along with her partner, to work in public transportation. Although business is down at times, she forges ahead, in order to support her 3 children. The members are grateful for support offered by Edaprospo, and those who participate in the financing, such as kiva lenders.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods

loans.name: Yesenia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Esta señora es trabajadora de la Alcaldía Municipal de Chichigalpa, se desempeña como conserje del área de Finanzas, tiene la edad de 28 años, es madre soltera de 2 niños los cuales están en edad escolar.
Ella nos expreso que los créditos que Ceprodel le ha otorgado han sido de mucha ayuda ya que con el primer crédito lo utilizo para hacerle mejoras a su vivienda donde habita con sus hijos y padres y con este último fue para comprarles los útiles escolares a sus hijos y para solventar otros gastos.
texts.en:
This woman works in the municipality of Chichigalpa, where she works as a financial advisor. She is a 28 year-old single mother with two school-age children. She has expressed that the loans Ceprodel has given her have helped her a lot. She has already used her first loan to make improvements to her home where she lives with her children and parents. This last loan was used to buy school supplies for her children and to settle other costs.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying notebooks, pencils, backpacks, uniforms and shoes for her children

loans.name: Denny

texts.es:
La Sra. Denny, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 49 años y es madre de 04 hijos, los 03 que aun dependen de ella. Denny presenta Estudios Superiores de Técnica en Enfermería, no lo ejerce por dedicarse al trabajo, desde muy joven.

Denny, ante la necesidad de aportar al ingreso económico de su hogar, motivada por su esposo, emprendieron su negocio de venta de ladrillos, iniciándose con un capital de 8,000.00 Nuevos Soles, de las cuales poco a poco fue obteniendo muy buenos resultados desde un inicio por la calidad de sus ladrillos y la buena atención al cliente.

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y lleva 22 años dedicándose a la venta de ladrillos, ubicada en un fundo que tienen lejos de la ciudad y sus principales clientes son los vecinos, instituciones y clientes fijos.

Con este crédito de S/. 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará  latas, para hornear sus ladrillos, parte del dinero también lo invertirá en el pago mensual de su personal. 

Denny, se siente muy contenta con el trabajo que realiza día a día agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante y ser grandes empresarias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Denny belongs to the community bank "Honesty and Work" in the district of Juanjui, province of Mariscal Cáceres, and department of San Martín. She is a 49 year-old married mother of four, three of whom still depend on her. Denny shows superior studies in nursing technique. She does not practice because she has worked since she was very young. In light of the need to contribute to her household income, Denny was motivated by her husband to begin her own business selling bricks, which she started with 8000 nuevos soles. Little by little she obtained positive results for her work because of the quality of her bricks and her excellent customer service. Today, Denny continues with the same business, having dedicated 22 years to selling bricks. She sells from a country estate they have outside of the city and her principal customers are neighbors, institutions, and certain clients. With this loan of 3000 nuevos soles, Denny will buy tins to bake her bricks. She will also invest part of her money into her monthly pay. Denny feels very happy in the work she does every day. She appreciates the Manuela Ramos Movement for supporting people like her who want to work hard, get ahead in life, and become big businesswomen.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tins to bake bricks

loans.name: Silvia Karina

texts.es:
La Sra. Silvia Karina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 36 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella. La Socia presenta Secundaria Completa.

Silvia, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora, así que decidió poner su propio negocio de ventas de bebidas gasificadas y refrescos, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa. Es ella quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con 250 Nuevos Soles y empezó comprando 02 paquetes de gaseosas, para probar como le va, vio que le iba muy bien y que le falto sus gaseosas, por lo que poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas. 
En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes que son sus vecinos, familiares y amigos 

Con este crédito de S/. 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará más bebidas como: paquetes de gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas, como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas, y parte del dinero lo invertirá en azúcar y en frutas para su refresco cómo naranjas en cientos, cocona, carambolas (frutas silvestres y naturales).
 
Silvia Karina, esta muy feliz con el trabajo que realiza, su meta es tener su propio Minimarket de venta de bebidas gasificadas y refrescos. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando mas lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Mrs. Silvia Karina belongs to the community bank "Honesty and Work" in the district of Juanjui, province of Mariscal Cáceres, department of San Martín. She is married, 36 years old, and a mother of two children, who still depend on her. She has a complete secondary education. Silvia is a hard-working fighting woman, which is why she decided to begin her own business selling carbonated drinks and beverages in a well-kept space located in her house. She directs the business without having a schedule or a boss. She told us she began her business with 250 nuevos soles and began buying 2 packages of carbonated drinks to see how it went. When she saw that the business worked well and she did not have enough carbonated drinks, she began investing little by little in her business. She still works in the same business and is known among her customers, who are her neighbors, family members, and friends. With this loan of 1,500 nuevos soles, Silvia will buy more drinks like packages of carbonated drinks in different flavors, sizes, and brands as well as mineral water with and without carbonation. She will also invest part of the money to buy ingredients for her drinks like sugar and fruits, such as oranges and other wild and natural fruits in bulk. Silvia Karina is very happy with the work she does. Her goal is to have her own mini-market selling carbonated drinks and beverages. She is very grateful for the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her when she most needed it. She is responsible with her loan repayments and she wants to continue.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying carbonated drinks to expand her business

loans.name: Elsia

texts.es:
Elsia tiene 42 años de edad, vive en casa propia con sus 2 hijos, de los cuales uno de ellos esta 
en edad escolar. Ella inicio el negocio de venta de verduras y legumbres con un
capital obtenido por ahorros de sus trabajos anteriores, adquirio el puesto por 
medio de créditos, ya que incremento su negocio con mucho esfuerzo. Ella atiende 
el negocio de manera muy calida y amable, además le ofrece a sus cliente precios bajos, el sueño de Elsia es poder brindarle a sus hijos una buena educación,  ya que su hija mayor acaba de ingresar a ala universidad,Elsia desea brindarles a sus hijos lo mejor, por ello trabaja a diario para incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Elsia is 42 years old. She lives in her own house with her two children, of whom one is school-age. She began her business selling fruits and vegetables with capital obtained from savings from her previous jobs. She acquired the produce stand using loans and is already growing her business with a lot of work. She attends to the business in a way that is very warm and nice. Furthermore, she offers her customers low prices. Elsia's dream is to be able to give her children a good education, not that her oldest daughter has just entered college. Elsia wants to give her children the very best, which is why she works daily to improve her income.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta G. is a married woman who supports her family by selling fish and running a general store. She lives in Brgy Miranda Bolobitoon, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental with her 41-year-old husband, Romulo, a labourer, and their four children who are 6 to 19 years old and currently going to school. Violeta has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000. She has improved her living conditions with the help of loans from NWTF and by her own efforts. By working hard in her fish vending and general store businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Violeta is now borrowing 23,000 PHP so that she can expand her fish vending and general store businesses. This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 17,000 PHP, which she paid off within its term, was just another step on her journey towards economic freedom. Violeta aspires to improve her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital for business

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa B. is a 37-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy 7, Isabela, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by selling dried fish and rice. Marissa’s 38-year-old husband, Joven, is a also a dried fish vendor. They have three children who are between 12 and 18 years old. The children are currently going to school and also help their parents with the business as part of their daily chores. Marissa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1993 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life for their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family's income with her business. Now she earns an average monthly income of 40,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Marissa is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP was used to fund the operations of her businesses and had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is requesting her 10th loan in the amount of 19,500 PHP which she intends to use on her dried fish and rice business. Marissa is working hard to achieve the dreams and aspirations she has for her family which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Thear

texts.en: Mrs. Thear K., a 25-year-old married woman, and her husband, Mr. Vandy Nheom, are farmers who own a 1.5-hectare field to cultivate rice. They live in Angk Prasat village, Takeo province and earn a living by farming crops. The couple has two children who are too young for school. In order to help cultivate the plants, Mrs. Thear K. decided to ask for a loan to buy an ox for plowing and supporting the farm.

loans.use: To buy an ox for plowing

loans.name: Savet

texts.en:
Mrs. Savet O. and her husband, Mr. Tharn ChhO., are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate plants. They are also grocers and own a food stand for selling food in their village. Mrs. Savet O. is a 36-year-old married woman who lives in Phnum Lonteah village, Takeo province. The couple has one child who is 10 years old and is currently in school. 

Mrs. Savet O. is now requesting a loan of 2,000,000 riels from AMK to buy more ingredients to enlarge her business. With the help of loans from AMK, she has been able to increase her family's income and improve their standard of living with her business activities.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to enlarge her business

loans.name: Kwt Tiing Gading Group

texts.en:
KWT Tiing Gading is an association of women farmers located in the village of Banyubiru, in the district of Jembrana, Bali. The group was formed at the initiative of mothers who wanted to develop businesses, but found it difficult to secure the necessary capital to do so, as the loan application process at banks is complicated and burdensome.
KWT Tiing Gading has 20 members and spans a wide range of businesses, from farming to trading to home-based businesses such as making cookies and chips. Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) Koperasi is working with Kiva to provide the necessary funding for these women to develop their businesses.
KWT Tiing Gading has a leadership team that is comprisesd of three members: Ni Putu Eka Yulianti (Chairman), Ni Made Mili Kasih (Secretary) and Ni Komang Mahayani (Treasurer). 
One of the borrowers, Ni Komang Mahayani, who is also the Treasurer in the leadership team, is a housewife whose tough day-to-day work is to make and supply a variety of cakes to shops or individual customers. In particular, when there are religious ceremonies approaching, cake orders will multiply as Komang Mahayani makes better and more expensive cakes than the artificial cakes and snacks sold in stores. Komang Mahayani is applying for loans through MUK, which will be used to increase her working capital. She will use the additional profit she earns to finance her children’s education, as one is waiting to enter school and the other is currently attending Junior High School.

Note to Kiva Lenders: This group uses a community lending model (commonly referred to as Village Banking) that is very common throughout Asia. In this model, a select number of group representatives will take out a large loan on behalf of their entire group (often an entire village). They will then distribute and manage the loan and collect repayments for the lender. This is a common and efficient practice in the region, but it makes reporting on Kiva somewhat unusual. Unlike most other loans, Kiva’s partner MUK will be in contact primarily with the group leadership team who in turn will be overseeing the end borrowers.  As such, journal updates likely will reflect the performance of the lending group rather than the individual end borrowers.

loans.use: As capital to develop the business

loans.name: 09.2.2 Nam Ngan Group

texts.en:
Ly H. T. (17) is a 47-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh hoa. Ly is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 09.2.2 Nam Ngan (02.09.2.2).


Ly is married and has three adult children.  To making a living, Ly owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community.  Ly has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2009, Ly joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Ly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,963,500 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the third loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Ly plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  N. T. Hang (19) is a 26-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a service-based business.


2.  N. T. H. Phuong (20) is a 25-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a service-based business.


3.  D. T. V. Ha (21) is a 53-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a service-based business.


4.  N. T. Du (22) is a 50-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector selling religious items.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Ly H. T. (17) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh hoa.  Ly là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 09.2.2 Nam Ngan (02.09.2.2).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán các loại sản phẩm khác nhau trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Ly thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Ly kiếm được khoảng 1.500.000 VND.  Vào 2009, Ly đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Ly đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1.963.500 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. T. Hang (19) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


2.  N. T. H. Phuong (20) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


3.  D. T. V. Ha (21) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


4.  N. T. Du (22) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán các vật dụng tôn giáo.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida D. is from the village of Minallo, Naguilian, Isabela. She is 42 years old. Aida is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Aida owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fruits and vegetables in the local community. In 2008, Aida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Aida is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Aida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Delia's Group

texts.en: Delia O.'s main source of income comes from raising ducks to produce and sell eggs. She is 37 years old, married and has four school-aged children. They are from the village of Olango, Mallig, Isabela. Delia has been in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Delia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Delia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Delia is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her third loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. Delia is the leader of a 6 member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members, if someone is delinquent or defaults. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Leticia is married and has 6 adult children. Leticia owns & operates a rice processing business and provides this service to local community members. Leticia has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

loans.name: Mr. Sophat Touch Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of thirteen people located in Preak Svay village in Kandal province. Mr.Sophat T. is a village bank president who has been selected by the group members. They all use the loan for different purposes. 

He and his wife, Mrs.Te Oran, are farmers who rent land to cultivate rice to support their family. This family has a problem in that the soil in their rice field is infertile. Mr.Sophat T., therefore, decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to increase his rice yield this year. 

He is the father of five children. Three of them help their parents to farm, while the others are attending the local public school. All the group members are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en: Mrs.Saroeun T. is 30 years old and lives in Chheu Teal Phluoh village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare field where she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Nak Hang, mines gems in the local village from which he earns a small income. Mrs. Saroeun T. decided to ask for a loan to buy two pigs and pig food for pig breeding. With this loan she hopes to increase their income and improve her family's living conditions. Mrs.Saroeun T. is the mother of two children who are both students at the local school.

loans.use: To buy two pigs and pig food

loans.name: Emmalinda

texts.en:
Emmalinda R., 41, is making sure that her family has enough for their daily needs. She is married to Joselito R., a buko (coconut) juice vendor, and they are blessed with 2 children. She helps her husband earn a living so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own buko salad and buko juice business for 10 years now.

Emmalinda has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and consistently pays her weekly dues. Due to her good repayment performance with previous loans, she has been able to borrow 4 times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She always pays her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her buko salad and buko juice business.

Now, with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 49,000 loan. This amount will be used to expand her business by buying raw materials for her salad and juice business.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can have enough money for her children’s college education. 


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her salad and juice business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita V., 53, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Virgilio V., a traffic enforcer, they are blessed with two children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been selling assorted beverages and managing her own store for two years.

Teresita has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than five years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow five times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrowed for added capital for her soft drink business.   Her business lets her earn a profit of PHP 15,000 per month.  

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a loan of PHP 11,000. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying assorted soft drinks and snacks for her store.

She dreams that her business will grow so that she can put up another store in another location for her children to manage someday. 


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and snacks for her store.

loans.name: Lê's Group

texts.en:
T. Lê Đắc (20209010016) is a 34-year-old male living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  T. is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Thôn Đông - Nhóm 03 (Nhóm 03).


T. is married and has a school-aged child.  To making a living, T. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising chickens for sale.  T. has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,704,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  He is now requesting a new loan of 6,496,000 VND, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  The loan will be the third loan taken out by T. from SEDA.  T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị Toán (20209010015) is a 35-year-old female who is requesting a 6,496,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


T. Lê Đắc  (20209010016) là 34 tuổi nam.  Anh ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 2 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Thôn Đông - Nhóm 03 (Nhóm 03).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán.  T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2008, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  điều kiện và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.704.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác.  Anh ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.496.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị Toán (20209010015) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva

2.  Đặng Thị Thắm (20203040074) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


3.  Trương Thị N. (20203040075) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  Nguyễn Thị Huyền (20203040076) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


5.  Nguyễn Thị Thắm (20203040077) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.256.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt N.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mrs. Savy Mai Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Savy M. is the village-bank president who has been selected by the members of a group loan. The village-bank loan consists of 14 people located in Preak Svay village in the Kandal province. They will all use the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Savy M. is a housewife and her husband, Mr. Phy Than, is an electrician who owns a small business in the local village. This famiL. doesn't earn enough income; however, they try to work hard with their business. Thus, Mrs. Savy M. decided to ask for a loan to buy some electric supplies to expand their business. This couple has nine children, two of whom are employed in the garment factory. Two of their other children help them with the electric system, while the others are attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy some electric supplies to expand their business

loans.name: You

texts.en: Mrs. You O. is 55 years old and she lives with her spouse in Pou Khvet village, Takeo province. She sells dried fish. Her husband, Mr. Orl Chantha, is a house builder who can make a little income to support his family. In order to support the business of selling dried fish, Mrs. You O. decided to ask for a loan to buy more dried fish to resell in the local market. The couple has three children. One of the children is a mechanic and the other two are students in the local school and help their mother in the business.

loans.use: To buy more dried fish to resell

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira Q., 45, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Alfredo Q., a carpenter. They are blessed with four children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own variety store for seven years.

Elvira has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her variety store.     

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a loan of PHP 8,000. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying groceries. This will replenish and expand her current product inventory.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can have a peaceful life with her family and enjoy good health.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her store

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Mrs. Sem B. is a farmer who owns a two-hectare field to grow rice to earn a living. In order to support the dry season farming, Mrs. Sem B. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline to support the field crops.    
              
Mrs. Sem B. is 59 years old and lives in Chrouy village, Takeo province. She is a widow with five children. One of her children is a laborer, three others are masseurs in Phnom Penh city and the youngest one is 18 years old and a student.

loans.use: To  buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: Amelia's Group

texts.en:
Amelia M. is from the village of San Marcos. She is 32 years old. Amelia is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Amelia is married and has 4 school-aged children. Amelia owns & operates a vegetable growing and selling business. Amelia has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Amelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Amelia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Amelia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean R., 27, is making sure that her family has enough for their daily needs. She is married to Alvin Allan R., a machine fabricator, and they are blessed with one child. She helps her husband by earning a living so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own variety store for 5 years.

Jean has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. As a result of her good repayment performance with previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She always pays her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her variety store.     

Now, with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP11,000 loan. This amount will be used as to expand her business by buying additional stock to replenish and expand her product inventory.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can have a peaceful and good life with her family.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy stock to replenish and expand her product inventory

loans.name: Chu's Group

texts.en:
D. Chu Thị (20209050056) is a 47-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  D. is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Vọng Nguyệt 3 - Nhóm 06 (Nhóm 06).


D. is married and has three school-aged children.  To making a living, D. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale.  D. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, D. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  D. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,704,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to build shelter for her livestock.  She is now requesting a new loan of 7,392,000 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  The loan will be the third loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  D. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Ngô Thị P. (20209050057) is a 33-year-old female who is requesting a 6,496,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  Nguyễn Thị Đệ (20209050058) is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 6,496,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


3.  Chu Thị Thắm (20209050059) is a 38-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


4.  Nguyễn Thị Bé (20209050060) is a 43-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


5.  Chu Thị Thủy (20209050061) is a 35-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


D.  Chu Thị (20209050056) là 47 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  D.  là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Vọng Nguyệt 3 - Nhóm 06 (Nhóm 06).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  D.  thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, D.  kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  Vào 2008, D.  đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  D.  đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.704.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng xây chuồng cho gia súc của người vay.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Ngô Thị P. (20209050057) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

3.  Chu Thị Thắm (20209050059) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


4.  Nguyễn Thị Bé (20209050060) là 43 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

loans.name: Lucita's Group

texts.en:
Lucita M. is from the village of V.. She is 39 years old. Lucita is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Lucita M..

Lucita is married and has 3 school-aged children. Lucita owns & operates a motorcycle transport business in the local community. Lucita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Lucita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lucita has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to repair a vehicle used in her business. Lucita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will also be used to repair a business vehicle. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Lucita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a vehicle used in her business

loans.name: Mrs.seng Kim Thai Villag Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of sixteen people located in Preak Svay village in Kandal province. Mrs. Seng Kim T. is a village president who has been selected by the group members. They all use the loan for different purposes. 

She is a vegetable seller and her husband, Mr. Bou Oring, is a Khmer noodle seller in the local market. This family earns a small income even though  they try to work hard in their business. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Seng Kim T. decided to ask for a loan to buy more noodles and vegetables for resale to increase profits. 

She is the mother of six children. One is employed in a garment factory, one is a construction laborer and another one helps with housework.  Her other children all attend a local public school. 

All the group members are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more noodles and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida J., 43, is making sure that her family has enough for their daily needs. She is married to Gerry J., a carpenter, and they are blessed with 3 children. She helps her husband by earning money so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own rag making business and has been selling clothing and cosmetics directly for five years now.

Zenaida has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. As a result of her good repayment performance with previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She always pays her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her businesses.

Now, with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 12,000 loan. This amount will be used to expand her business by buying the raw materials needed to make rags. A portion will also be invested in her direct selling line.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can enjoy life with her family in good health.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to produce rags and to invest in her direct selling business

loans.name: Myrna's Group

texts.en:
Myrna D. C. is from the village of Brgy.Murong, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 44 years old. Myrna is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Myrna is married and has 2 school-aged children. Myrna owns & operates a general store and sells everyday products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Myrna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional stock. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her inventory. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Myrna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase goods to expand her product inventory

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị (20211020036) is a 39 year-old woman living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  H. is the group leader of a 7-member loan group offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Ngô Nội nhóm 07 (7).

H. is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, H. owns & operates a business venture in the arts sector operating a handicraft business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling bamboo handicrafts to tourists and local community members.  H. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from these activities.

H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  H. is requesting for the first time a loan from SEDA.    She is now requesting a new loan of 5.152.000 VND which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.name: Nora's Group

texts.en:
Nora A. is from the village of San Juan. She is 49 years old. Nora is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Nora is married. To make a living, Nora owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Nora has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP whenever she sells one of her raised animals.

In 2009, Nora joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Nora is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Nora from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:

texts.en:
Jovita N. is from the village of Centro 2, Mallig, Isabela. She is 57 years old. Jovita is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Jovita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jovita has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Jovita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fabric and materials. Jovita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Jovita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:

texts.en: Huệ Hà Thị (20203020028) is a 22-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong, Bắc Ninh. Huệ is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Đông Thái 2 - Nhóm 06 (Nhóm 06). Huệ is married and has two infant children. She owns and operates a business providing hairdressing and beauty services to local community members. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month. Huệ joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,152,000 VND which will be used to purchase equipment to improve her business. The loan will be her first from SEDA. Huệ plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. Trương Thị Q. Cô ấy sống ở tH.nh phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. Huệ là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các tH.nh viên. Mặc dù mỗi tH.nh viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các tH.nh viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Đông Thái 2 - Nhóm 06 (Nhóm 06). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ làm tóc & làm đẹp cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. Huệ thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Huệ kiếm được khoảng 3,000,000 VND. Huệ đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Huệ đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,152,000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. loans.name: Norn

texts.en: Mrs. Norn P. is 56 years old and she lives in Phnum Lonteah village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Roeun Mark, are farmers who own a 4-hectare field to cultivate rice. Although they try to work hard with their field, they still earn little income to support their family. In order to increase income and improve the family's living conditions, Mrs. Norn P. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. Mrs. Norn P. is a mother of two children, one of whom is employe in a garment factory while the other one is a dog breeder and also supports the parent's farm.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Kimman

texts.en: Mrs. Kimman M. is 30 years old and she lives in Chrouy village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 2.5-hectare field to cultivate rice. In order to support her crops, Mrs. Kimman M. is applying for a KHR 2,000,000 loan from AMK to buy fertilizer and pesticides. Her husband, Mr. Peoun Pang is a fisherman who earns a small income by selling fish to support his family. The couple has three children; two are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study as the child is a year old. Her husband and her children are presented with her in the photo.
