H. Nguyễn Thị (20211030018) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  H. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Phù Lưu 1 - nhóm 04 (Nhóm 04).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán.  H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 8 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2008, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  H. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.704.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.496.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị H. (20211030063) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Nguyễn Thị Tư (20211030064) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Trần Thị D. (20211030020) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Mrs. Chantha Nao Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantha N. was selected as village bank president by the members applying for this loan. The village bank loan group consists of seventeen people located in Preak Svay village in Kandal province. The borrowers all plan to use the loan for different purposes.  All the members are shown in the photo, but some of them are blocked.            

Mrs. Chantha N. is a house worker.  Her husband, Mr. Oroeung Oroun, is a rickshaw driver who earns some money to support his family. This family's house is old and in need of repairs, but they do not have enough money to fix it.  Thus, Mrs. Chantha N. decided to ask for a loan to repair their house. This couple has six children.  Two of the children are mechanics; one is a construction laborer, while the others are attending local public school.

loans.use: To repair their house.

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Khorn S. lives in Angk Prasat village in Takeo province.  She is 61 years old and married with two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory.  Her other child is a duck breeder.

Mrs. Khorn S. and her husband, Mr. Tuy Soun, are farmers who own a 1-hectare field where they cultivate rice. In addition to farming, Mrs. Khorn S. also breeds ducks, which earns her a small income to support the family. Her business is going well and she wants to expand it. She is seeking a loan to buy more ducks for breeding. As a result of the loan, she expects an increased income and improvement in the family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more ducks for breeding.

loans.name: Dương

texts.en:
H. Dương Thị (20213040011) is a 42-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, H. owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a tailoring business.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing women's tailoring services to local community members.  H. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,500,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,704,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital.  H. is now requesting a new loan of 7,840,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital.  The loan will be the third loan taken out by H. from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


H.  Dương Thị (20213040011) là 42 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, H.  Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ may mặc trang phục nữ giới cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  H.  thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H.  kiếm được khoảng 4.500.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2008, H.  đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  H.  đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.804.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động.  Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  H.  dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch H. is 50 years old and ives in Chrouy village, Takeo province. She is married and has two children who all are students in the public school and also support their parents with the farming. Mrs. Touch H. and her husband, Mr. Lav Vann, are farmers who own 2.5-hectare field to cultivate rice and a variety of fruit, which has allow them to support their family.

Mrs. Touch H. is now requesting a loan of 2,000,000 Riel from AMK to purchase seeds, fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline to support the farming business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline to grow more crops.

loans.name: Dương

texts.en:
T. Dương Thị (20213040006) is a 33-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has two school-aged children.  To making a living, T. owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community.  T. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,500,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,704,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  T. is now requesting a new loan of 7,840,000 VND, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering.  The loan will be the third loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


T. Dương Thị (20213040006) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, T. T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 4.500.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2008, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  T. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.840.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua các vật dụng mới để mở rộng việc giới thiệu sản phẩm.  Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  T. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Mrs. Kim Heng Sokh Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Kim Heng S. is a village bank loan group president who has been selected by the members. The group using the loan consists of thirteen people located in Preak Svay village, in Kandal province. Mrs. Kim Heng S. is a vegetable seller in the local market and her husband, Mr. Vatey Vagn, is a mechanic in the village. They earns a small income and allthough this family works hard with their business, they do not earn sufficient income to properly support the family. 

Thus, Mrs. Kim Heng S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more vegetable and pork to re-sell. The rest of the loan she would like to use to buy some supplies to repair motorbikes. 

This couple has four children, three of whom are attending a local public school, while the other is too young to attend school or work. All the members of the loan group are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy some supplies of parts and material to repair motorbikes.

loans.name: San

texts.en: Mrs. San S., 56, is a hard working woman who resides in a rural area of Phnom Penh city. San S. cultivates rice and vegetable crops in the village, on which she earns a living. She is a widow and mother blessed with five children. Three of them are married and working at different jobs, while the remaining two are single. San S. also depends on the income from her sons who are construction laborers. San S. faced difficulty cooking foods because her house doesn’t include a suitable kitchen. Therefore, she has applied for a loan which will enable her to construct a kitchen. She will use some remaining money from the loan for her crop growing.

loans.use: To construct a kitchen.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en: Mrs. Sokha T. is 31 years old and lives in Ampil Lech village, Takeo province. She is a silk weaver and pig breeder from which she earns a small income to support her family. Since her business is going well and in order to expand her business, Mrs. Sokha T. decided to ask for a loan to buy more silk supplies and rest of the loan she would use to purchase three pigs and pig feed. With this loan she will increase her income and improving her family living standard. Mrs. Sokha T. is married and has three children, all between 1 to 6 years old. Her husband, Mr. Vin Kork is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to help meet the family's needs. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of silk and to purchase three pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Srou

texts.en:
Mrs. Srou K. is 50 years old and she lives in Thlok Doung Tum village, Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who own a plot of land on which they cultivate rice. Aside from farming, Mrs. Srou K. raises pigs at home.

In order to support their farming, Mrs. Srou K. decided to ask for a loan to buy two oxen. She will use the rest of the loan to buy pig feed to support her pig-raising.

The couple has two children, one of whom is a driver and the other is a student in the local school. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy two oxen to support the farm and pig feed for her pigs

loans.name: Mrs. Chhom Nao Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhom N. is a village bank loan group president who has been selected by the members. They will all use the loan in different purposes. The village bank loan group, which consists of twelve people, is located in Preak Svay village, in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Tim Lieb, are Khmer cake makers who sell their products in a local marK.. 

Although this family works hard with their business, they do not earn sufficient income to meet the family needs. Thus, Mrs. Chhom N. decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice to make thrit Khmer cakes to sell and with the rest of the loan she would like to buy supplies for constructing their home. She is a mother of four children, two of whom are employed at a garment factory and the others are construction laborers.

loans.use: To buy more rice to make Khmer cake to sell

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Mrs. Yon D. is 35 years old and lives in Daeum Pou village, Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who own a 2.40-hectare (6-acre) field on which they cultivate rice.

On this farm they now face a problem because they lack financial resource to grow crops. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Yon D. is now requesting 2,000,000 Riel from AMK to purchase fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline to support the growing of crops.

Mrs. Yon D. is married with four children, three of whom are students in the public school while the youngest one is only a year old. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline to support her rice field

loans.name: Loeng

texts.en:
Mrs. Loeng C. is 39 years old and lives in Roka village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns 1.5-hectares (3.75-acres) of land on which she cultivates rice to support her family living. Her husband, Mr. Saroeun Chhon, is a palm juice collector.

In the rice field, this family has a problem because their rice field has infertile soil. Thus, Mrs. Loeng C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and fuel. With the rest of the loan she would like to buy some supplies for collecting palm juice.

This couple has eight children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory, three are attending the local public school, while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and fuel for her rice field plus supplies for her husband's business

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarom O. is 32 years old and lives in Pech Changva village, Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who own a plot of land on which they cultivate rice.

In order to grow crops and support their farming conditions, Mrs. Sarom O. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer and pesticide. She would use the rest of the loan to hire a laborer for the farm.

Mrs. Sarom O. is the mother of three children who are between 1 and 11 years old. Two of her children are currently in school. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticide and to hire a laborer

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantha N. is a villager in Srae Ampil village in Kandal province. She is 22 years old. She farms a small piece of land, cultivating rice to help support her family. Her husband, Mr. Thul Sok, is a laborer who plows the fields in their village. 

The family has some problems because the field Chantha farms has infertile soil, but they don't have enough money to improve it. Thus, Mrs. Chantha N. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, and would also like to buy pesticides. 

She is the mother of two children who are too young to work or study. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Dor

texts.en:
Mrs. Dor Y., 49, lives in a rural territory of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She owns a plot of farmland in the village where she plants different kinds of crops to earn a living. She has a partner in her husband, who climbs palm trees to tap juice which he boils into sugar to sell for a profit. 

The couple is responsible for four children, including school fees, clothing, and medicine. Another three of their children are married and have established new families. 

Dor Y. is taking out her loan to buy three cows which will alleviate her physical labor in plowing the farmland. In the future, she proposes to raise a cow to produce calves to sell.

loans.use: To buy three cows.

loans.name: Sok Heang

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok Heang N. is a villager in Srae Ampil village in Kandal province, and she is 38 years old. She is a farmer who rents a small piece of land to cultivate rice to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Vuth Saun, is a motorbike taxi driver. 

In the rice field, this family has some problems because the field has infertile soil, but they do not have enough money to improve it. Thus, Mrs. Sok Heang N. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, and she would also like to buy pesticides. 

She is the mother of five children, all of whom are enrolled in the local public school. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Shinoun

texts.en:
Mrs. Shinoun N. is a villager in the Kouk Romiet village in Kandal province. She is 30 years old. and she is a sewer. Her husband, Mr. Kamsen Rom, is a construction laborer. Besides this, he is a farmer who owns a small  piece of land for cultivating rice to support his family. 

The rice field has some problems because it is far from an irrigation system, but they do not have money to improve it. Thus, Mrs. Shinoun N. decided to ask for a loan for digging a well. With the rest of the loan she would like to buy fertilizers and fuel to support their field and increase the rice yield. 

This couple has three children, two of whom are attending the local public school, while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: For digging a well

loans.name: Monika

texts.en:
Monika C. is currently in the business of selling eggs at the market and is requesting a loan to buy more trays of eggs to sell.  Monika is 40 years old and is married to a soldier. She has six children and they all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to buy more trays of eggs to sell

loans.name: Romano

texts.en:
Romano M. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local alcoholic beverages. She is requesting a loan to stock more materials to use and to make more alcohol to sell.  Romano is 34 years old and is divorced.   She has four children and they all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a hotel.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock more materials to use and to make more alcohol to sell.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora J. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local beer and is requesting a loan to stock crates of beer and sodas to sell.  Flora is 30 years old and is single. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a bar and restaurant.

She has three children and they all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children.

loans.name: Siama

texts.en:
Siama S. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Siama is 20 years old and is married to a teacher. She has two children and they both go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a charcoal store.

loans.name: Francisco's Group

texts.en:
Francisco R. is from the village of Villa Cayaban. He is 41 years old. Francisco is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Francisco is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, he plants and harvests a variety of vegetables to sell. Francisco has been engaged in his business for over fifteen years and earns approximately $155 a month from this activity.

In 2010, Francisco joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation by engaging in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be his 1st loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Jurabek

texts.ru: Бердикулов Журабек проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 29 лет. Женат, имеет одного ребенка. Жена, домохозяйка. Кроме того сними живут его радители. Сам Журабек более 7 лет занимается растениеводством. Он выращивает пшеницу. Кредит просит для закупа качественных семян, чтобы получить хороший урожай.
texts.en:
Jurabek B. lives in the region of Yavan. He is 29 years old. He is married and has one child. His wife is a housewife. His parents also live with them. Jurabek has been in agriculture for more than seven years. He grows wheat. He is asking for a loan to buy quality seeds to sow good crops.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Violeta's Group

texts.en:
Violeta R. is from the village of Sto. Niño. She is 40 years old. Violeta is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Violeta is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Violeta owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Violeta has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Violeta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Violeta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Violeta is requesting a new loan of 22,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Violeta from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Lang

texts.en: Mrs. Lang N. is 39 years old and a resident of a rural area near the city of Phnom Penh where she has owned a plot of land since she was single. She grows rice crops, which she plants twice a year. In addition, she assists her husband in producing cement jars for extra profit. She is married with five children, all five of whom are going to school. Her husband is a jar maker. In the past, Lang N. hired a cow to plow her farmland and right now she wants to own cows so she can reduce the hiring expense. Because of this reason, Lang N. requested a loan to purchase a couple of cows.

loans.use: To purchase a couple of cows

loans.name: Emelisa

texts.en: Emelisa T. is engaged in retail business. Aside from that, she also owns and manages a small rice field in their village. She has seven children. Her eldest child is 21 years old. She desires a better life for her family, that is why she is working very hard to be able to earn income to buy them adequate food and other basic needs. She would like to apply for a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise in for her RTW (ready-to-wear) business and farm supplies for her farm.

loans.use: To buy RTW porducts to resell

loans.name: Rosalie's Group

texts.en:
Rosalie O. is from the village of Bagong Tanza. She is 38 years old. Rosalie is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Rosalie is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalie owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Rosalie has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rosalie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Rosalie is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Rosalie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mr. Sok S. was born in 1965. He has been married for many years to Sokhim, 32, who raises a few pigs from home for a profit. They have 3 children who are living at home and they are cared for by their parents. To earn a living, Sok S. buys animals from rural people and fattens them for a while before selling them for a profit. Sok S. wants to make his ox trade more successful and increase his income. He is applying for assistance which will allow him to order additional animals to resell.

loans.use: To order additional animals to resell

loans.name: Pech

texts.en:
Mrs. Pech R. is 35 years old and lives in Roka village in Kandal province. She is a sewer in the local village and her husband, Mr. Cheang Choeun, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he cultivates rice to support his family. Besides this he is also a construction laborer.

In the rice field he has some problems because it has infertile soil and they do not have money to support it. Thus, Mrs. Pech R. decided to apply for a loan to buy fertilizer and fuel. With the rest of the loan she wants to buy five piglets to raise.

Mrs. Pech R. is the mother of four children who are attending the local public school. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and fuel plus five poglets to raise

loans.name: Norn

texts.en:
Mrs. Norn S. lives in Ampov Prey Pir village in Kandal province. She is 69 years old. She and her husband, Mr. Sien Sou, are grocers in the local village who are able to earn a little money to support their family living.

However hard this family tries to work with their business, they are not able to earn enough income. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Norn S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to sell to expand their business.

Mrs. Norn S. has no children. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Hav

texts.en:
Mrs. Hav C. lives in Pouthi Reamea village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Mat San, are farmers who own a small piece of land on which they cultivate rice to support their family living.

The rice field has some problems because it has infertile soil but they do not have money to support it. Thus, Mrs. Hav C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and fuel to improve their rice production.

This couple has three children, two of whom are attending the local public school while the other is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and fuel for her rice field

loans.name: Barinisa`s Aburahmanova Group

texts.ru:
Баринисе 44 года, она замужем и воспитывает 3 детей. Старший сын недавно закончил юридическую академию, в данное помогает родителям в бизнесе, однака его мечта устроится на работу в финансовую полицию. Единственная дочь студентка Юридической академии, а младший сын школьник. У них имеется семейный бизнес. Бариниса вместе с супругом занимаются транспортировкой и оптовой реализацией овощей и фруктов (хурма, персики, картофель, лук) в столице Кыргызстана, в Бишкеке. Наш клиент непосредственно занимается заготовкой продукции, а ее супруг на собственном грузовике доставляет продукцию постоянным клиентам в Бишкеке. Этим бизнесом они занимаются на протяжении 20 лет. За это время смогли обновить свой грузовик, предоставили возможность детям получить хорошее образование и обустроили свой дом. Кредит запрашивается на ремонт кухни.

Мадинабону 21 лет, замужем. У нее есть маленький сын, за которым присматривает ее свекровь. Супруг работает в мясной лавке. у них имеется семейный бизнес по выращиванию живности, также производят молоко и кисломолочные изделия. Продукция реализуется в сельских пунктах общественного питания.На кредит она планирует купить одного бычка и корм. 

Мафтуне 25 лет, пока она не замужем, но собирается в этом году.  Она проживает вместе с родителями. Дома она занимается шитьем мужской и женской одежды, постельных принадлежностей, а также штор. Искусству шитья она научилась у матери, которая по профессии является портнихой. На полученный кредит клиент планирует закупить ткань для производства швейной продукции.

Саёра,19, замужем. Совсем недавно, всего лишь 9 месяцев назад, у нее появился первенец, очаровательная маленькая дочька. Супруг строитель - выполняет отделочные работы по Ошской области. На своем земельном наделе семья клиента выращивает хлопок. Кредит будет использован на весенние полевые работы, а именно для закупа семян хлопка, минеральных удобрений и вспахать землю. 

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Barinisa is forty-four years old. She is married and raising three children. The eldest son recently graduated from the law academy and helps his parents in the business, but his dream is to work for the financial police. The only daughter is a student at the law academy, and the youngest son is attending school. They have a family business. Barinisa along with her husband works in the transportation and wholesale of vegetables and fruits (persimmon, peaches, potatoes, onions) in the Kyrgyz capital, Bishkek. They are directly involved in the procurement of produce, and her husband delivers the produce to regular customers in Bishkek in his truck. They've been in business for twenty years. During this time, they have been able to upgrade his truck, give their children the opportunity to get a good education and renovate their house. They are asking for a loan for the remodel of the kitchen. Madinabona is twenty-one years old and married. She has a young son who is cared for by her mother-in-law. Her husband works in the butcher shop. They have a family business to raise livestock, and produce milk and milk products. The products are sold in the local cafes and restaurants. She asks for loan to buy a calf and feed. Maftuna is twenty-five years and is planning to get married this year. She lives with her parents. She has a home based business of sewing men's and women's clothing, bedding, and curtains. She learned the art of sewing from her mother, who by profession is a dressmaker. She needs a loan to purchase fabric for the production of garments. Sayora is nineteen and married. Just nine months ago, she gave birth to a cute, little daughter. Her husband is in construction and performs finishing work in the Osh region. They also grow cotton on their own piece of land. The loan will be used for spring field work, particularly to purchase cotton seeds and fertilizer and plowing the land. This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Translated from Russian by Susan Savkov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair kitchen

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Mrs. Van R. is 64 years old and she lives in Dei Edth Kaoh Phos village in Kandal province. She is a vegetable seller who is able to earn money to support her family living.

However hard this family tries to work with their business, they are not able to earn enough income. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Van R. decided to ask for a loan to buy more vegetables to sell in order to expand her business.

Mrs. Van R. is a widow with two children, one of whom is a worker in a cake shop, while the other helps her mother.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Mrs. Sen S. lives in Preak Svay village in Kandal province and she is 47 years old. She and her husband, Mr. Phun S., are farmers who own a small piece of land they use to grow bananas and sugarcane.

In the sugarcane field, they have some problems because it has infertile soil. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Sen S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizer and pesticide to support her field.

Mrs. Sen S. is the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local public school. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and pesticide for her field

loans.name: Fhang

texts.en:
Mr. Fhang P. is 53 years old and lives in Popeal Khae village in Kandal province. He and his wife, Mrs. Ra Noun, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they grow crops to support their family living.

In the rice field they have a problem because it is time to harvest the rice but they do not have money to support it. Thus, Mr. Fhang P. decided to apply for a loan to hire laborers to harvest his rice.

Mr. Fhang P. is the father of five children, two of whom help with the farming while the others are attending the local public school. His wife is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To hire laborers to harvest his rice

loans.name: Kimhiv

texts.en:
Mrs. Kimhiv N. is 60 years old and lives in Popeal Khae village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Vit Loem, are farmers who own a small piece of land on which they cultivate rice to support their family living.

In the rice field, they have a problem because it is time to harvest the rice but they do not have money to support it. Thus, Mrs. Kimhiv N. decided to apply for a loan to hire some laborers to harvest her rice.

Mrs. Kimhiv N. is the mother of three children who are attending the local public school. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To hire laborers to harvest her rice

loans.name: Segundina's Group

texts.en: Segundina D. is from the village of Qinagabian, Sta. Maria, Isabela. She is 43 years old and is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Segundina is married and has six school-aged children. She owns and operates a general store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Segundina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Segundina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Renalyn's Group

texts.en: Renalyn D. is from the village of Estefania, Amulung, Cagayan. She is 26 years old and is the group leader of a ten-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Renalyn is married and has two infant children. She owns and operates a manufacturing business, primarily manufacturing and selling iron products to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Renalyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This loan will be her first from ASKI. Renalyn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Man

texts.en:
Selling clothes is the main part of 38-year-old Man A.’s daily routine. She operates her trade inside the local busy market and has been a clothes seller for years. She has a partner in her husband, who assists her in conducting the business.

Man A. currently runs her business very well and a lot of customers recognize the good clothing she sells. In order to better satisfy the needs of her customers, she looks for a loan to increase the financial capital of her enterprise by buying more clothing.

Man A. has three kids, two of whom are taxi drivers.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing to sell

loans.name: Loep

texts.en:
Mrs. Loep A. is 49 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. She is married to Karya, 53, who is a security officer in the district. She currently takes care of three kids and another two are married and live away from home. Four of the children are employed in different fields. Loep A. was not available at photo time so her husband is pictured instead.

Loep A. earns a living as a clothes seller, selling both men’s and ladies’ clothes at the market. From her business, she is able to earn an average of US$3 per day.

Loep A. will be using her first loan to decorate her house which she will rent to guests for a fee.

loans.use: To decorate her house in order to rent it to guests

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Prom

texts.en:
Prom M. is a humble villager living in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She was born in 1959 and has established her own small family with other members. She is married to Samet, 52, a taxi driver, and they help each other to care for seven children. Now, two of their children are married and live independently while the remaining five are single and working.

Prom M. sells different kinds of fruit by hawking (going door-to-door) around the community and normally earns about $4 each day. She is taking out her loan to repair her existing house because it is falling down.

loans.use: To repair her house because it is falling down

loans.name: Elsa's Group

texts.en: Elsa P. is from the village of Saranay, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 46 years old and is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Elsa is married and has two school-aged children. She owns and operates a business selling personal-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Elsa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be her fourth from ASKI. Elsa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Wycliffe Onyango

texts.en:
Wycliffe Onyango O. is 26 years old and is from Migori town. He is married to Judith Auma and they have no children as they are newlyweds.

Wycliffe sells secondhand shoes in Migori market and is looking for funds to enable him to add stock to his business. He plans to buy more shoes, especially for the men, since there is a high demand for a particular design. His mainly sells to people within the market.

This is Wycliffe’s second loan from KADET after successfully repaying his first one. He hopes to diversify into selling secondhand clothes in the future.

loans.use: To add stock to his business by purchasing more shoes

loans.name: Efren's Group

texts.en: Efren T. Sr. is from the village of Barangcuag, Angadanan, Isabela. He is 57 years old and is the group leader of a eleven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Efren is married and has four adult children. He owns and operates a furniture business. He has been engaged in his business for over eight years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Efren joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a new loan of 24,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be his seventh from ASKI. Efren plans to use the additional revenue generated from his business to improve and expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Kaï

texts.fr: T. Kaï est née vers 1965 à Seme Podji.  Mariée à MERESANVI Albert, un magasinier à la SOBEMAP, Kaï est mère de quatre enfants, dont 1 seul est à leur charge.  Kaï vit ensemble avec son mari et l’enfant à leur charge au quartier Xuilacodji à Cotonou, capitale économique du BENIN, depuis 35ans.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Kaï n’a pas été à l’école. Kaï vend du charbon et du jus de bissap (boisson locale de la Côte d'Ivoire, pays voisin du BENIN) et du citron de façon ambulante à Xulacodji.Kaï vend également de l'eau glaçée. Kaï exerce cette activité depuis dix ans et s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin.  Kaï est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu 2 crédits à ALIDé.  Ces crédits ont été bien remboursés.  Elle sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé pour renforcer son activité et acheter du charbon,du sucre,des feuilles de bissap, et divers autres produits. Kaï voudrait vendre également des pagnes.
texts.en:
Ms. T. Kaï was born around 1965 in Seme Podji. Married to Mr. MERESANVI Albert, a store clerk at the SOBEMAP, she is the mother of four children, of whom only one is in her care. Kaï has been living together with her husband and child in the Xuilacodji district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for 35 years. The couple jointly ensure that family expenses are covered. Kaï did not go to school. In Xulacodji, she goes door to door selling charcoal and lemonade and bissap juice (a local drink from Cote d'Ivoire, a country near Benin). She also sells ice water. She has been in this business for ten years and gets her supplies from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She is a previous ALIDé client having already obtained two loans from ALIDé. These loans have been repaid. She is requesting a third loan from ALIDé for bolstering her business and buying some charcoal, sugar, bissap leaves, and various other items. She would also like to sell pagnes (colorful West African cloth).

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying charcoal, sugar, bissap leaves, etc.

loans.name: Maryrose's Group

texts.en: Maryrose A. is from Barangay Tuao North, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 22 years old and is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Maryrose is married and has one infant child. She owns and operates a business making and selling food, preparing and selling barbecued pork and chicken for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Maryrose joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Maryrose is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Math

texts.en:
Mrs. Math T. is 60 years old and the mother of six children. She currently stays at home to care for her children and to cook food for her family. She relies on the income from her husband’s fishing and from her sons who work in construction.

Recently, her husband is not able to catch more fish because he lacks essential accessories and some of his existing equipment is ruined. Therefore, Math T. requested a loan which will allow her husband to buy a fishing boat as well as to repair his broken equipment so as to resume his fishing activity.

loans.use: To buy a fishing boat for her husband as well as to repair broken equipment

loans.name: Charity Faith's Group

texts.en:
Charity Faith T. is from the village of Bryg. Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 28 years old. Charity Faith is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Charity Faith T. Group.

Charity Faith is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Charity Faith owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Charity Faith has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Charity Faith joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Charity Faith has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Charity Faith is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Charity Faith from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Biola

texts.en:
Biola sells drinks and is in the sachet water business. She is married to a commercial driver and they have 2 sons. She is happy about the progress that her children are making in school.

At this point, Biola is hoping for the loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more drinks and sachet water to sell. She hopes to expand her business. She also has a good relationship with LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organisation) which is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She is thankful in anticipation for your kind support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and sachet water to sell

loans.name: Teresita's Group

texts.en:
Teresita A. is from the village of Baringin Sur, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 35 years old. Teresita is the group leader of an 11-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Teresita is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Teresita is just starting this business.

In 2009, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Teresita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ethel

texts.en:
Ethel M. is from the village of D'Ban, Calamba, Misamis Occidental.  She is 41 years old, married, and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Ethel owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products in the local community. Ethel has been engaged in her business for 6 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ethel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ethel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Ethel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Ethel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: Augustina lives in Lagos state, Nigeria with her husband and children. Her eldest child is 18 years old while her youngest child is 9 years old. Her children are still dependent on her and they go to school. She sells friut to make a living. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is very positive of utilizing this loan to ensure that the impact improves her business and extends to her family. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit to sell

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita J. is from the village of Napilan, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old, a widow, and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Anecita owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products in the local community. Anecita has been engaged in her business for 8 years and earns approximately 1,800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Anecita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anecita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Anecita is requesting a new loan of 10,500 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Amecita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann L. is from the village of East Poblacion, Rizal, Zamboanga del Norte.  She is 49 years old, married and has 2 children. To make a living, Mary Ann owns & operates a a clothing business particularly Ready to Wear items. The main source of income for the business comes from selling dry goods especially clothing or ready to wear items in the local community. Mary Ann has been engaged in her business for 2 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Mary Ann joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Ann has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional items to sell. Mary Ann is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital for her clothing business or ready to wear business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Mary Ann from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her Ready to Wear (Clothing Business)

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa S. is from the village of Napilan, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental.  She is 57 years old, married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Luisa maintains a corn farm. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from her corn production. Luisa has been engaged in her business for 8 years and earns approximately 16,000 PHP per cropping cycle (about 4 months) for these activities.

In 2006, Luisa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC.  Luisa is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to finance her corn production. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Luisa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her farm. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for corn production

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.fr: Née en 1976, A. Elisabeth vit depuis 20 ans à Xwlacodji, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du BENIN. Mariée à METONOU Ludovic, un pêcheur,  Elisabeth est mère de 4 enfants dont certains parmi eux sont scolarisés. Elisabeth vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges familiales. Pour venir en aide à son mari, Elisabeth exerce comme activité principale la vente de banane plantains, comme autre activité, Elisabeth vend du savon, des tubercules de manioc et d’igname. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du BENIN et au GHANA, pays voisin du BENIN que Elisabeth s’approvisionne. Elisabeth vend ses produits de façon ambulante et par distribution. Elisabeth n’a pas fréquenté l’école mais exerce son activité depuis 3ans. Elisabeth est une cliente fidèle de ALIDé qui a déjà obtenu 3crédits, crédits qui ont tous été bien remboursé. Dans le souci d’augmenter son niveau d’activité et de diversifier ses produits, Elisabeth sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born 1976, A. Elisabeth has been living for twenty years in Xwlacodji, a district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to METONOU Ludovic, a fisherman, she is the mother of four children; some of them children are in school.  Elisabeth lives with her husband and children.  The couple jointly ensure that family expenses are covered.  To help out her husband, Elisabeth has a business selling plantains.  Her other business is selling soap, cassava tubers, and yams.  She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and from Ghana, a country near Benin.  She sells her products door-to-door and by distribution. She didn't attend school but has been doing this work for three years.  Elisabeth is a loyal client of ALIDé who has already obtained three loans, which have all been repaid.  Concerned about increasing her level of business and diversifying her goods, she's requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cassava and yam tubers, plantains, etc.

loans.name: Math

texts.en:
Mrs. Math S., 40, and her husband, 37, support their family by fishing with fishing implements along the Mekong river. They wake up at dawn every day to gather the fish from their nets which they put in the water the night before. After that they re-set the nets in the water to harvest fish again in the late afternoon.

After gathering the fish from the river, Math S. hurries to the market so that she can sell at a suitable price. If she has some fish left over, she will turn them into dried fish or fish paste. Because Math S.'s house is located along the river, it is affected by flooding and also needs repair. Math S. requested her second loan to buy supplies to repair the broken parts of her house.

loans.use: To buy supplies to repair the broken parts of her house

loans.name: Secondiano

texts.en:
Secondiano P. is from the village of Centro Napu, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He is 81 years old. Secondiano is widowed and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Secondiano owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting coconuts for sale. Secondiano has been engaged in his business for over 25 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Secondiano joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Secondiano has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to pay for services to increase crop yield. Secondiano is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used for the re-acquisition of pawned parcel of land. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Secondiano from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: for the re-acquisition of  pawned parcel of land

loans.name: Sav

texts.en:
Mrs. Sav B. is 26 years old and lives in Ta Daol Pir village in Kandal province. She is a mother of two children who are too young to go to school or work.
Sav B. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land for cultivating rice, from which she supports her family. Her husband, Mr. Khorn Kheng (pictured right), is a battery charger in the local village and also a fisherman. In the rice field, the family has some problems because the soil is infertile and they do not have sufficient money to support it. Therefore, in order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Sav B. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and rice seed. With the rest of the loan, she would like to hire laborers to plow the rice field, and also buy fishing nets.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seed

loans.name: Aduke

texts.en: Aduke is married with four children. She is a hardworking woman who is experienced in her business of selling drinks and sachet water. Her business gives her joy because she does not sell on credit – her customers pay cash when they come to purchase drinks. Aduke is longing to expand her business significantly, and is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more drinks to sell. Her husband is a building contractor and he also supports the home. Aduke sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 30 years old, married with two children: one is 3 years old and the other one is just 4 months old. Josephine was a farmer before thinking on how she could start up a business selling a variety of goods in a shop. Josephine lives in Nyamagabe, a region situated in the southern province of Rwanda. It is in this area that, since 2008, she has owned a shop and she is happy because since she started this business, her family situation changed positively. Her shop is open from 7 AM until 6 PM every day.

As the number of her customers keeps growing, Josephine needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company so that she can add more goods to her shop which hopefully will increase sales as well as profits. With the profits from this loan, Josephine hopes to do a lot in her life including taking care of her family as well as saving for their future. Josephine has a hope that if her business keeps growing, she will create many sources of income as well as creating more jobs for the people of her community.

loans.use: Additional foodstuffs including rice, cooking oil, beans, etc.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Mrs. Sim M., 43, is a good mother who has been blessed with four children, two of whom are married and the others of whom are single and in school. Sim M. makes a living by buying and selling used goods for a profit. She owns an old motorbike that she uses to transport used goods that she buys door-to-door in her community. Her husband was a civil servant officer, but has been retired for years. Sim M. has requested a loan which is her second loan processing. She will increase the financial capital of her used-good sales trade. She intends to use some of her loan to decorate her existing house.

loans.use: To increase the financial capital of her business

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 52 years old and married with four children. She sells foodstuffs and groceries at retail prices to her customers. She loves her business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. In the future, she hopes to own a world-class supermarket. Florence is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs and groceries to sell. Her husband is a pastor and he also supports the home. She is thankful to all Kiva lenders in anticipation of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and groceries to sell

loans.name: Meu's Group

texts.en:
This small, three-member group loan is made up of residents of Phnom Penh. Mrs. Meu P. has been selected as the group leader by the other members. Meu P. is 41 years old and earns a living by cultivating crops with her husband, Chom Mao, 43, who is also a carpenter skilled I. making furniture by hand. They currently earn an income of approximately $7 USD per day. The couple has six children, two of whom are married while the others are single. One of their daughters provides her income as a garment worker to feed the family. Meu P. will use her loan to buy more fertilizers to sustaI. her crops.
The other two members of the group are:
Siek I., age 53, who farms a rice crop. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for her crop.
Siek A., age 50, who is a local farmer. She is applying for a loan to buy more supplies for her farming business.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers to sustain her crops

loans.name: Aguenon

texts.fr: Née le 21 juillet 1972 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du BENIN, K. Aguenon Sourou vit depuis 9 ans à Enagnon, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du BENIN. Aguenon est divorcée et mère de 4 enfants dont seulement quelques uns sont scolarisés. Aguenon vit seule avec ses enfants. Aguenon assure seule les charges de ses enfants. Pour subvenir aux divers besoins de ses enfants, Aguenon exerce comme activité principale la vente de gâteaux et de bouillie. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du BENIN, que Aguenon effectue l’achat de ses produits. Aguenon vend ses produits à son domicile. Aguenon n’a fréquenté que le primaire mais exerce son activité depuis bientôt 10 ans. Aguenon est une cliente de ALIDé qui a déjà bénéficié de 3 crédits, crédits qui ont tous été bien remboursé. Aguenon désire épargner beaucoup plus pour acheter une parcelle mais ne dispose pas d’assez de moyens financier pour y arriver, c’est la raison pour laquelle Aguenon sollicite un quatrième crédit.
texts.en:
Born on July 21, 1972 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin, Ms. K. Aguenon Sourou has been living in Enagnon, a district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for nine years.  She is divorced and the mother of four children, of whom some are in school.  She lives by herself with her children. She alone ensure that their expenses are covered.  To provide for the various needs of her children, Aguenon's main business is in selling cakes and porridge.  Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, is where she purchases her supplies.  She sells her goods out of her home.  She attended school primary school only, yet she has been operating her business for nearly ten years.  Aguenon is an ALIDé client who has already benefited from three loans, which have all been repaid.  She would like to save more money in order to buy a plot of land but lacks enough funds to do so.  For this reason, she is requesting a fourth loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying corn, peanut oil, and wheat flour

loans.name: Funke

texts.en:
Funke is a businesswoman who loves her business. She sells undergarments at retail prices to her customers. In the future, she hopes to sell at wholesale prices to her customers. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more undergarments to sell. She says that, with her loan, she will no longer lose customers to her competitors.
Funke's husband is a businessman and he also supports the home. They have four children, the eldest of whom is 18 years old. Funke is happy because her children are excelling in their school work. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more undergarments to sell

loans.name: Folorunsho

texts.en:
Folorunsho lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 33 years old, married, and blessed with two children. Folorunsho is a trader who sells drinks, sachet water and ice blocks in small quantities to her customers. Her business is very lucrative, especially in the dry season. In the future, she hopes to have a mini depot for her drinks business.
