Folorunsho is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more drinks to sell. This will enable her to meet high customer demand. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Kry

texts.en:
Mrs. Kry S. is 30 years old and has been selling fresh fish in her busy local market for one year. She buys her fish in bulk from a wholesale supplier and from fishermen. She is married to Sue Fyei, 31, who works as a motorbike taxi driver. The couple have been married for many years and are blessed with two teenage children who attend school. Kry S. faces difficulty whenever she wants to travel anywhere because she doesn’t have a vehicle. She is therefore requesting a loan to buy a used motorcycle.
Kry S. was busy selling fish when the photo was taken, so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 46 years old, and she has 5 children with ages between 3 and 21. Marie lives in Nyamagabe, a region of the southern province of Rwanda. Marie has been working as a taxi driver for a long time in this province. Marie starts driving early in the morning and works until late in the evening every day.

Marie wants to create one more job for one of the people from her community. Her wish is to purchase a motorbike. Through using this motorbike, Marie hopes that the life situation of her employees will be improved and Marie' s daily revenue will increase. Through the profits she gains daily, Marie's goal is to keep helping the people from her community through purchasing some more motorbikes. With this purchase of motorbikes, Marie hopes that one day she will find herself financially stable and be able to help other people see how they too can also work for themselves.

loans.use: the purchase of a motorbike

loans.name: Silifat

texts.en:
Silifat is 47 years old, widowed, and has three children. She lost her husband some years ago, and works very hard to care and provide for her fatherless children. To make a living, Silifat sells motorcycle parts in Lagos State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for some years and is doing fine.
In the future, Silifat hopes to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 150,000 NGN to purchase more motorcycle parts to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more motorcycle parts to sell

loans.name: Tamaneh Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the Tamaneh Group. They are small-scale businesswomen from the township of Magburaka, in northern Sierra Leone. They have applied to Kiva partner, SMT, for the first time for a loan of 500,000 SLL each to enable them to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their standard of living.
M’Balu K. is the leader of this group. M’Balu is 45 years old and was born in Magburaka town. She is married with four children. For ten years now, M’Balu has been selling ready-to-wear clothes. With her share of the loan, she will buy more ready-to-wear-clothes to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy more ready-to-wear clothes to sell

loans.name: Brigitte

texts.en:
Brigitte is 45 years old, and she is married with 9 children who are aged between 4 and 18 years old. Brigitte and her family live in Nyamagabe, a region of the southern province of Rwanda. Here, Brigitte owns a business selling peas, and this is her third successful year in this business. Brigitte starts at 7 AM in the morning and works until 5 PM every day. Brigitte is really dedicated to this business because it helps her to feed her family.

After 3 years of experience in this business, Brigitte has a number of customers greater than the quantity of peas she can sell to them. To satisfy the needs of her customers, Brigitte wants to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, her hope is to satisfy the demand of her customers. If she can do that, of course the profits will increase. With those profits, one portion will be used in building a secure future for her family and another portion will be used for reinvestment into her business.

loans.use: A large quantity of peas for sale

loans.name: Chandima

texts.en: Chandima is a married woman living with her husband along with their only daughter in the Matara district of Sri Lanka. She is 28 years old, and runs a small fabrics printing business with her husband. Both of them are working together in this business. She wants to develop the business so that they can maintain their family and manage their daily expenses smoothly.

loans.use: Fabrics, colours, brushes, and new blocks for new designs

loans.name: Tayagba Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the Tayagba Group. They are small scale businesspeople in the township of Magburaka, in northern Sierra Leone, applying to SMT/Kiva Lenders for the first time for a loan of SLL 500,000 each to enable them to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living.

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs, Idrissa F., 27, was born in Magburaka, is married to a businesswoman and is the father of one child. Idrissa has been a motorbike driver for three years now, and with his share of this loan, along with savings, he will buy a new motorbike.

loans.use: Buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: R.h.k.

texts.en: D. is a 36 year old married woman living in the Matara district of Sri Lanka. She lives with her husband along with their 3 sons. Her husband has a small business as an electrician; whenever clients need his service, they call him. D. has a small grocery shop so both she and her husband can earn enough money for their family expenses. Now D. wants to improve her small grocery shop to be a self-sufficient business woman. She plans to have small electric materials shop for her husband in the future.

loans.use: Items for her shop such as rice, spices, cooking oil, and dry fish

loans.name: M.g.

texts.en: S. is a married woman living with her husband and two daughters in the Matara district of Sri Lanka. She is 47 years old. Her husband is a bus driver, and she runs her small tailoring business at home. She currently has just one sewing machine and provides tailoring services for her neighbours and relatives as they place orders with her.  She wants to develop her business and in the future hopes to buy more machines and create employment opportunities for other women as well.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other accessories for designing dresses

loans.name: P.

texts.en: G. is a 49 year old woman living with her husband and their 3 children.  They live in the Matara district of Sri Lanka on the southern coast of the island.  Her husband is a daily worker in a small hotel and she has a small grocery shop.  Their income is not enough to support their five-member family, so now she wants to increase her business with this loan.  She hopes to be self-sufficient and earn enough money to pay for her children's higher education and improve their livelihood in future.

loans.use: Grocery items such as rice, vegetables, cooking oils, spices, etc.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma A., a 53-year-old widow from Quisao, Tanay Rizal, is blessed to have two children, both of whom are of legal age and already college graduates. Emma is a member of the Quisao Center in Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) Rizal East Branch. A widow for almost ten years; she is a very strong-minded woman, working hard to better her life. Despite hardships brought about by poverty, Emma remains strong and dedicated in her pursuit to improve her family’s standard of living. Her aspiration to give her children a brighter future is what motivates her all day.

To make a good living, she has been buying and selling frozen foods for ten years. In 2000, she joined ASHI, a micro-finance institution and Kiva partner in the Philippines. During the course of her membership, she has been a good performer with regard to her attendance at center meetings, repayments, and business. She is now applying for her tenth loan, this time in the amount of 20,000 PHP to obtain additional stocks of frozen foods. She is positive that, with access to additional working capital through ASHI and Kiva, her dreams of building a comfortable house will be achieved.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of frozen foods

loans.name: Keep On Trying Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the Keep on Trying Group, who are small-scale businesspeople in the township of Magburaka, in northern Sierra Leone. They are applying to SMT/Kiva lenders for the first time for a loan of SLL 500,000 each to enable them to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living.

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Fatmata K., 39, born in the village of Yele, some few miles from Magburaka. Married to a motor mechanic and the mother of five children, Fatmata has been a businesswoman for 10 years now. She sells local food items including rice, palm-oil, tomatoes, cassavas, etc. With her share of this loan, she will expand her business by purchasing additional food items.

loans.use: Buy rice, palm-oil, tomatoes, cassavas, etc. to add to her business

loans.name: W.

texts.en: R. is a 44 year old woman. She is married and living with her husband; they do not have any children. She is currently running a mushroom business, in which she grows mushrooms that she sells to the market and her nearest neighbours. Her husband has a small retail business selling electric bulbs, and he also helps her to sell the mushrooms at the market. She wants to increase her business as her husband’s income alone isn't enough for the two of them.

loans.use: Inputs for growing mushrooms and plastic packaging

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.en:
Cerefina A. is a resident of Quisao, Tanay, Rizal. She is 68 years old and single. As she is reaching an older age, she is working hard on her own. She is grateful that they have an ASHI group in their village that offers her happiness and so she never feels alone in achieving her goals in life.

Currently, Ceferina is busy with her small business of buying and selling RTW (Ready To Wear) clothes just to earn the means to live every day. When she received a small amount of capital from ASHI, she managed to put it all into her business. For her, business is an important factor and she does not want to be a problem for her group mates or for the center.

She applied for a new loan amount of PHP 20,000.00 to have additional working capital for her RTW business. Specifically the loan funds will be used to buy more stock like pairs of sandals, slippers, and accessories (for all ages).

Ceferina is a very good member of ASHI. She performs well in her business; when she has enough capital, she adds more business in order to gain more income. She hopes to share this with her sister, Paulita, who is a 55 year old maid. 

She hopes that through her loans from ASHI, in partnership with KIVA, that someday she will be able to save money for her future use because she is getting older now.

loans.use: Buy more stock like pairs of sandals, slippers and accessories.

loans.name: P.g.

texts.en: A. is 32 years old, and married with 3 children living with her husband.  They live in the Matara district of Sri Lanka, on the southern coast of the island.  Her husband runs a small masonry business, which she wants to help him improve with this loan.  They hope to earn enough money for their children's education and to take good care of the family.

loans.use: Building construction materials such as stone, tiles, brick and cement

loans.name: Cheikhou Omar

texts.fr:
Monsieur T. sociétaire à la caisse de liberté 6 est  commerçant de profession dans le domaine de l'informatique et bureautique il vend des produits de papeterie un cyber café Internet copieur noir et blanc fax envoie et réception il  a une expérience dans ce domaine qu'il exerce depuis plusieurs années
il sollicite un prêt de 500 000 F C FA pour acheter du matériel informatique et augmenter son fond de roulement
texts.en:
Mr. T., a member of the Liberté 6 branch office. He is a merchant by profession in the domain of computers and office supplies and equipment. He offers stationary supplies, an internet café, a black and white copier, and the sending and receiving of faxes. He has experience in this business, which he has been operating for several years. He's requesting a loan of 500,000 francs CFA to buy computer equipment and supplies and to increase his working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buyiing computer and office supplies and equipment

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a widow with 6 children. She is 48 years old. Her youngest child is 6 years old and they excel in their jobs and at school. She is a restaurateur with over 20 years experience; she majors in cooked foods like pepper soup and drinks. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

She is humbly seeking a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more drinks and soup spices to cook more pepper soup to sell. She has a good relationship with LAPO. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and soup spices to cook more pepper soup to sell

loans.name: B.g.

texts.en: C. is a 21 year old married woman living with her husband and one daughter. Her husband has a small masonry business which she helps him with to support the family. She wants to take a loan and improve their business so that in future with the income from the business they can provide higher education for their daughter.  Ultimately they want to earn enough money to live a decent life.  With the loan she plans to buy brick, sand, stone, and other materials that help the daily operations of the masonry business.

loans.use: Brick, sands, stone etc.

loans.name: P.g.

texts.en: N. is a 43 year old woman living in a village in the Matara district of Sri Lanka, located on the southern coast of the island. She lives with her husband and three children. She is a house wife and helps her husband in his small masonry business. Currently, the business is too small to earn enough income for their family of 5, so she is seeking a loan to help her husband develop this small venture.  She will use the loan to buy brick, sand, and other materials to help them expand.

loans.use: Brick, sand and other building construction materials

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita U. is a woman of many dreams and the heroism to fight challenges in order to achieve her dreams. She is 57 years old and married to George, 50, who is a fisherman.  She is a loving mother of an only child, King, who is 15 years old and a high school student. She lives in the town of Tanay, Rizal Province, in the Philippines. 

In 1996, she joined ASHI (Ahon SA Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, with an opportunity of having startup capital for generating income. During her previous loans from ASHI, she carefully invested it in planting vegetables and a hog raising business. Both businesses gave her a reasonable income, but it was lost due to a storm last September 2009.

Now on her third loan, she requests 15,000 PHP for the recovery of her planting business and to also start hog fattening. Specifically, the amount will be use for both businesses. This loan will help her business, which was destroyed by huge typhoons ”Ondoy” and “Santi”. 

As a mother, Nenita dreams of sending her son to school and on to completing college degrees and finding jobs for a better life. She also enjoys that the loan from ASHI will change their lives and accommodate her family's needs. Through the support of ASHI, a Kiva partner, she hopes to continue reaching for her dreams.

loans.use: For the recovery of her planting business and to start hog fattening.

loans.name: Lamine

texts.fr: ce jeune homme vendeur de produit cosmétique est membre à la caisse de liberté 6 depuis 2007 il habite juste a coté de la caisse il achète des produits comme les parfum le lait de toilette actuellement a son troisième prêt il sollicite un montant de 500 000 F CFA pour acheter des produits cosmétique et augmenter son fond de roulement
texts.en:
Lamine C. is a young man who sells cosmetics. He has been a member of the village bank "Liberté 6" (Freedom 6) since 2007 and lives right next to it. He trades in cosmetics, such as perfume and body milk. This is his third loan. It amounts to 500,000 CFA francs and he will use it to buy cosmetics and increase his working capital.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell cosmetics

loans.name: Kanda Sellers Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the Kanda Sellers Group. They are small scale businesswomen in the township of Magburaka, in northern Sierra Leone. They have applied to SMT/Kiva Lenders for the first time for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each to enable them to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living.

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Marie S.. The 29-year-old Marie S. was born in Magburaka town. She is married to a teacher and they have three children. Marie has been a businesswoman for 10 years now. She sells cow skins (Kanda). With her share of the loan, she will expand her business by buying more cow skins (kanda) to sell.

loans.use: Buy dozens of cow skins to sell

loans.name: Believe In God Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the Believe In God Group. They are small-scale businesswomen in the township of Magburaka, in northern Sierra Leone. They have applied to SMT/Kiva Lenders for the first time for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each to enable them to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living.

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Memunatu I. K.. The 28-year-old Memunatu was born in Magburaka town. Memunatu is single. She has been a businesswoman for five years now. She sells clothes. With her share of the loan, she will expand her business by buying bales of clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy bales of clothes

loans.name: Bear Bozzu Ii Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the Bear Bozzu II Group. They are small-scale businesswomen in the township of Magburaka, in northern Sierra Leone. They have applied to SMT/Kiva Lenders for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each to enable them to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living.

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Aminata S.. The 40-year-old Aminata was born in Magburaka town. Aminata is married to a businessman and they have four children. Aminata has been a businesswoman for 15 years now. She sells locally produced items like rice, palm oil, fish, cassavas, potatoes and any other goods she can lay her hands on. With her share of the loan, she will expand her business by buying rice, palm oil, fish, cassavas, potatoes etc.

loans.use: Buy rice, palm oil, fish, cassavas, potatoes etc

loans.name: John

texts.en: John does photography in Nairobi.  He has been running this business for the past thirteen years.  He is 45 years old, married with three children in school.  He also has a tailoring shop which his wife runs.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to pay school fees for his children.  He requested a loan of Kes. 30,000 to buy a sewing machine and to increase their stock of fabric.  He hopes to buy a piece of land and develop it in the future.  He dreams of having his own studio and a residential house.  He describes himself as focused, hard-working and God-fearing.

loans.use: Buy sewing machine and increase stock of fabric

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina sells baby things like sleeping nets, baby cots, toys, and clothes. She has been in this business for 7 years. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes for the loan amount of NGN 120,000 to purchase more baby things to sell. She is happily married with 4 children. Her youngest child is 3 years old. Her husband is a businessman and he also supports the household.

Tina hopes to grow her business. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more baby things to sell

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is 38 years old, single, and he lives in Nyamagabe, a region of the southern province of Rwanda. Here, Innocent owns a business selling bread produced from his bakery. This is his fifth successful year in this business. His business is open from 7 AM to 5 PM every day.

Innocent has a target of increasing the sale of bread in his business so that he can satisfy the demand of his customers. To reach this goal, he would like to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, Innocent will purchase a large quantity of raw materials, including flour and sugar, etc. With this additional quantity of bread, Innocent hopes that the number of his customers will increase as well as the profits.

Innocent has a goal of expanding his business through creating many sources of income selling the same products. With this method, he will also try to sell at the lowest price so that a higher percentage of the people can be able to buy at least one loaf of bread.

loans.use: Additional quantity of flour for producing more bread

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is friendly and a hard-working woman. She sells electrical materials to make a living in Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells for long hours to make her business sustainable. She hopes to expand her business in the future by adding the sale of electronics. She hopes for the loan amount of NGN 160,000 to purchase more electrical materials to sell. She is 45 years old and married with 5 children. Her children are still dependent on her and they attend school. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purcchase more electrical materials to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 53 years old and she is the mother of 7 children. She is a hard-working woman and she is also experienced in her business. She sells planks at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to sell planks at wholesale prices to her customers in the future. She hopes for the loan amount of NGN 120,000 to purchase more planks to sell. She sells for long hours to enable her to assist her husband in meeting the basic needs of her family. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Pablo Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Pablo es profesional el cual trabaja para Ceprodel como asesor legal en Esteli y Condega.
Pablo va usar el crédito para la compra de repuesto para su camioneta ( llantas y diferencial) 
El espera que con las llanta y el diferencial nuevo le ayude mucho ya que necesita reparar su camioneta ya que es su herramienta de trabajo.
Pablo es acompañado y no tiene hijo, Este es su segundo crédito con Ceprodel Pablo dice que con los crédito anteriores le ayudado mucho a solventar deudas personales.
texts.en:
Pablo is a professional who works with Ceprodel as a legal adviser in Esteli and Condega. Pablo is going to use the loan to pay for repairs to his bus (tires and axle). He hopes that the new tires and axle will help him a lot. He needs to repair his bus because it is his tool for work. Pablo is seeing someone but has no children. This is his second loan with Ceprodel. Pablo says that the previous loans allowed him to resolve a lot of personal debt.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paying for repairs for bus

loans.name: Divine

texts.en: Divine is a tailor and she makes lovely Nigerian and Western designs for her customers. She also sells clothes. With these businesses she hopes to meet the basic needs of her family. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes for the loan amount of NGN 120,000 to purchase more clothes and tailoring materials. She is married with 5 children and her husband is a businessman who also supports the household. She hopes to own a big fashionable home in the future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and tailoring materials

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary sells foodstuffs to make a living in Lagos State, Nigeria. She loves this business because it helps to meet the basic needs of her family members. She is 38 years old and married with 7 children. Her husband is a businessman and he also supports the home.

Mary hopes for the loan amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She is a LAPO client. Lift Above Poverty Organisation (LAPO) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. Mary says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 44 years old. He and his wife Agnes M. have 4 children who attend school.  He has operated a motorcycle transport business in the town of Naivasha since 1987.  He now wants to try his hand at poultry farming.  He hopes to sell the poultry to established hotels in town.

Geoffrey was introduced to KADET by a friend who knew he was seeking financing for this new venture. He finished the set training and applied for this loan, which will be his first with the organization.  His dream is to grow his poultry farming business and become one of the major distributors of poultry meat in Naivasha.

loans.use: to establish a poultry business as a secondary-income business

loans.name: Okari

texts.en: Okari is 29 years old, married, and blessed with two children who attend school.  He operates a retail shop where he sells cosmetics.  He also earns extra income from his temporary rental houses.  Okari has learned how to manage his money and business through his field partner, Faulu Kenya.  He hopes to strengthen his business, and for this reason he has requested 50,000 KES to add items such as lotions, face cream and nail polish to his stock.  Okari dreams of being financially stable, owning more business premises and having more sources of income.  He describes himself as hardworking, understanding and honest.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics such lotion, face cream and nail polish

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Perfil del Cliente 	El señor Luis Alberto V. es trabajador de Universidad FAREM Esteli desempeñándose como conductor.
Luis va usar el crédito para compra de medicamento ya que tiene a su madre en mal estado de salud y también para pagar una deuda personal.
El quiere con el medicamento se  pueda recuperar el estado de salud de su madre y poder cancelar su deuda y solo quedar con la del crédito.
Luis es casado y tiene dos hijo a su cargo y ambos en edad escolar este es su segundo crédito con Ceprodel el cual le han permitido hacer algunas mejora en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto V. works with the University FAREM Esteli as a driver. Luis is going to use the loan to buy medicine for his mother who is in poor health. He will also use it to pay for his personal debt. He wants to have the medicine so his mother's health can improve and to be able to cancel his debt and only have to pay off this loan. Luis is married and has two school-age children. This is his second loan with Ceprodel, which has allowed him to make small improvements in his home.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying medicine and paying back a loan

loans.name: Sliveny

texts.en:
Sliveny sells spices to earn a living. Spices in Nigeria are used in the preparation of delicious Nigerian soup such as egusi soup (melon soup). The demand for her soup spices is high. She is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more spices to sell. 

Sliveny is married to a commercial driver and they are blessed with 5 children. Her youngest child is 6 years old. Her children are still dependent on her and they attend school. She hopes to lift her business and family above poverty. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more spices to sell

loans.name: Las Flores 4 Group

texts.en:
Maria, 44, is a borrower who lives in Los Alcarrizos, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Las Flores (Flowers), and her story is representative of those in her group and other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Esperanza International.

Maria is a single mother, and she and her children live in Los Alcarrizos on the outskirts of Santo Domingo, the capital of the Dominican Republic. Urban areas of the Dominican Republic are highly overcrowded and can be rough, with no potable running water, frequent power outages (if one has power to begin with), and inadequate healthcare. Despite these difficulties, Maria runs a successful beauty salon. With this loan, she plans to purchase more beauty products, as well as clothing and shoes to sell to her customers when they visit her salon.

This is Maria’s fifth loan with Esperanza International, and she hopes to continue taking out loans to grow her business and improve her home life for her family. Her loans have been a huge benefit, and she hopes to continue “growing as a person and helping her family towards the future.” Maria has high hopes for the future, and her business loans are helping her reach her goals.

Esperanza International seeks to free children and their families through initiatives that generate income, education and health, restoring self-worth and dignity to those who have lost hope. We have over 8,500 active associates in eleven offices in the Dominican Republic and Haiti. Thank you for lending to Maria and Las Flores group!

loans.use: to purchase beauty care products, clothing & shoes

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith makes lovely Nigerian designs for her customers. She also sells clothes to make a living. Edith loves her tailoring skills and she is happy that they are making a living for her. She hopes to own a fashion house in the future. She is requesting a loan of NGN 160,000 to purchase more clothes and tailoring materials. 

Edith is 32 years old and married with 8 children. Her youngest child is 4 years old. Her children are still dependent on her and they attend school. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and tailoring materials

loans.name: Fuerza Divina 5 Group

texts.en:
Virginia is the coordinator of her group Fuerza Divina (Divine Force), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Hato Mayor, an agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure as a single mother with her two children.

Virginia is excited to be taking out her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her ambulatory business selling underwear, which she does by travelling to the main market in Santo Domingo where she buys her goods in bulk and then returns to her community to sell them at a profit. She will use the profits to invest in the education of her children by purchasing school supplies as well as paying for their transportation costs. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija G. is married and has two children. She lives in Mombasa, in an area known as Mikoroshoni. Khadija runs a grocery store in the area and her business has been in existence for two years. She serves clients from the Mikoroshoni area. Khadija supplements her income by selling home-made juice in the area and has been able to get regular customers for it.

Khadija is taking out her first loan from KADET and plans to buy vegetables and potatoes to add more stock to her greengrocer business. She also intends to do minor renovations on her store.

In the future Khadija hopes to relocate her business to a busier centre, preferably near the central business district of Mombasa.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and potatoes, and also to do renovations on her store.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy M. is the 39-year-old married mother of two children. She lives with her family in Mikoroshoni, Mombasa where she sells secondhand clothes. Mercy's secondhand clothes business has been in operation for five years and has been doing well.

Mercy joined KADET recently and is taking out her first loan. She intends to purchase two bales of secondhand clothes for reselling. Her main customers are the area residents of Mikoroshoni.

In the future Mercy hopes to open a secondhand store in a more urban area to be able to serve more customers.

loans.use: To purchase two bales of secondhand clothes to resell.

loans.name: María Tomasa

texts.es:
La señora María Tomasa es trabajadora de Ceprodel desempeñándose como cajera en Esteli.
María va usar el crédito para la compra de útiles escolares tales como cuadernos, lapicero, mochila y ropa escolar
Quiere con los útiles escolares su hijo puedan ingresar al nuevo año lectivo, ella espera que con la compra de esto útiles sus hijo se sientan motivado y puedan ir a la escuela.
María es soltera y tiene tres hijo a su cargo pero solo dos conviven con ella todos en edad escolar.
Este es su cuarto crédito con Ceprodel y ha trabajado con 4 años con esta financiera.
María expreso que con los crédito que le ha otorgado Ceprodel le han ayudado mucho a cancelar deuda y que sus hijo puedan estudiar..
texts.en:
María Tomasa works with Ceprodel as a cashier in Esteli. Maria will use the loan to buy school supplies like notebooks, a pencil case, a backpack, and school clothes. She wants her children to be able to begin the new school year with these school supplies. She hopes that with the purchase of these new supplies her children will feel motivated and will be able to go to school. Maria is a single mother with three children in her care, though only two are school-age and still live with her. She has worked four years with Ceprodel, and this is her fourth loan with them. Maria says that the loans Ceprodel has given her have helped her cancel a lot of her debt and helped her children study.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying school supplies like notebooks, a pencil case, a backpack, and school clothes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu L. is the 37-year-old single mother of two children. She lives in the Majaoni area of Mombasa. Saumu does retail sales of charcoal and firewood in an area called Mkoroshoni and has been in the business for the last two years. It has been a paying business for her.

Saumu was introduced to KADET by an existing client and she is glad to begin her first loan. With the money, she intends to purchase firewood stock and also to purchase charcoal for reselling. She mainly serves the households in the Mkoroshoni area.

She hopes to start selling supplies in bulk to retailers in the area and the surrounding community.

loans.use: To purchase firewood stock for charcoal production.

loans.name: Fumilayo

texts.en: Fumilayo is 52 years old and married, with four children. Her children are excelling in their school and jobs. Her husband is a businessman and also supports the home. She sells planks at retail and wholesale prices to her customers. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more planks to sell. She is very hard-working and is looking forward to making use of this loan effectively. She has a good relationship with LAPO. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Limota

texts.en: To earn a living in her town in Nigeria, Limota sells planks at retail prices to her customers, who are usually friends and neighbors. In the future, she hopes to expand her business to cover a wider territory. For now, she has applied for a loan for NGN 140,000 to buy more planks to sell. She loves her business because it is highly profitable. Limoita is 45 years old, married and has five children. She extends her sincerest thanks to all Kiva lenders for making this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more wood planks to sell to her customers

loans.name: Roca Fuerte Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal Roca Fuerte es una asociación que desea un crédito para su primer ciclo, en el centro focal de Villa Exaltación. Los negocios de las socias son diferentes, desde artesanías, confección de faldas, confección de chamarras, venta de zapatos deportivos, muebles, abarrotes, venta de comida, costura de buzos y mantas. 

Una de las socias màs antiguas es la señora Mery M., con 9 ciclos en la asociación, su negocio es la confección de chamarras.  Los materiales son comprados por mayor en la ceja de la Ciudad de El Alto.  Las chamarras son elaboradas en el mismo domicilio, su esposo es un apoyo. Las ventas son realizadas en su mismo hogar, pues sus clientes vienen a recoger la mercadería al mismo.  Le gusta las reuniones de pago en el centro focal pues es un momento de esparcimiento y le permite descansar.
texts.en:
The community association Roca Fuerte ("Strong Rock") wants a loan for their first cycle in the focal center of Villa Exaltación. The women's businesses are all different, from artisanry, making skirts and jackets, selling sports shoes, furniture, groceries, food sales, and sewing sweaters and blankets. One of the oldest businesswomen is Mrs. Mery M.. She has gone through nine loan cycles with the association with her business making jackets. The materials are born in bulk in the city of El Alto. Mery makes the jackets in her home with her husband's support. She sells the jackets from her own home, so the customers come and retrieve the merchandise themselves. Mery likes meetings in the center because it is a leisure activity that allows her to relax.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fabric, zippers, thread and snaps

loans.name: Omolara

texts.en: Omolara is a member of the Yoruba tribe and lives with her family in Nigeria. She is a hard worker, and we see this in her business, where she sells both sarongs and groceries. She works long hours to meet the basic needs of her family, and has applied for a loan for NGN 100,000 to buy more sarongs and groceries to sell. Omolara is 42 years old, married and has four children, all of whom are still in school and depend on her for support. She has a good relationship with LAPO, and has asked that we extend her sincerest thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more sarongs and groceries to sell to her customers

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señorita Juana vive casa de sus padres en la zona Bajo Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz; es profesora de matemáticas.

El crédito que solicita es para someterse a una operación de vesícula, por medio de Kiva la apoyamos dándole un crédito en el área de salud; esta operación a la que se someterá le dará mayor comodidad física y despreocupación por su salud.

Es el cuarto crédito en IMPRO y tiene un historial impecable.
texts.en:
Juana lives in her parents' house in the Bajo Llojeta zone in La Paz. She is a math teacher. The loan Juana is soliciting will be used to undergo an operation for her gallbladder. Through Kiva we are giving her a credit related to health. The operation she is undergoing will allow her greater physical comfort and set her mind at rest with regards to her help. This is her fourth loan with IMPRO, and she has an impeccable history.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cost of a gallbladder operation to improve her health

loans.name: La Superacion 5 Group

texts.en:
Eufrecia, 36, lives in Samana, Dominican Republic with her husband and two children. She leads a loan group called La Superacion (Overcoming), and her story is typical of those told by the people in this group as well as of other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Esperanza International.

Samana is a small city in the northeastern region of the Dominican Republic. Life here can be rough, with no potable running water, frequent power outages (assuming one has power to begin with) and inadequate health care. Despite these difficulties, Eufrecia runs a successful business selling interior decorations to her friends and neighbors. She has applied for this loan to buy fabric, thread, lace and trim in order to make new products to sell.

This is Eufrecia’s second loan with Esperanza International, and she hopes to qualify for additional loans in the future so that she can continue to grow her business and improve life for her family. She has high hopes and believes that by worK. hard, she will one day finish construction of her home, buy a small car and get a computer for her children. She also hopes to have many employees and take out loans of greater and greater sizes. Eufrecia has lofty dreams, and with your loan she will be well on her way to achieving them.

Esperanza International seeks to free children and their families through initiatives that generate income, education and health, restoring self-worth and dignity to those who have lost hope. We have over 8,500 active associates in eleven offices in the Dominican Republic and Haiti. Thank you for lending to Eufrecia and La Superacion group!

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, trim and lace she can use to make products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Janet

texts.es:
La señora Janet vive casa propia en la zona Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz; ella es empleada de una empresa productora de hielo.

Janet solicita el crédito para hacer arreglar un vehiculo que quiere poner en funcionamiento como transporte público; por medio de Kiva apoyamos a esta familia porque estamos seguros que este apoyo hará que tenga mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.

Es el primer crédito en IMPRO y el análisis socio-económico la califica para otorgarle un préstamo.
texts.en:
Janet lives in her own house in the zone of Alto San Pedro in La Paz. She is an employee at a company that makes ice. Janet is asking for a loan so that she can fix up a vehicle to use as a taxi. Through Kiva we can support this family because we are sure that this support will help her achieve better revenues and a better quality of life. This is her first loan with IMPRO, and an analysis of her socioeconomic analysis qualified her for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cost of fixing a car to work as a taxi

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 50 years old, married and has four children. She makes a living by running a grinding machine that processes foodstuffs for her customers. The demand for her services is currently too high for her to meet, and she would like to expand her business to help satisfy all of her customers. To make this possible, she has applied for a loan for NGN 150,000 to buy an additional grinding machine and a generator. She hopes to expand her business in the future, and is pleased to be able to say that her children are excelling in their various fields of endeavor. She extends her sincerest thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy a grinding machine and a generator

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna is 41 years old, married and has three children. She makes a living selling drinks to both wholesale and retail customers in her community in Lagos. She sells her goods from a stall, and has applied for a loan for NGN 100,000 to buy more crates of drinks to sell. In the future, her goal is to be a major distributor of beverages. Her children are doing well in school and she is determined to give them a high-quality education. Her husband is a pastor, and also helps support their family and their home. Lorna extends her sincerest thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell

loans.name: Sofía

texts.es:
Sofía tiene 47 años de edad, es casada, y vive junto a su esposo y a su hijo en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica al transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi que adquirió hace un año. Ella nos comenta que la inicativa de este negocio nació debido a la necesidad de apoyar a la economía de su familia, ya que lo que su esposo percibe como trabjador agrícola no es suficiente para solventar los gastos familiares.

El servicio lo brinda en el area urbana de su distrito y en los anexos del lugar. La unidad movil es manejada por un chofer y eventualmente por su hijo. Debido al execesivo uso y a que los caminos que conectan Cayaltí con sus anexos son bastante accidentados, la mototaxi ha empezado a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación, por lo que Sofía se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su mayor anhelo es brindarle a su hijo una educación de calidad que le asegure un futuro exitoso. Ella es una mujer honrada, trabajadora y que siempre ayuda a los que la necesitan.
texts.en:
Sofía is 47 years old, married, and lives together with her husband and son in the district of Cayaltí, located one hour outside the city of Chiclayo. She works transporting cargo and passengers in the mototaxi she acquired a year ago. She tells us that the initiative to start this business was born out of the need to support her family, since her husband's job as an agricultural worker does not seem to be enough to support their household costs. The services Sofía offers are in her district's urban area and outskirts. Her only mototaxi is driven by a driver and eventually her son. Due to excessive use and the fact that the roadways that connect Cayaltí with its outskirts are fairly accident-prone, the mototaxi has began to suffer some damage that requires urgent repair. This is why Sofía is asking for her first loan through Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 nuevos soles. Her biggest dream is to give her child a quality education that assures him a successful future. She is a very respectable hard-working woman who is always helping those who need it.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repair and maintenance

loans.name: Apolinar

texts.es:
El señor Apolinar vive casa de sus suegros en la zona Alto Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz; Apolinar es zapatero y su esposa es lavandera de ropa. Su familia es una de las familias mas pobres que forma parte de Impro y el crédito que solicita es para comprar útiles escolares a sus 5 hijos y también para apoyarse económicamente en su pequeño negocio, por medio de Kiva y a través de Impro apoyamos a esta familia con un micro crédito que generará mejores ingresos y una mejor oportunidad y calidad de vida.

Es el primer crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en:
Apolinar lives in his parents-in-law's home in the Alto Tacagua zone of the city of La Paz. Apolinar is a cobbler and his wife is a launderer. His family is one of the poorest member families of Impro. The loan he is asking for is to buy school supplies for his 5 children and also to support himself financially with his small business. Through Kiva and Impro we support this family with a microloan which will generate more income and a better opportunity and quality of life. This is his first loan with IMPRO.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase school supplies for his 5 children now that classes are starting in high school.

loans.name: Sotero

texts.es:
El señor Sotero vive casa propia en la zona Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz; es comerciante de relojes y ropa. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital de trabajo, para comprar más relojes y ropa y por medio de comercializar estos productos mejorar sus ingresos  ayudándole a mejorar la calidad de vida de el y su familia.

Es el primer crédito en IMPRO y su flujo de ingresos le permite ser sujeto de crédito.
texts.en:
Sotero lives in his own home in the Tacagua zone in the city of La Paz. He sells watches and clothes. The loan he is asking for is to increase his working capital to purchase more watches and clothes. By selling these products he will improve his income, helping him to improve his and his family's quality of life. This is the first loan with IMPRO and his income flow allows him to access credit.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more watches and clothes to be sold in his business.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet has a unique business: she has a general store where she sells things ranging from toothbrushes to padlocks. She sells for long hours to enable her to make more profits to meet the basic needs of her family. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She is 40 years old and married, with four children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Gift

texts.en: Gift sells colorful sarongs at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. Her customers are usually women and young ladies. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 90,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. Gift is 36 years old and married, with two children. Her children are in school and this makes her happy. She hopes to give her children a solid and sound education. Her husband is a sailor and he also supports the home. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Cuver

texts.es:
El señor Cuver vive en casa de sus padres, en la zona de Villa Armonía, de la ciudad de La Paz; es casado y tiene un hijo. 
El señor Cuver trabaja como asistente de marketing en la empresa Nuevatel de la Ciudad de la Paz, los ingresos que recibe son para mantener a su familia, ya que su esposa no trabaja. 
El crédito solicitado es para la refacción de su cuarto y poder separar la cocina, ya se encuentra en la misma habitación donde tiene su dormitorio y comedor.
Esta es la tercera vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Cuver lives in his parent's house in the Villa Armonia area of the city of La Paz. He is married with a son. Cuver works as a marketing assistant at the Nuevatel company in La Paz. His salary goes toward maintaining his family since his wife does not work. The loan is needed to renovate his bedroom in order to separate it from the kitchen and dining room. This is Cuver's third loan. His favourable credit history means he is able to apply for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renovate a bedroom in order to separate it from the kitchen.

loans.name: Bernudis Yaneth

texts.es:
Bernudis Yaneth C. O. es una mujer luchadora de 40 años, tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 21, 18 y 11 años, vive en el barrio la Nueva Jerusalén  del Municipio de  Soledad-Atlántico donde se dedica al negocio de vender mercancía variada directamente y mediante guías especializadas, así como a la elaboración de comidas  los fines de semana y días festivos.  
Se iniciò como negociante porque fue ama de casa sin cónyuge y aunque antes había trabajado como empleada, decidió   hacerlo  por  su  propia cuenta, para poder educar de cerca a sus hijos y compartir mas tiempo con ellos;  Bernudis ha tenido varios negocios, en un principio   vendió  pollos congelados,  negocio al que agregó un restaurante que tuvo que cerrar  porque se incrementaron los costos fijos y la clientela se retiró por el aumento del precio de los almuerzos. Fue  en ese momento, hace 5 años, que decidió iniciar su negocio de alimentos en su casa del Barrio Nuevo Jerusalén, en la línea de hallacas, pasteles y pasa bocas, al èl se dedica los fines de semana y lo combina con la de venta de mercancía en general. Sus utilidades le ayudan al sostenimiento de su familia; ella dice que ser negociante ha cambiado su vida, le ha proporcionado además de ingresos independientes, autonomía y le ha permitido comprar activos fijos como cuando compró su congelador y la estantería para el restaurante. Ella ha recibido 4 créditos con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y es una clienta destacada en el pago puntual de sus cuotas;  en la actualidad aplica al quinto por valor de $2.000.000 para invertirlo en la compra de mercancías sobre pedidos, especialmente sabanas, calzado y cosméticos.
Su principal meta es apoyar el estudio de sus hijos y mas adelante con ellos ya capacitados montar una farmacia familiar, donde no tenga que ofrecer créditos, porque aunque ha aprendido a seleccionar a sus clientes, debe hacer mayor esfuerzo con las cuentas por cobrar. Su mayor desafío es conseguir concretar ese sueño de trabajar en familia en su farmacia, ella reconoce que en ese negocio no se empieza con poca plata por eso debe esforzarse y esperar un largo plazo
texts.en:
Bernudis Yaneth C. O. is a tenacious 40 year old woman. She has three children; 21, 18, and 11 years old. She lives in the Nueva Jerusalén neighborhood in the Soledad-Atlántico municipality. That is where she has her business of selling varied merchandise directly and through specialized guides. She also makes food on the week ends and for holidays. She started as a businesswoman because she was a housewife without a life partner. Even though she had worked previously as an employee, she decided to work on her own. She did this in order to be able to be close to her children while raising them and to share more time with them. Bernudis has had various businesses. In the beginning she sold frozen chicken, and she added a restaurant to this business. She had to close it because the fixed prices increased, and the customers stopped coming due to the increase in the price of the lunches. That was when, five years ago, she decided to start her food business in her house in the Nuevo Jerusalén neighborhood. She sells “hallacas” (cornmeal, meat, and vegetables wrapped in banana leaves), pastries, and appetizers on the week ends. She combines this with her general merchandise sales. Her profits help her support her family. She says that being a businesswoman has changed her life. In addition to giving her independent income, it has given her autonomy and allowed her to buy assets. She bought a freezer and shelving for her restaurant. She has had four loans with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She is an outstanding client with her punctual payments. She is currently applying a fifth time for 2,000,000 COP to buy merchandise on order; especially sheets, footwear, and cosmetics. Her main goal is to support the education of her children. Later, when the children have been prepared, she will start a family pharmacy where she will not have to offer credit. Even though she has learned to select her customers, she must make a greater effort with charged accounts. Her biggest challenge is making this dream of working in a family pharmacy a reality. She realizes that you cannot start this business with little money. Therefore, she needs to work hard and wait a long time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise on order; especially sheets, footwear, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en: Violet sells bags of rice and cooking oil. She would like to expand her business, and is hoping for a loan of NGN 160,000 to purchase more bags of rice and cooking oil to sell. She hopes to lift her business above poverty. Her husband is a technician and they have four children. Her husband also supports the home. Her four children attend school and she hopes they will graduate in the future. Her youngest child is three years old. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of rice and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motor pump

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio tiene 60 años de edad, es separado y vive en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se gana la vida realizando reparaciones y mantenimiento de artefactos eléctricos y electrónicos. Posee un taller en su vivienda donde trabaja todos los días, la calidad y responsablidad con la que realiza su trabajo ha hecho que su negocio sea conocido y que siempre tenga clientes que lleguen a solicitar sus servicios.

La continua demanda por su negocio ha hecho que tenga que viajar continuamente a la ciudad de Chiclayo para adquirir repuestos, lo que supone un gasto excesivo para su economía. Por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de circuitos integrados, condensadores, parlantes y otros repuestos con los que pueda tener un sotck permanente en su negocio.

Julio es una persona bastante honrada y que gusta mucho de lo que hace. Sus vecinos y clientes lo estiman mucho.
texts.en:
Julio is 60 years old, separated and lives in the district of Cayalti, located an hour from the city of Chiclayo. He repairs and maintains electrical appliances for a living. Julio owns a workshop in his home from where he works on a daily basis. The quality of his work and his sense of responsibility mean he is highly regarded and sought after. The continual demand for his services means that he has to travel regularly to Chiclayo to procure spare parts, something which creates considerable financial strain. Therefore, Julio has felt compelled for the first time to request a loan of 1000 Peruvian Soles from Edpyme Alternativa. The money is to go towards the purchase of circuits, condensers, speakers and other spare parts in order to ensure a permanent stock of supplies. Julio is a very honest person who loves his job. Both his neighbours and clients value him highly.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to increase his business supplies.

loans.name: Nuevo Renacer 1, 3, & 4 Group

texts.en:
Maria, 37, is a borrower who lives in Samana, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Nuevo Renacer (Rebirth), and her story is representative of those in her group and other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Esperanza International.

Maria is a single mother who lives with her two children in Samana, a small city in the northeastern region of the Dominican Republic. Life in the Dominican Republic can be rough, with no potable running water, frequent power outages (if one has power to begin with), and inadequate healthcare. Despite these difficulties, Maria runs a successful business selling home products to her friends and neighbors. With this loan, Maria will purchase sheet sets to sell to her friends and neighbors for a small profit.

This is Maria’s eighth loan with Esperanza International, and she hopes to continue taking out loans to grow her business and improve her home life for her family. With her profits, Maria hopes to purchase a small van in order to make her business more mobile. This will add to her profits, which will allow her to improve life at home by finishing her bathroom and purchasing a computer for her children. Computers are difficult to afford, but are one of the best investments for a low-income household to make. It gives access to the world of information that those of us in the developed world take for granted while teaching children to use the invaluable tools of modern technology. In the long term, Maria hopes to have her own house one day, something of value she can pass on to her children.

Esperanza International seeks to free children and their families through initiatives that generate income, education and health, restoring self-worth and dignity to those who have lost hope. We have over 8,500 active associates in eleven offices in the Dominican Republic and Haiti. Thank you for lending to Maria and the Nuevo Renacer group!

loans.use: To buy sheet sets for resale.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Felix se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno y  la producción de leche la cual la comercializa  a Pil Andina, planta Industrializadora de leche.
 
Vive en la comunidad  de Chojasivi  de la Provincia Los Andes del departamento de La Paz ubicado  a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz.

También trabaja como profesor en el área rural, su esposa  aparte de colaborar el cuidado del ganado,  se encarga de los quehaceres de su hogar y cuidado de sus hijos que son de 8, 6 y 4 años de edad.


El crédito lo destinará a la compra de  una vaca lechera y así incrementar  la producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Felix raises cattle that produce milk, which he sells to Pil Andina, an industrial milk plant. He lives in the community of Chojasivi, Los Andes Province, La Paz Department. He is located some 3 hours from the city of La Paz. He also works as a teacher in the rural area, and his wife, besides collaborating in the care of the cattle, takes charge of household matters and cares for their children, aged 8, 6, and 4 years old. With the loan he will buy another milk cow and thus increase milk production, and his earnings as well. This is his first credit with IMPRO. The evaluation that was carried out judges him qualified for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING A MILK COW TO INCREASE MILK PRODUCTION

loans.name: Tulio Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Tulio Alberto A. M. trabaja en la universidad católica agropecuaria del trópico seco (ucatse) como responsable de área en ganado bovino el cual se encarga de darle mantenimiento al ganado y mantener en orden todos los datos actuales que se dan sobre inventario y manejo del rebaño. El crédito se le otorgo para la compra útiles escolares de sus hijos y otros gastos personales como: compra de uniformes, zapato y  mochilas. 

Tulio tiene mas de 8 años de estar laborando para  la universidad y se desempeña bien en el trabajo él es originario de una comunidad del departamento de Estelí llamada el pino. Antes de trabajar para la universidad él se dedicaba a la agricultura ya que trabajo con sus papá por muchos años hasta que se dependisó. Este señor es casado y tiene tres hijos en edad escolar en el nivel de primaria y apoya mucho a que ellos realicen sus estudios y puedan llenarlo de orgullo algún día siendo esta una de las principales metas.

Tulio expresa que también ayuda a sus padres y que siempre estará con ellos. Este es el sexto crédito que se le otorga y a demostrado una buena capacidad de pago plantea que desea seguir trabajando con ceprodel por mucho mas tiempo ya que se le a ayudado a solucionar muchos problemas el cual esta muy agradecido
texts.en:
Tulio Alberto A. M. works in the Catholic Agricultural University of Trópico Seco (UCATSE). He is in charge of the livestock. He takes care of them, and he keeps all of the current data about inventory and management of the herd in order. The loan is to buy school supplies and cover other personal expenses for his children. He will buy things like uniforms, shoes, and backpacks. Tulio has been working for the university for over eight years, and he does a good job. He is from a community called El Pino, which is in the Estelí department. Before working for the university he was a farmer. He worked with his father for many years until he became independent. He is married and has three school-age children who are in primary school. He gives them lots of support so that they can go to school, and one day they will fill him with pride because that is one of his main goals. Tulio says that he also helps his parents, and he will always be with them. This is his sixth loan, and he has demonstrated good payment capacity. He wants to keep working with Ceprodel for a long time. Ceprodel has helped him solve many problems, and he is very grateful.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy school supplies and personal expenses for his children

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raul, vive en la zona Villa nuevo Potosi en la ciudad de La Paz.
 
El es separado, vive  en un pequeño departamento el la casa de su hija.
 
Se dedica al auto transporte, trabaja como chofer propietario de automóvil en una  de las líneas céntricas de la ciudad.
 
El crédito lo destinará a la compra de motor nuevo y realizar otras reparaciones a su movilidad, ya que por el modelo y tiempo de uso se encuentra en malas condiciones.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgar el crédito.
texts.en:
Raul lives in the Villa Nuevo Potosi area of the city of La Paz. He is separated and lives in a small room in his daughter’s house. He is a freelance driver for one of the city’s centrally located transportation companies. The loan will go towards the purchase of a new car engine and to make some repairs on his vehicle as long-term usage and an old make have meant it is in poor condition. This is Raul’s first loan with Impro. Successful credit analysis has meant he qualifies for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new car engine and make some repairs on his vehicle, which he uses for work as a driver.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es:
Marcelo, vive en la zona Villa Cooperativa, de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive en  su terreno propio, donde construye su casita  la cual adquirió con sus ahorros, junto a su esposa y su pequeño hijo de 1 año.
 
Trabaja como ingeniero civil en la alcaldía de la ciudad de La Paz.
 
El crédito lo destinará a la compra de materiales de construcción y así  acelerar la construcción que viene realizando,  ya que por esta época de lluvias  resulta un poco dificultoso su construcción.

Es el segundo  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgar el crédito.
texts.en:
Marcelo lives with his wife and baby son of one year old in the Villa Cooperativa area of the city of El Alto. He lives on his own land and is building his home, which he bought with his savings. He works as a Civil Engineer for La Paz city council. The loan will go towards buying construction materials and help speed up the house building process, especially since the rainy season means construction is all the more difficult. This is Marcelo’s second loan with Impro. His successful credit analysis means he qualifies for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to continue building his house.

loans.name: Maria Azucena

texts.es: La señora Maria Azucena tiene 36 años de edad, La señora Maria  se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace 4 años. Por lo que ella busca la forma de mejorar sus condiciones de vida para su familia. Su crédito será invertido en la compra de las frutas que sus clientes le solicitan, ya que tiene un sin número de clientes nuevos la atención que les brinda es la mejor pues siempre trata de salir adelante con su actividad. Ella sueña con instalar una distribuidora en el municipio en donde vive, ya que actualmente no hay ninguna.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Azuena is 36 years old. She has a fruit and vegetable business which she started four years ago because she was looking for a way to improve the condition of her family. The loan will be used to purchase the kinds fruits that her clients request. She has many new customers who say that the attention she gives them is the best, since she is always trying to move her business forward. She dreams of setting up a distribution business in her city since, as of now, there isn´t one.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits

loans.name: Franklin

texts.es:
Franklin A. R. es agricultor del Municipio de Telpaneca y se dedica a cultivar y cosechar café.

El Sr. Franklin R. solicita un crédito para el mantenimiento de su cultivo el cual es café, dicho mantenimiento consiste en  que las plantas de este cultivo sean abonadas y cultivadas así como el alporque de la tierra para que aumente considerablemente sus rendimientos.

El tiene aproximadamente 13 años de dedicarse a esta labor, el empezó con el objetivo de aumentar sus ingresos ya que el café es un cultivo que deja muy buenos ingresos principalmente cuando la laza esta buena.

La propiedad de el Sr Franklin R. esta ubicado en la parte alta del municipio de Telpaneca, es una zona húmeda apta para dicho cultivo, el lo asiste antes y después de la cosecha para que la planta mantenga su condición y por ende sus rendimientos, antes de dedicarse a este cultivo es se dedicaba a la cosecha de granos básicos.

El espera que con el crédito que se le otorgue asistir bien el plantillo de café y seguir aumentándolo con la siembre de nuevas plantas para en futuro obtener mayor rendimiento y ganancias.

Franklin es casado y tiene dos hijo y una niña y un barón ambos son menores y aun no están en edad estudiantil.

 Este es el crédito numero 7 que Franklin tiene en Ceprodel en un periodo de 6 años, dichos crédito le han ayudado a mejorar su fuente de ingreso el cual es un plantillo de café, el se muestra muy alegre por que los crédito le han impactado positivamente y le han mejorado en gran manera su condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Franklin A. R. is a farmer in the Telpaneca municipality. He grows and harvests coffee. Franklin R. is asking for a loan for the maintenance of his coffee crops. This maintenance consists of fertilizing the plants and cultivating them in order to considerably increase their yield. He has been doing this work for approximately 13 years. He started with the objective of increasing his income. Coffee is a crop that brings good income, especially when the harvest is good. Franklin R.’s property is located in the high part of the Telpaneca municipality. It is a humid area, which is suitable for this crop. He cares for it before and after the harvest so that the plant stays in good condition for a good yield. Before he grew this crop he grew and harvested basic grains. With this credit he hopes to take good care of his coffee plants. He will continue increasing his crops by planting new plants so that he can get greater yield and more income in the future. Franklin is married and has two children; a daughter and a son. Both are young and are not yet school-age. This is the seventh loan that Franklin has had in a period of six years with Ceprodel. These loans have helped him improve his source of income, planting coffee. He is very happy because the loans have positively impacted him, and they have help him greatly improve his living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy leaf fertilizers and pay for the labor to maintain his coffee

loans.name: Auner Mauricio

texts.es:
El joven Auner Mauricio H. Z., originario del Municipio de Condega, el trabaja en una fabricas de puros en la elaboración de esto, aquí en este mismo municipio.

El crédito que solicita este joven es para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como cemento  madera. La mejora que hará en su hogar será afinar las paredes  y la elaboración de una puerta.

El empezó a trabajar en la fabricas en la elaboración de puros hace 5 años con la intensión de mejorar sus ingresos familiares, cabe señalar que s esposa también trabaja en dicha fabrica. El trabaja 5 días a la semana de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, antes de dedicarse a esta labor el Sr. Mauricio H. era estudiante de secundaria.

El espera que con la compra de dichos materiales termine una parte de lo que le hace falta para terminar su casa de habitación y así tener un hogar justo y mas presentable.

El Sr. Mauricio H. es casado y tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad el cual esta a su cargo.

Este es el crédito numero tres de el Sr. Mauricio H. tiene en Ceprodel en un periodo de 4 años.  El dice que con los créditos que le han otorgado en Ceprodel a podido realizar ampliaciones a su vivienda lo que le a dado un impacto en su vida ya que esta a punto e terminar su casa y por ende darle mejor condición de vida a su esposa e hijo
texts.en:
The young man Auner Mauricio H. Z., a resident from the Municipality of Condega, works in a cigar factory producing cigars in his own municipality. The loan he is seeking will be used for the purchase of construction materials like cement and wood. The improvement he will make on his home will be to improve the quality of the walls and build a door. He started working in cigar factories five years ago in order to improve his family's income. It is also work noting that his wife also works in the same factory. He works five days a week, from Monday to Friday, from 8 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon. Previous to this employment, Mr. Mauricio H. was a high school student. He hopes that with the purchase of these materials he will be able to finish a part of work remaining to finish his house and thus have a more sufficient and presentable home. Mr. Mauricio H. is married and has a 4-year-old son who is his dependent. This is the third loan Mr. Mauricio H. has taken with Ceprodel over the past four years. He says that with the loans he has received from Ceprodel, he has been able to expand his home, which has already changed his life, so now that he is about to finish his house, he will be able to provide a better quality of life to his wife and son.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cement and wood

loans.name: Jesus Divino Amor Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “JESUS DIVINO AMOR”, ellos están ubicados en la ciudad del Cusco, y se reúnen en el distrito de huanchac en el local de arariwa.

Nuestros socios se dedican al comercio minorista, entre los miembros de este banco tenemos a un socio que tiene su tienda de ti peos en computadoras e impresiones; otro socio tiene una empresa turística que estos meses por la inundación está preocupado ya que en toda la ciudad del Cusco bajó el turismo,; otra socia vende productos de belleza por catálogo; otra socia vende cerámica y ahora está muy preocupada no hay turistas; otra socia vende comida en el mercado de huanchac; otro socio es chofer, otras dos socias tiene tienda de abarrotes; otro socio trabaja en una panadería y nuestra socia la Sra. Antonieta P. A., tiene 44 años de edad y es natural de Sicuani en la provincia de Canchis, es separada ella estudió en un instituto superior la elaboración de tortas y repostería; Nuestra socia tiene 3 hijos y es madre soltera, ella es una mujer emprendedora y sola apoya a sus hijos en sus estudios, alimentación y otras necesidades, La socia tiene una tienda propia de venta de tortas en la calle belén, es un muy bonito local y le va tan bien que está abriendo una sucursal en la av. La cultura, sector altamente transitado. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para costear su nueva tienda. 

Nuestros socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
These clients belong to the communal bank “JESUS DIVINO AMOR” which is located in the city of Cusco and meets in the district of Huanchac in Arariwa's offices. These clients all have retail businesses. Among the members of this group, there is a client who has a store where he provides copying and printing services. Another member has a tourism business – he is worried that because of the past few months of floods, tourism has decreased throughout the city of Cusco. Another member sells beauty products by catalog. Another member sells pottery and is currently very worried about the lack of tourists. Another member sells food in the Huanchac market. Another member is a taxi driver; another two own general stores; another works in a bakery. Mrs. Antonieta P. A., who is 44 years old, is originally from Sicuani in the province of Canchis, and is separated. She studied cake and pastry baking in a professional institute. She has three children and is a single mother. She is a entrepreneurial woman and has independently been able to provide her children with their studies, food, and other needs. She has her own store on Belén Street where she sells cakes. It is a very pretty shop and it is so successful that she is opening another branch on La Cultura Avenue, a neighborhood that has gone through a great transition. Antonieta is seeking this loan to pay for her new store. All the members of this group appreciate this opportunity for a loan and promise to repay each of their loans in the agreed-on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mrs. Antonieta will open a new branch of her cake shop

loans.name: Juan De La Cruz

texts.es: Este empresario tiene 40 años, por lo que siempre se ha encargo de su actividad económica,  el tiene 1 hijos por el cual velar y proporcionarle lo necesario. El se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general y una pulpería, el siempre ha buscado la forma de salir adelante y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, el inicio este negocio con su compañera de vida que le ayudo a volver realidad su idea. Además Juan con el poco capital que obtuvo con su financiamiento anterior logro establecer una pequeña pulpería en su  vivienda ya que es un hombre que realiza sacrificios para obtener ingresos necesarios. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de productos de su pulpería.
texts.en:
This entrepreneur is forty years old and has been working his whole life. He has one son who depends on him for his necessities. He owns and runs a general store. He has always sought ways to prosper and improve his family's quality of life. He started this business with his life partner who helped him realize this life-long dream. Additionally, Juan used the small amount of capital he received from his previous loan to open a small general store out of his home. He is a man who makes sacrifices in order to gain his necessary income. This loan he his seeking is for working capital that will be used to buy goods for his general store.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital - inventory

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es: Rosa Emilia tiene 46 años, anteriormente había realizado financiamiento con Fundación León 2000 que han sido de muy buena ayuda. Ella se dedica a una pulpería y también a ofrecer el servicio de triciclos, por lo que ha logrado administrar muy bien su negocio ya que es por medio de esto que ha obtenido otro medio de ingresos para sustentar a su familia, pero continúa con su humilde actividad la pulpería. Ella está solicitando este financiamiento para capital de trabajo como es la compra de jugos, refrescos naturales, golosinas en general, pan, galletas, detergentes, jabón entre otros productos para el hogar. Su deseo es establecer una distribuidora que sea muy reconocida por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa Emilia is 46 years old and has previously received a loan from Fundación León 2000 which has been of great help to her. She owns and runs a general store and also rents tricycles. She was able to run her first business so well that she was able to start another to receive additional revenue to support her family while still running her first business.
