Actualmente continua con el mismo negocio es muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes que a diario acuden a su negocio a comprar, cuenta con todo lo necesario que el ama D. casa necesita.

Con este crédito D. S/ 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, galletas D. todos los sabores en cajas,  bebidas gasificadas D. diferentes tamaños y marcas, utensilios D. aseo para el hogar y D. higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Rosa, se siente una mujer realizada, con más ganas D. salir siempre adelante. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio, tanto a ella como a otras mujeres que lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank "María Auxiliadora," in the Tarapoto District, San Martín Province, San Martín Department. She is 71 years old, a widow, and mother of five children, all of whom are grown. She finished high school, but due to health reasons, could not continue her studies. Rosa, despite her age, would love to continue working. For the last eight years, she has been selling household goods out of her home. In a big and well equipped room, she meets her customers daily and displays her charisma and charm. With the first loan (PEN 300) that Kiva partner Manuela Ramos Movement gave her, she bought bags of sugar and rice, and milk. Today, she continues the same business, and her customers know and love her; they come to her store every day because she has everything a homemaker may need. With the new loan of PEN 1,000, she will buy bags of sugar and rice, boxes of cookies, soft drinks, house cleaning supplies, and personal hygiene products. Rosa feels fulfilled and wants to continue succeeding. She thanks Kiva partner Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her and other women who need it start their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying goods to stock her business

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
En Somotillo, municipio de Chinandega, el señor Emilio M. se dedica a la venta de ropa y mochilas vendidas por él mismo ambulantemente por las calles del municipio saliendo diario desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana con el fin de vender dichos productos para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Los productos los lleva en un saco y cuando va llegando a los lugares para mostrarlo los saca para su exhibición.
El crédito que está solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de ropa y de mochilas para continuar con sus ventas y así ganarse el pan de cada día dignamente en el municipio.
texts.en:
In Somotillo, in the municipality of Chinandega, Mr. Emilio M. sells clothes and backpacks door to door. Daily, he leaves home in the early morning in order to sell his products and bring home an income. He carries everything in a bag, and takes out one or two samples when he needs to. He will use the loan he is requesting to buy clothes and backpacks in order to continue selling them and making a living with dignity.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clothes and backpacks to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora   ROSA G. R. tiene 71 años, vive en el distrito DEL PROVENIR, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal UNIDAS PARA EL PROGRESO II. La socia presenta estudios  hasta 1ero de Primaria, pero refiere que luego empezó a aprender a escribir y leer con ayuda de sus familiares, es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo ya mayor e independiente. Rosa se dedica a la venta de anticuchos (comida al paso) en la esquina de su casa. Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles lo utilizó para la compra de 1 parrilla y bancos.
Con este crédito de 1,100.00  nuevos soles comprará insumos como: camote, mollejas, corazón (carne) al por mayor para preparar sus anticuchos. Ella sueña con  empezar a vender menú todos los días.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa González Rodríguez is 71 years old, lives in "Del Porvenir" District, Trujillo Province, Libertad Department in Peru. She belongs to the Communal Bank "Unidas para el Progreso II." She has a 1st grade education, but says she learned to read and write with the help of relatives. She is a single mother of one grown son. Rosa sells food in the corner of her home. With her first loan of PEN 300, she bought a grill and some benches. With this loan of PEN 1,100 she will buy beef and organ meats to prepare the food she sells. Her dream is to be able to sell food every day.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying organ meats to sell

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
Ysabel es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy que significa Siembra en quechua.
Ysabel es casada, tiene 60 años y 12 hijos, Ysabel viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región en donD. venD. ropa variada, y D. las ferias compra cereales, queso. Ysabel también tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general.
Ysabel necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. pantalones, sombreros y blusas.
Los sueños D. Ysabel son ampliar su tienda habilitando otro ambiente mas.
texts.en:
Ysabel is member of the Communal Bank "Tarpuy," which in Quechua means "Harvest." Ysabel is married, is 60 years old, and has 12 children. Ysabel travels to different markets around the region where she sells clothes and buys cereal and cheese. She also operates a store from her home where she sells groceries. Ysabel needs a loan of PEN 2,000, which she will use to buy pants, hats, and blouses. Ysabel dreams of making her store bigger by adding another room to it.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clothes to sell

loans.name: René Benito

texts.es:
El señor Rene C. se ha destacado por ser un caballero muy trabajador y con grandes deseos de superación personal ya que también ha velado por su humilde hogar que tiene en buen dirigir.
Está comprometido con el bienestar de sus tres hijos y para ello solicita un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como el cemento para construir en su vivienda y de esta manera brindarle a sus amados hijos las condiciones necesarias de vida y un techo digno donde habitar.
texts.en:
Mr. René C. is known for being a gentleman and a hardworking individual who has great aspirations to succeed personally; he has taken good care of his humble home. René is committed to the welfare of his three sons, which is why he requests a loan to buy construction materials to build his house and therefore provide a solid roof and good living conditions for his beloved children.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying construction materials

loans.name: Irma Hermelinda

texts.es:
La señora Irma es socia del Banco Comunal “San Pedro” desde hace 2 años, vive en el distrito de Acora, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 36 años de edad, es casada y tiene 01 hijo. Ella estudió hasta segundo de primaria, se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores.

Irma nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 1,800.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar ovejas cara negra.

Su sueño para el futuro es aumentar su ganado y tener mas capital.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad de las socias para cada reunión.
texts.en:
Irma has been a member of the Communal Bank "San Pedro" for two years. She lives in the Acora district, Puno department. She is 36 years old, is married, and has one son. She has a 2nd grade education and currently buys and sells small animals. Irma has told us that with the first loan of PEN 300 she received from Kiva partner Movimiento Manuela Ramos, she was able to increase her working capital. She is now requesting a loan of PEN 1,800 with which she will be able to buy Black Faced sheep. Irma's dream for the future is to increase the number of cattle she owns and to have more working capital. What she likes most about the Communal Bank is how timely all the members are when attending meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying Black Faced sheep

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy que significa Siembra en quechua.
Elizabeth es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo, Elizabeth vende especerías, productos que embolsa en pequeñas cantidades, sus ventas los realiza a las diferentes tiendas. Además Elizabeth junto a su esposo tiene un carro con el cual realiza transporte publico a la selva ayacuchana.
Elizabeth necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de canela, hongos, laurel.
Los sueños de Elizabeth son vender sus productos por mayor y comprar otro carro.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the Tarpuy Communal Bank, which means Harvest in Quechua. Elizabeth is 23, in a common law marriage, and has one child. Elizabeth sells spices. She bags these products in small amounts. She makes her sales in different stores. Also, Elizabeth and her husband have a car. It is used for public transportation to the Ayacuchana jungle. Elizabeth needs a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy cinnamon, mushrooms, and bay leaves. Elizabeth’s dreams are to sell her products wholesale and to buy another car.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cinnamon, mushrooms, and bay leaves

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
Georgina, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive el distrito de Manantay, región Ucayali, tiene 45 años, es madre de cuatro hijos, uno mayor de edad e independientes, ella se dedica a la venta de salchipollos (comida al paso), esta actividad la realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien trabaja en un grifo. Georgina forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Trabajadoras del Puerto”, desde hace dos años.
El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la compra de insumos para la preparación y posterior venta de salchipollos, ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1200 soles, que será invertido en la compra de insumos para su negocio. La meta de Georgina es agrandar su negocio de salchipollos para tener más clientes.
texts.en:
Georgiana is a hard working woman. She lives in the Manantay district in the Ucayali region. She is 45 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is an adult on his own. She sells chicken sausages (food on the go), from her home and has the full support of her husband, who himself works in a gas station. Georgiana has been a member of the " Mujeres Trabajadoras del Puerto" (Working Women of the Port) communal bank for the past two years. The first loan she received was for 300 PEN, which she used to invest in supplies for her manufacture and sale of sausages. This time she needs a loan for 1,200 PEN ($425), which she will invest in supplies for her business. Georgiana's goal is to grow her sausage business in order to be able to serve more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies for her business

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.es:
Gertrudes es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy que significa Siembra en quechua.
Gertrudes es casada, tiene 40 años y 5 hijos, Gertrudes vive en el Distrito de Pampa Cangallo en donde tiene una tienda de abarrotes, además compra quesos que vende en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Gertrudes necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Gertrudes son construir su casa en la ciudad de Ayacucho y comprar un carro para transportar sus productos.
texts.en:
Gertrudes is part of the Tarpuy communal bank. (Tarpuy means "To Seed" in Quechua.) Gertrudes is 40 years old, married, and has five children. She lives in the Pampa Cangalla district, where she has her grocery store, and where she buys cheeses to sell in Ayacucho. Gertrudes needs a 1,500 PEN ($525) loan to invest in rice and sugar. She hopes to one day be able to build a home in Ayacucho and buy a car to transport her goods.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice and sugar for resale

loans.name: Luis Felipe

texts.es:
Luis Felipe G. es un Sr. de 59 años de edad quien, labora como Vigilante en la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua.

 El tiene tres hijos a su cargo, y estos se  encuentran en  edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante dos años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido dos   crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL. El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc,  perlines, y mano de obra para el techo de su casa de habitación  por lo que anteriormente el techo de su casa se encontraba en mal estado y en invierno el agua se pasaba.
Luis dijo que gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por ceprodel su vivienda ha venido mejorando ahora es mas segura y mi familia vive en mejores condiciones que antes.
texts.en:
Luis Felipe is 59 years old and works as a security guard in the National University of Nicaragua. He is married and has three school-aged children. He has been working with CEPRODEL for the past two years and has used the money from two previous loans to improve his home. He requested this loan in order to buy building materials, such as zinc metal sheeting, and to pay for labor to install a new roof, as the old one was in bad shape and leaked during the winter. Luis says that he appreciates the loans he has received through CEPRODEL. He has been able to improve his home and his family is now more secure and lives under better conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replace the roof in his home

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
La Sra. Trinidad, pertenece al Banco Comunal “María Auxiliadora”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de  San Martin y  Departamento de San Martín. Es Viuda tiene 63 años y 04 hijos, todos independientes. La Socia presenta Secundaria Completa.

Trinidad, es una mujer perseverante y luchadora que siempre le gusto trabajar,  lleva 06 años dedicándose a la venta de dulces  como: Mazamorra de maíz morado, arroz con leche y flan, como vio que le genera buenos ingresos diarios, decidió implementarse más en el negocio, sus ventas los realiza en la tardes en las afueras de su casa a partir de las 3.00 Pm.
Con su primer crédito de 300 Nuevos Soles compró, maíz morado en kilos, azúcar y algunos utensilios que le sirvierón para iniciarse en el negocio, nos cuenta que le va  excelente  porque  tiene muy buena acogida por el rico sabor de sus dulces. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio.

Con este crédito de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará ingredientes para preparar sus dulces  como: Maíz morado, arroz y azúcar en kilos, manzanas y piñas, canela molida y otros ingredientes, para dar un rico sabor, en cuestión de utensilios comprará vasos y cucharitas de plástico.
 
Trinidad, se siente aun con muchas fuerzas de seguir trabajando. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a cumplir sus sueños anhelados, tanto a ella como a otras mujeres que quieren crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Trinidad belongs to the Communal Bank “María Auxiliadora”, District of Tarapoto, Province of San Martin and Departament of San Martín. She is a widow, 63 years old and has four children, all independent. She has a high school education. Trinidad is a woman who perserveres and fights and who has always liked to work. She has spent 6 years selling sweets such as: blue corn pudding, rice pudding and flan. Since she saw it was generating good daily income, she decided to dedicate herself more to the business. She sells in the afternoon outside of her house starting at 3:00. p.m. With her first loan of 300 Nuevos Soles she bought kilos of blue corn, sugar and some utensils which she used to start the business. She tells us that it is going excellently for her because she has a good clientele because of the delicious taste of her sweets. Presently, she continues with the same business. With this loan of S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, she will buy ingredients to prepare her sweets such as: blue corn, rice and kilos of sugar, apples and pineapples, ground cinnamon, and other ingredientes to give a good flavor. In regards to utensils, she will buy glasses and little plastic spoons. Trinidad still feels a lot of strength to continue working. She thanks the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping to acheive the dreams she has longed for, for her and for other women who want to grow and get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy ingredients for the preparation of her sweets.

loans.name: Eufemia Gregoria

texts.es: Eufemia Gregoria tiene 50 años, su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general y una pulpería. Ella es una persona muy responsable que lucha por salir adelante y además sus 3 hijos que trabajan de manera independiente le ayudan en lo que pueden. Este negocio lo inicio hace 12 años como un medio de vida para su familia, por lo que siempre busca la forma de generar ingresos a su hogar. Ella está solicitando este financiamiento para la compra una parte de calzados, ropa interior, cosméticos y la otra parte en su pequeña pulpería. Es una mujer muy luchadora y con muchos sueños como es que su negocio sea más grande.
texts.en:
Eufemia Gregoria is 50 years old. She sells general merchandise, and she has a mini-market. She is a very responsible person who fights to get ahead. Her three children who work independently help her when they can. She started this business 12 years ago as a way of providing for her family. She is always looking for a way to generate income for her household. She is requesting this loan to buy footwear, underwear, and cosmetics. She will use part of the money in her small mini-market. She is a very tenacious woman with lots of dreams. One of them is that her business becomes bigger.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La Sra. Victoria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “María Auxiliadora”,  Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin y Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera tiene 49 años y es madre de 04 hijas; todos independientes. Estudio Primaria Completa.

Su espíritu luchador que siempre le caracterizo y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes. Nos cuenta que lleva 08 años en este negocio, poco a poco fue ganando experiencia en este tipo de actividad y haciéndose muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes. Con su primer crédito de 300 Nuevos Soles compró, huevos en jabas, fideos en paquetes así empezó vendiendo y poco a poco fue surgiendo más.

Actualmente cuenta con clientela fija; amigos del barrio, moradores y vecinos que  a diario acuden a su tienda a comprar, donde allí encuentran todo lo necesario que el ama de casa necesita y es ella quien personalmente les atiende con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este crédito de S/ 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará avena en paquetes, té en diferentes sabores (manzanilla y anís), leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, utensilios de aseo para el hogar y de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Vicky como le dicen de cariño está contenta con su la actividad que realiza. Y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Victoria belongs to the María Auxiliadora Communal Bank in the Tarapoto district, San Martin province, San Martín department. She is 49, single, and has four daughters. All of them are independent. She has an elementary school education. The tenacious spirit, which has always characterized her, and the desire to get ahead using her own wherewithal have been useful in starting her own business selling groceries. She tells us that she has been in this business for eight years. Little by little she gained experience in this type of business. She has been making herself well known and liked among her customers. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bought crates of eggs and packages of noodles. That is how she started selling, and little by little sales increased. She currently has loyal customers; neighborhood friends, inhabitants of the area, and neighbors. They come to her store daily to shop, and they find everything a housewife needs. She personally waits on them with her characteristic charisma. With this loan for 1,500 PEN she will buy packages of oatmeal, different flavors of tea (chamomile and anise), milk, crates of different brands of canned fish, cleaning tools for the home, and personal hygiene products in order to keep giving her customers good service. Vicky, as she is affectionately called, is happy with the work she does. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to stock her store

loans.name: Yahira Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yahaira Dávila Rodríguez, Labora como Responsable de Cartera y Cobro en el Mercado Mayoreo de Managua. 
 Ella tiene dos hijos a  su cargo, y se  encuentran en  edad escolar, es casada, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante ocho años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido diez crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.
 El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de cables eléctricos,  para el cambio del sistema eléctrico, caja y mano de obra para su casa de habitación, ya que anteriormente estos cables se encuentran en mal estado.
Yahaira dijo que gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por ceprodel  a hora cuenta de seguridad y una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yahaira Dávila Rodríguez is in charge of accounts payable in Managua's Mayoreo market. She has two, school-age children under her care. She is married and has collaborated with CEPRODEL for 8 years, having received 10 loans during this time which she used for home improvements. The funds requested will be used to buy electrical wiring, breaker box, and labor costs to replace the electrical system in her home because the wires are in bad condition. Yahaira stated that thanks to Ceprodel's funding she has security and better living conditions for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For home improvements.

loans.name: Juntas Si Podemos Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Juntas si Podemos, inicia su segundo ciclo con 15 socias. 

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. comidas, abarrotes en general, ropa, bebidas, verduras, frutas y servicios D. transporte, renovadora D. calzados, salones D. belleza.

Como es el caso D. L. señora Aydee que es conviviente, tiene 39 años y 1 hijo, Aydee viaja a los diferentes pueblos en donD. venD. ropa variada y también pedidos que le hacen sus clientes. Aydee necesita un préstamo D. 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra pantalones, chompas y polos.

Mientras que Alicia es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 3 hijos, Alicia venD. ropa D. manera ambulatoria en los mercados D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho, además Alicia tiene un carro que realiza transporte publico. Alicia necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. blusas, chompas.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600soles, 750 soles, 1050 soles  haciendo un total D. 8,850 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en L. compra D. chompas, polos, blusas, arroz, azúcar, aceite, bebidas, verduras y frutas.

Los sueños D. las socias son levantar el segundo piso D. su casa, implementar su negocio en su casa, tener una tienda D. abarrotes por mayor y comprar un carro para transportar sus productos.
texts.en:
The Juntas Sí Podemos Communal Bank is starting its second cycle with 15 members. The members have different businesses like selling food, general groceries, clothing, drinks, vegetables, and fruits. Some proviD. transportation services, fix shoes, or have beauty salons. That is the case with Aydee. She is 39, in a common law marriage, and has one son. Aydee travels to different villages to sell various clothes and deliver her customers’ orders. Aydee needs a loan for 1,050 PEN to buy pants, sweaters, and shirts. Alicia is 30, in a common law marriage, and has three children. Alicia is a street vendor, and she sells clothes at the markets in the city of Ayacucho. Also, Alicia has a car, which is used for public transportation. Alicia needs a loan for 600 PEN to buy blouses and sweaters. The members need different amounts of loans like 300, 600, 750, and 1,050 PEN. The total amount of the loan for the communal bank is 8,850 PEN. Their loans will be used to buy sweaters, shirts, blouses, rice, sugar, oil, drinks, vegetables, and fruits. The members’ dreams are to raise a second floor on the house, start a business in the home, have a wholesale grocery store, and buy a car to transport their products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sweaters, shirts, blouses, rice, sugar, oil, drinks, vegetables, and fruits

loans.name: Cristhian David

texts.es:
El Señor Cristhian  A. García, Labora como Conductor A en la Universidad Nacional de Ingeniería.
 El tiene un  hijo a su cargo, y este  se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante dos año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido dos créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: arena, Cemento y mano de obra, para embaldosar el porche de su casa.
Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Cristhian A. García works as a driver at the National Engineering University. He has one school-age son under his care. He is married. He has worked with Ceprodel for two years. During this time he has used two loans improving his house. He did this thanks to the loans from Ceprodel. He is an excellent client. The requested loan is to buy construction materials like sand and cement and to pay for the labor to tile the porch on his house. His objective is to give his children greater security and better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: 220300399 Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Jose D. Viñaca, inicia su sexto ciclo con 26 socias. Las socias son D. la comunidad D. Viñaca.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. animales menores, tara, cochinilla, abarrotes en general, fabricación D. ladrillos y la mayor parte D. las socias se dedican a la agricultura D. verduras.

Como es el caso D. la señora Rosa que es casada, tiene 43 años y 3 hijos, Rosa se dedica a la agricultura D. verduras, Rosa necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. semillas y abono.

Mientras que Natalia es casada, tiene 45 años y 6 hijos, Natalia tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, Natalia necesita un préstamo D. 450 soles dinero que sera invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600soles, 750 soles, haciendo un total D. 13,650 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, semillas, abono, animales menores y para el pago D. peones.

Los sueños D. las socias son tener una buena producción, que sus hijos sean profesionales y comprar un carro para transportar sus productos.
texts.en:
The San Jose D. Viñaca Communal Bank starts its sixth cycle with 26 members. The members are from the Viñaca community. The members have different businesses like selling small animals; tara, a local tree used to make industrial products; cochinilla, an insect used to make red dye; and general groceries. Some make bricks, and most of the members devote themselves to growing vegetables. Rosa is 43, married, and has three children. Rosa grows vegetables. Rosa needs a loan for 600 PEN to buy seeds and fertilizer. Natalia is 45, married, and has six children. Natalie has a store in her house where she sells general groceries. Natalia needs a loan for 450 PEN to buy rice and sugar. The members need different amounts of loans. The amounts they need are 300, 450, 600, and 750 PEN. The total amount of the loan for the communal bank is 13,650 PEN. Their loans will be used to buy rice, sugar, seeds, fertilizer, small animals, and to pay workers. The members’ dreams are to have good production, that their children become professionals, and to buy a car to transport their products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, seeds, fertilizer, small animals, and to pay workers

loans.name: Allin Warmikuna Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Allin Warmikuna que significa Buenas Mujeres en quechua, inician su tercer ciclo con 21 socias. 

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. cereales, medicina natural, verduras, pan, joyas, ropa, comida, cosméticos, artículos D. ferretería y servicio D. transporte.

Como es el caso D. la señora Leila es casada, tiene 46 años y 4 hijos, Reynilda junto a su esposo tienen un recreo llamado Natali, el cual cuenta con una piscina, Reynilda también venD. golosinas y comida. Leila necesita un préstamo D. 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, carne y golosinas.

Mientras que Reynilda es casada, tiene 40 años y 2 hijos, Reynilda tiene una vidrieria en un local alquilado, además venD. artículos D. ferretería en las ferias D. la región, Reynilda necesita un préstamo D. 450 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. chapas.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600soles, 750 soles, 1000 soles  haciendo un total D. 13,200 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, carne, chapas, cereales, animales menores, verduras y cosméticos.

Los sueños D. las socias son ampliar sus negocios, sus hijos sean profesionales y tener casa propia.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Allin Warmikuna” (which means “Good Women” in Quecha) is starting its third loan cycle with 21 members. They are engaged in different businesses selling grain, natural medicines, vegetables, bread, jewelry, clothing, food, cosmetics, hardware, and transportation services.

Such is the case with Sra. Leila, who is 46 years old, married, and has four children. She and her husband operate a recreation center called “Natali” that has a swimming pool. Leila also sells sweets and prepared foods. She needs a loan of 900 soles in order to buy rice, meat, and candy.

Reynilda is 40 years old and has two children. She operates a glassware shop from a rented location and also sells hardware at the regional fairs. Reynilda needs a loan of 450 soles in order to buy metal sheeting.

The members need different loan amounts ranging from 300 soles, 600 soles, 750 soles, up to 1000 soles, for grand total of 13,200 soles to the entire Communal Bank. They will use the money to buy rice, sugar, meat, metal sheeting, grain, small animals, vegetables, and cosmetics. The members dream of expanding their businesses, helping their children become professionals, and acquiring their own homes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
El señor Lorenzo R. esta muy agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual pudo comprar la herramienta necesaria para su negocio.
Esta solicitando nuevamente un préstamo para terminar los cuartos que esta construyendo en la planta alta de la casa. Ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar el material, y así terminar las recamaras de sus hijos.
Planea pagar el crédito con las con las ganancias de su negocio que tiene de taller de herraría.
Desea que sus hijos tengan su propio espacio en la casa y vivan mejor.
texts.en:
Sr. Lorenzo R. is very grateful for the assistance provided through his previous loan, which was used to buy a necessary tool for his business.

He is requesting a new loan so that he can finish construction of the rooms on the second floor of his house. Lorenzo does not have the necessary money to buy the materials that will be used to finish the bedrooms for his children.

He plans to repay the loan with the profits from his metal works shop. Lorenzo wants his children to have their own space in the house so that they can live better.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish construction of the rooms on the second floor of his house

loans.name: Brillantes Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Brillantes, inicia su octavo ciclo con 19 socias. Las socias son de la comunidad de Mollepata.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta de abarrotes en general, cereales, leña, helados, comidas, cosméticos, artículos de ferretería.

Como es el caso de la señora Edith que es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Edith tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días, Edith necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.

Mientras que Delia es conviviente, tiene 38 años y 2 hijos, Delia se dedica a la compra y venta de leña en su casa y también reparte a los negocios, Delia necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña. 

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de prestamos como 300 soles, 600soles, 900 soles  haciendo un total de 14,350 soles de prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra de arroz, azúcar, leña, aceite, verduras, cereales, helados, cosméticos.

Los sueños de las socias son construir sus viviendas con material noble, ampliar sus negocios y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The Brillantes Communal Bank is starting its eighth loan cycle with 19 members who are from the community of Mollepata. They are involved in different businesses selling groceries, grain, firewood, ice cream, prepared food, cosmetics, and hardware.

Such is the case of Sra. Edith. She is 32 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children. Edith has a grocery store in her home that she manages every day. She needs a loan of 600 soles in order to buy rice and sugar.

Delia is 38 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children. She buys and sells firewood from her home and also delivers her product to businesses. Delia needs a loan of 900 soles in order to acquire more firewood.

The members need different loan amounts ranging from 300 soles, 600 soles, to 900 soles, with a grand total of 14,350 soles for the entire Communal Bank. Their loans will be used to buy products such as rice, sugar, firewood, oil, vegetables, grain, ice cream, and cosmetics. They dream of building homes of solid materials, expanding their businesses, and helping their children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Maria Luisa P., esta muy agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual pudo, comprar los uniformes y útiles escolares para que sus hijos pudieran seguir estudiando.
Nuevamente está solicitando un préstamo para invertir en su negocio de venta de ropa usada ya que tiene muy poco inventario y desea surtir mercancía, como juguetes, zapatos, artículos de belleza, etc. 
En este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión, es por eso que está solicitando su cooperación para este crédito.
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias del negocio. Los gastos de la casa son cubiertos por su esposo, el señor Sotero De La Cruz, quien trabaja como guardia de seguridad en un hospital de la localidad.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Luisa P. is very grateful for the assistance provided from her previous loan, which was used to buy uniforms and school supplies so that her children could continue studying. She is requesting a new loan to invest in her business of selling used clothing. Maria Luisa has very little inventory and wants to offer a variety of merchandise such as toys, shoes, and beauty products. At the moment, she does not have the money to make this investment, so she is requesting your help through this loan. Maria Luisa plans to repay the loan with the profits of her business. The family expenses will be covered by the salary of her husband, Sr. Sotero de la Cruz, who works as a security guard at a hospital in the city of Nuevo Laredo.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Suli Merly

texts.es:
Suli tiene 27 años de edad, es madre soltera  vive en casa propia con sus 2 hijas. ella inicio en el negocio de venta de ropa hace 2 años el cual comenzó con ahorros 
obtenidos por los mas de 4 años trabajando como obrera de campo en los fundos de la 
ciudad. Suli poco a poco ha ido incrementado su negocio y su clientela a los cuales 
les brinda precios bajos y prendas de calidad. Siendo muchos de sus clientes 
compañeros de sus centros de trabajo. Suli tiene el anhelo de construir su vivienda la 
cual fue seriamente afectada por el terremoto del 2007, y aún así siguen viviendo en esas 
condiciones. Además Suli quiere brindarles a sus hijas la mejor educación y una buena 
calidad de vida,ella requiere el crédito para la comprar de mercadería.
texts.en:
Suli is a 27 year old single mother who lives in her own home with her two daughters. She started a clothing business two years ago using the savings she built up after working more than four years as a farm worker on a large estate in the city. Over time, she increased her business and gained more customers by providing them low prices and quality clothing. Many of her customers are co-workers from the places where she was previously employed.

Suli dreams of rebuilding her house since it was seriously damaged by the earthquake of 2007, yet she still lives in it with its current condition. She wants to provide her children with the best education and a good quality of life, so she is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Mrs. Em N. is 63 years old and lives in Kouk Roka village, Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who own a four-hectare field to cultivate rice. In this venture they face a problem because the field's soil is infertile. So Mrs. N. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to improve the crop. Mrs. N. is the mother of two children — one employed in a garment factory, and the other a farmer who helps with his parents' farm.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Mrs. Srey S. is 37 years old and lives in Cheav Bdei Khang Kaeut village, Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who own a two-hectare field to cultivate rice. In order to support the farm's crop in drying season, Mrs. Srey S. decided to ask for a loan from AMK to buy a water machine and dig a well to support her bsuiness. Mrs. Srey S. has three children who all are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy a water machine

loans.name: Prim

texts.en:
Mrs. Prim V. is 44 years old and lives in Cheav Bdei Khang Kaeut village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Tam Bun, are farmers who own a 2-hectare (5-acre) field on which they cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

In their farming, they lack financial resource to support their crops. In order to support them, Mrs. Prim V. decided to ask for 500,000 Riel from AMK to buy a water pump for irrigating their crops.

Aside from farming, Mrs. Prim V. raises pigs at home. The couple has four children, one of whom is selling spare parts for cars, two others are attending the local school, while the youngest one is too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy a water pump to irrigate her crops

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Mrs. Chan S. is 46 years old and lives in Cheav Bdei Khang Kaeut village, Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who own a three-hectare field to cultivate rice. In the dry season, they do not have enough water to support their crop so Mrs. Chan S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a water machine and dig a well. Aside from being a farmer, her husband, Mr. Leap Krich, (on the right in the photo) owns a cart to deliver goods which helps add to the family's income. Mrs. Chan S. has a child who is cow breeder.

loans.use: To buy a water machine and dig a well

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Soeun S. is 31 years old and lives in Ta Ou Khang Cheung village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Nat In, are farmers.

Although they try to work hard with their farm they still earn less income than needed to support their family, so they started a new business as rice middleman. In order to support the new business, Soeun S. decided to ask for a loan to purchase a cart. She will use the rest to buy more rice to support her new business.

Soeun S. is the mother of two children who are 2 and 8 years old. One of her children is currently in school.

loans.use: To purchase a cart and more rice for her business

loans.name: Khoeun

texts.en: Mrs. Khoeun K. is 40 years old and lives in Pongro village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 3-hectare field where she cultivates rice. She has a problem in that she does not have enough money to grow her crop during the current dry season. Mrs. Khoeun K. has, therefore, decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer. She will use the rest of the loan to buy pesticide, rice seed and gasoline. She is also a duck breeder and earns a small income selling eggs to help support her family. Mrs. Khoeun K. is a widow with two children. One of them is employed in a garment factory. The other one is a farmer who helps her on her farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide, rice seed and gasoline

loans.name: Sros

texts.en: Mrs. Sros S. is 30 years old and lives in Si Sla village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Bol Koch, are farmers who own a 1-hectare field where they cultivate rice. Mrs. Sros S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to assist during the dry farming season. Mr. Bol Koch also works as a laborer, driving a cultivator, in the local village. He makes a small income to support his family. Mr. Bol Koch has a child who is too young to study or work. Her husband and child are shown with her in the photo.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Bona

texts.en:
Mrs. Bona C. is 38 years old and lives in Sla village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare field where she cultivates rice. She also breeds pigs to earn money. She faces problems with her farm because the soil is infertile and there is not enough water to grow crops. She decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer and a water machine. The rest of the loan will be used to buy piglets and pig food for breeding. 

Her husband, Mr. Vorn Khev, is a policeman who earns a small salary. Mrs. Bona C. is the mother of four children. One is employed in the garment factory. The other three attend the local school and also help their mother with the farm. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, a water machine, piglets and pig food

loans.name: Nhor

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhor S. is 52 years old and lives in Angk Ta Phouk village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Kosal Chhom, are farmers who own a plot of land where they cultivate rice. Mr. Kosal Chhom is also a village chief and earns a small income to support his family. Mrs. Nhor S. owns an old motorcycle which her husband uses to get to work. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow five times from CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her broom-making business.

Now with your help, she would like to receive a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos. This money will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business to buy equipment and raw materials needed to continue production. Liliana dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can have a good and comfortable life with her family.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.name: Numanjanova Tursunoy`s Group

texts.en:
Tursunoy is 53 years old. She is married and has four sons. She also has four grandsons. Her husband is a taxi driver. She lives with her family in Aravan Village. Her family is involved in agriculture. They own land where they usually grow cotton and potatoes. Now, almost every member of her family is preparing for the spring planting. 

She will use this loan to buy potato seeds and mineral fertilizers. She also has some livestock. In the future she wants to increase the number of cattle she owns. So far, because of their business, they were able to raise children, build a house for their eldest son, and build a sheep yard. Her monthly income is about $200 USD. 

Zohrohon, age 51, is married. She is the most respected teacher in the local school. Her husband is a pensioner. His pension is about USD $70. She has 4 sons who work in the village, but because they don't earn much, in a few months, two of them are going to Russia to find better jobs. This loan will be used to buy potato seeds. Her family will plan them in their own land. 

Mukaddam is 41 years old. She is married with children. Her husband is in Kazakhstan, where he works as a builder. Her eldest son is disabled person and younger two are student. Mukaddam works a mailer in the local post office. Her family gets additional income from agriculture. They grow cotton, potatoes, and sunflowers. This loan will be used to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. 

Nigoroy, age 20 is not yet married. She lives with her parents. She is involved in agriculture and she is going to buy seeds with her loan. Her family also has some cattle, and they sell milk and milk products to the local population. Their total monthly income is about USD $300. 

This loan is the first one for all of the members of this group. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our lending team, Supporters of Kyrgyzstan, http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva fellows in Kyrgyzstan and the Mol Bulak staff.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.en:
Viviana M., 54, is making sure that her family has enough provision for their daily needs. Married to Asisclo M., a sales coordinator, they are blessed with three children. She helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own variety store for a few years now.

Viviana has been a regular member of the Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She has been consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to purchase more products to be incorporated into her inventory.     

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a loan of PHP 10,000. This will be used as additional capital for expanding her business by buying more products to be incorporated into her inventory.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can have enough money to expand her store into a grocery and thus make her dreams come true.


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more products to add to her inventory

loans.use: To purchase more bags of flour and other baking materials

loans.name: Rwobuziizi Group, Ibanda

texts.en:
Being cooperative and hardworking have enabled A. Lawrence to succeed. He is 35 years old and married with five children. He also takes care of five additional dependents.  

Lawrence has operated a retail shop in Rwobuziizi for thirteen years, and he also has a taxi that operates from the same area. He works hand-in-hand with his wife and family in managing both businesses, and this has enabled them to succeed. 

He hopes to expand his businesses further, especially the retail shop which still needs more stocking, since the shop's profits help to take care of the family's needs. Lawrence needs a loan to be able to expand his retail shop with additional goods.

loans.use: To restock his retail shop with more goods.

loans.name: Abiodun

texts.en:
Abiodun is a friendly woman. She sells loaves of bread by hawking them in her community. She hopes to own a bakery in the future. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more loaves of bread to sell. 

Abiodun is 36 years old and married with three children. Her children are excelling in their school work. Her husband is a building contractor and he also supports the family. She loves her business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more loaves of bread to sell

loans.name: Abdudjalil

texts.ru: Латипов Абдуджалил проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 58 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Двое сыновей занимаются торговлей. Сам Абдуджалил более 4 лет занимается продажей лекарств. Он имеет среднее Техническое образование по специональности "Фармацевт". Абдуджалил имеет собственную аптеку, где продает лекарства. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Abdudjalil L. lives in the city of Kulob. He is 58 years old, married and has 5 children. His wife is a homemaker. Two of their sons are involved in retail sales. Abdudjalil has been involved in selling medications for over 4 years. He has a secondary technical education as a pharmacist. Abdudjalil owns a pharmacy, where he sells medications. He is requesting this loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy goats
